original: gal te de lta na kho bo cag gi phyogs su lhung ba'i phyir grub pa la sgrub po /
analyzed: gal te de lta na kho bo cag gi phyogs su lhung ba'i phyir grub pa la sgrub po /
translated: If that is so, then it is a proof of what is already established, because it falls into our position.

original: sngar spobs pa'i sgo nas song bas de'i phyir yang zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sngar spobs pa'i sgo nas song bas de'i phyir yang zhes bshad do //
translated: Since it has already been refuted by the gateway of confidence, therefore it is said ‚Äúagain.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de ltar brda ma byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar brda ma byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, this reason, ‚Äúbecause it is not conventionally understood,‚Äù is not unestablished.

original: ma nges pa nyid dang 'gal ba nyid dag ni dang po nyid du brtsal zin to //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid dang 'gal ba nyid dag ni dang po nyid du brtsal zin to //
translated: And uncertainty and contradiction have already been sought out previously.

original: de lta bas na sgras ji skad du bshad pa'i sel ba byed do zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na sgras ji skad du bshad pa'i sel ba byed do zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Thus, it is established that a word expresses an exclusion as it is explained.

original: 'dir gzhan dag sel ba'i sgra thos pa las blo skrag ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag sel ba'i sgra thos pa las blo skrag ste /
translated: Here, others are frightened by the word ‚Äúexclusion‚Äù that they hear.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i sel ba'i ngo bo mi shes pas dam bca' ba grags pa la sogs pa dang 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i sel ba'i ngo bo mi shes pas dam bca' ba grags pa la sogs pa dang 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they do not understand the nature of the exclusion that is intended, in order to demonstrate that the thesis contradicts what is commonly acknowledged, and so on, it is said:

original: 'on te khyed kyi phyogs la sgras //
analyzed: 'on te khyed kyi phyogs la sgras //
translated: But is it not said that your position

original: gzhan sel byed bar brjod min nam //
analyzed: gzhan sel byed bar brjod min nam //
translated: is that a word expresses an exclusion of other?

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
translated: And so on, elaborating.

original: sgras gzhan sel byed pa zhes bya ba 'dir zhes bya ba'i sgra khong nas dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgras gzhan sel byed pa zhes bya ba 'dir zhes bya ba'i sgra khong nas dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthe word also excludes others‚Äù should be supplied from the previous verse.

original: sgras gzhan sel bar byed ces bya ba de ltar ji ltar brjod par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgras gzhan sel bar byed ces bya ba de ltar ji ltar brjod par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúhow can it be said that the word excludes others?‚Äù is ‚Äúhow can it be said that the word excludes others?‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir brjod par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir brjod par mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why can‚Äôt it be said?

original: snang ba 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: snang ba 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn this appearance . . . ‚Äù

original: gzhan sel ba ni dgag pa tsam nyid du 'dod par grags la /
analyzed: gzhan sel ba ni dgag pa tsam nyid du 'dod par grags la /
translated: Exclusion is known to be asserted as mere negation.

original: sgra las byung ba la snang ba 'di la dgag pa tsam du rtogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba la snang ba 'di la dgag pa tsam du rtogs pa ni med do //
translated: In this appearance, which is derived from words, there is no understanding of mere negation.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nges pa nyid kyis sgra las byung ba'i blo 'jug par dmigs la /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nges pa nyid kyis sgra las byung ba'i blo 'jug par dmigs la /
translated: It is observed that the cognition derived from words engages its object through the ascertainment of the nature of the entity.

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la mi snang ba gang yin pa de'i sgra'i don du rigs pa yang ma yin pa de ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la mi snang ba gang yin pa de'i sgra'i don du rigs pa yang ma yin pa de ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable that what does not appear to the cognition derived from words is the meaning of the word, because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: de'i phyir dam bca' ba grags pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dam bca' ba grags pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the thesis contradicts what is commonly recognized.

original: gal te ba lang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis shes chen gyi lugs kyis grags pa la sogs pa dang 'gal ba ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te ba lang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis shes chen gyi lugs kyis grags pa la sogs pa dang 'gal ba ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: The three verses beginning with ‚ÄúIf the word ‚Äòcow‚Äô . . .‚Äù show that the system of the great scholar DignƒÅga is in contradiction with what is renowned in the world.

original: gal te ba lang gi sgra gzhan rnam par gcod pa ston par byed pa lhur len pa yin na de'i tshe de nyid la don byas pa'i phyir nog la sogs pa'i dngos po ba lang gi sgra las rtogs bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te ba lang gi sgra gzhan rnam par gcod pa ston par byed pa lhur len pa yin na de'i tshe de nyid la don byas pa'i phyir nog la sogs pa'i dngos po ba lang gi sgra las rtogs bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is the principal means of teaching the exclusion of other, then the things such as a dewlap are not understood from the word ‚Äúcow,‚Äù because its meaning has already been expressed.

original: de lta yin dang nog la sogs ba ldan pa'i dngos po'i yul la ba lang gi blo skyed par byed pa'i sgra gzhan brtsal bar bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang nog la sogs ba ldan pa'i dngos po'i yul la ba lang gi blo skyed par byed pa'i sgra gzhan brtsal bar bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, then one would have to seek another word that generates the cognition of a cow in regard to the thing that possesses a dewlap, and so on.

original: 'di snyam du ba lang gi sgra gcig nyid kyis blo @322b gnyis bskyed pa'i phyir sgra gzhan brtsal bar mi bya'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du ba lang gi sgra gcig nyid kyis blo @322b gnyis bskyed pa'i phyir sgra gzhan brtsal bar mi bya'o snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that because a single word ‚Äúcow‚Äù generates two cognitions, one should not seek another word, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says:

original: sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The word ‚Äúcow‚Äù does not generateüîΩthe cognition of a non-cow.

original: sgrub pa'i yul can dang dgag pa'i yul can gyi 'bras bu shes pa gnyis gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i yul can dang dgag pa'i yul can gyi 'bras bu shes pa gnyis gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those are called ‚Äúthe two results of the cognition of the object of affirmation and the object of negation.‚Äù

original: de la cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the point of that?

original: gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩsgra gcig la sgrub par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / sgra gcig la sgrub par byed pa'am /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn one,‚Äù and so on.

original: dgag par byed pa rnam bar shes pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'bras bu cig car ma yin te /
analyzed: dgag par byed pa rnam bar shes pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'bras bu cig car ma yin te /
translated: In one sound, the result of the cognition of affirmation or the cognition of negation is not simultaneous, because of the characteristic of the two consciousnesses.

original: mi dmigs ba zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs ba zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚Äú Non-observation‚Äù is the remainder.

original: dgag pa dang sgrub pa 'bras bu'i shes pa phan tshun 'gal bas rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa dang sgrub pa 'bras bu'i shes pa phan tshun 'gal bas rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that the result of negation and affirmation are mutually contradictory cognitions.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs bla lhag 'chad de /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs bla lhag 'chad de /
translated: He explains the superlative reason with ‚ÄúBy whom,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te ba lang gi sgras dngos su ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa ston par byed pa yin na de'i tshe ba lang gi sgra thos ma thag tu nyan pa pos ches thog mar ba lang ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di rtogs par 'gyur ro
analyzed: gal te ba lang gi sgras dngos su ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa ston par byed pa yin na de'i tshe ba lang gi sgra thos ma thag tu nyan pa pos ches thog mar ba lang ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di rtogs par 'gyur ro
translated: If the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù directly indicates the exclusion of non-cow, then when the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is heard, the hearer would first understand ‚Äúnon-cow.‚Äù

original: // sgra las bar mchod par shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de nyid sgra'i don du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: // sgra las bar mchod par shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de nyid sgra'i don du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: That which is understood as the middle, the meaning of the word, is posited as the meaning of the word.

original: bar du mchod par ba lang ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa'i blo skye ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bar du mchod par ba lang ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa'i blo skye ba yang ma yin no //
translated: The cognition that arises, excluding what is not a cow, is not the meaning of the word.

original: de'i phyir ba lang gi blo mi skye bar thal ba dang / ches dang por ba lang ma yin par rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan sel ba sgra'i don ma yin no zhe'o //üîΩgang gis ba lang mi ldog pa'i //
analyzed: de'i phyir ba lang gi blo mi skye bar thal ba dang / ches dang por ba lang ma yin par rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan sel ba sgra'i don ma yin no zhe'o // gang gis ba lang mi ldog pa'i //
translated: Therefore, because it would follow that the cognition of cow would not arise, and because it would follow that one would first understand what is not a cow, the exclusion of other is not the meaning of the word.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhon nu ma len gyi lugs kyi dam bca' ba'i skyon ston pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhon nu ma len gyi lugs kyi dam bca' ba'i skyon ston pa yin te /
translated: Because of such statements as by which a cow is not excluded, the fault of the thesis in the system of Kumarila is shown.

original: de ni 'di skad du smras te /üîΩgzhan sel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi brjod par bya ba nyid du brjod par bya ba na res 'ga' ma yin par dgag pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du smras te / gzhan sel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi brjod par bya ba nyid du brjod par bya ba na res 'ga' ma yin par dgag pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: This is what he says:üîΩWhen the universal characterized by the exclusion of other is said to be the object of expression, is it sometimes said to be characterized by negation by exclusion,

original: med par dgag pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pa yin grang /
analyzed: med par dgag pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pa yin grang /
translated: or is it said to be characterized by negation by non-existence?

original: de la phyogs dang po dam bcas pa grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon yin te /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po dam bcas pa grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon yin te /
translated: The first position is a fault of the proof of the established proposition.

original: 'di ltar ba lang nyid du brjod pa'i spyi ba lang gi sgra'i brjod bya nyid du 'dod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ba lang nyid du brjod pa'i spyi ba lang gi sgra'i brjod bya nyid du 'dod la /
translated: Thus, you assert that the universal of cowness, which is called ‚Äúcow,‚Äù is the object expressed by the word cow.

original: khyed cag kyang ba lang ma yin pa ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi ba lang gi sgras brjod do zhes smra ba na de nyid sgra gzhan gyis brjod pa'i phyir ming rtsod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: khyed cag kyang ba lang ma yin pa ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi ba lang gi sgras brjod do zhes smra ba na de nyid sgra gzhan gyis brjod pa'i phyir ming rtsod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: But when you say that the word cow expresses the universal that is the definition of the opposite of non-cow, then it is merely a dispute over names because it is expressed by another word.

original: yang ji ltar de nyid sgra gzhan gyis brjod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar de nyid sgra gzhan gyis brjod pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it expressed by another word?

original: 'di ltar dngos med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said that nonentity and so on.

original: 'di ltar de gang gi phyir snga na med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa rnam pa bzhi po thams cad ni dngos po gzhan gyi @323a * //üîΩbdag nyid du rnam par gnas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de gang gi phyir snga na med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa rnam pa bzhi po thams cad ni dngos po gzhan gyi @323a * // bdag nyid du rnam par gnas te /
translated: Thus all four types of nonentity, which are characterized by prior nonexistence and so on, exist as the nature of another entity.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: zho sogs 'o ma la med gang //
analyzed: zho sogs 'o ma la med gang //
translated: What does not exist in milk, such as yogurt,

original: de ni snga na med par brjod //
analyzed: de ni snga na med par brjod //
translated: is said to be prior nonexistence.

original: zho la 'o ma med pa nyid //
analyzed: zho la 'o ma med pa nyid //
translated: The absence of milk in curd

original: zhig nas med pa'i mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: zhig nas med pa'i mtshan nyid yin //
translated: is the characteristic of the destruction of milk.

original: rta sogs ba lang la med gang //
analyzed: rta sogs ba lang la med gang //
translated: The absence of horses, etc. in cows

original: gcig la gcig med par brjod de //
analyzed: gcig la gcig med par brjod de //
translated: is said to be the absence of one in another.üîΩThe absence of the head, etc. in the limbs,

original: mgo yi yan lag dma' ba dang // ri bong rva sogs ngo bo yis //
analyzed: mgo yi yan lag dma' ba dang // ri bong rva sogs ngo bo yis //
translated: and the absence of the horns of a rabbit, etc.üîΩare the absence of an entity by way of

original: 'phel dang mkhrang ba spangs pa ste //üîΩgtan nas med par brjod pa yin //
analyzed: 'phel dang mkhrang ba spangs pa ste // gtan nas med par brjod pa yin //
translated: increase and hardness.

original: tha dad de dag dngos med par //
analyzed: tha dad de dag dngos med par //
translated: The absence of difference in those is

original: mi 'gyur nges 'di dngos po nyid //
analyzed: mi 'gyur nges 'di dngos po nyid //
translated: not non-entity; it is definitely an entity.

original: ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: 'di ni 'o ma la sogs pa zho la sogs pa'i ngo bor med pa ni snga na med pa la sogs par bstan pa'i rten yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'o ma la sogs pa zho la sogs pa'i ngo bor med pa ni snga na med pa la sogs par bstan pa'i rten yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the basis of the teaching of the non-existence of milk, etc. in curd, etc. as prior non-existence, etc.

original: ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa yang gcig la gcig med pa yin te /
analyzed: ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa yang gcig la gcig med pa yin te /
translated: The exclusion of non-cow is also the absence of one in another,

original: de ni rtags la sogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtags la sogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the nature of the exclusion of the sign, etc.

original: de lta bas na de'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i dngos po yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is an entity.

original: de la de ltar dngos po med pa ni dngos po gzhan gyi bdag nyid yin par gnas pa na /
analyzed: de la de ltar dngos po med pa ni dngos po gzhan gyi bdag nyid yin par gnas pa na /
translated: In that case, since the non-existence of that thing is the nature of another thing,üîΩtell us what you assert this ‚Äúnature of a thing that is the opposite of horse, etc.‚Äù to be!

original: khyed cag gi rta la sogs pa las ldog pa rang bzhin gyi dngos po zhes pa 'di ci zhig la 'dod pa smros shig /'di snyam du 'dir ci zhig smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: khyed cag gi rta la sogs pa las ldog pa rang bzhin gyi dngos po zhes pa 'di ci zhig la 'dod pa smros shig /'di snyam du 'dir ci zhig smra bar bya ste /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúWhat is there to say here?

original: 'di ni ba lang la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: 'di ni ba lang la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: We assert that this is the nature of the individual characteristics of cow, etc.,‚Äù

original: re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then BhƒÅviveka says, ‚ÄúIf that is so . . .‚Äù

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de ni khyed cag gis rtag la sogs pa las ldog pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de ni khyed cag gis rtag la sogs pa las ldog pa'i bdag nyid du mi 'dod do //
translated: You do not assert that the uncommon attributes are the nature of the opposite of horse, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa / rtog pa med phyir te /
analyzed: bshad pa / rtog pa med phyir te /
translated: The explanation is ‚Äúbecause there is no conception.‚Äù

original: de la rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because all conceptions are abandoned.

original: spyi kho na rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul du 'dod la /
analyzed: spyi kho na rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul du 'dod la /
translated: You assert that only universals are the objects of conceptual consciousnesses.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i don ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i don ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: The uncommon meaning is not the domain of all conceptual thought.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dbang po'i spyod yul ngo bo ni //üîΩrig bya bstan du med pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul ngo bo ni // rig bya bstan du med pa'o //
translated: The nature of the domain of the senses

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //üîΩbye brag gi bdag nyid la rgyu ni thun mong min pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o // bye brag gi bdag nyid la rgyu ni thun mong min pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: is not to be indicated as an object of knowledge.üîΩThe uncommon nature is the cause of the specific nature.üîΩThe meaning is that it is the distinction by way of the uncommon nature.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyis khyad par gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde ltar bye brag med pa bshad nas /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyis khyad par gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to // de ltar bye brag med pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the general meaning,

original: da ni don de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa ni /
analyzed: da ni don de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa ni /
translated: now the specific meaning will be explained.

original: de bzhin du ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the same way‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar khyed cag thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par rta la sogs pa las ldog pa bdag nyid ba @323b lang gi sgra'i brjod byar mi 'dod pa de bzhin du khra bo la sogs pa khra bo la sogs pa'i sgra brjod par bya ba nyid du mi
analyzed: ji ltar khyed cag thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par rta la sogs pa las ldog pa bdag nyid ba @323b lang gi sgra'i brjod byar mi 'dod pa de bzhin du khra bo la sogs pa khra bo la sogs pa'i sgra brjod par bya ba nyid du mi
translated: Just as you do not assert that the uncommon distinction, the cow, is the object of the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù because it is the opposite of a horse and so on, in the same way, you should not assert that a cow that is multicolored and so on is the object of the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù because it is the opposite of a cow that is not multicolored and so on.

original: 'dod do // rta la sogs pa las ldog pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po zhes bya ba 'di la yang rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: 'dod do // rta la sogs pa las ldog pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po zhes bya ba 'di la yang rjes su 'jug go //
translated: And we also accept that the entity that is the opposite of horse, etc. is the universal.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: spyi ma yin par thal 'gyur phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: spyi ma yin par thal 'gyur phyir // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is not a universal.

original: gal te 'dod pa de'i tshe spyi'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa de'i tshe spyi'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that, then it is not the universal that is the referent of the term.

original: de ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang kho na'i phyir rta la sogs pa las ldog pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po thun mong ma yin pa mi 'thad pa de lta bas na kun la ste /
analyzed: de ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro // gang kho na'i phyir rta la sogs pa las ldog pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po thun mong ma yin pa mi 'thad pa de lta bas na kun la ste /
translated: Because it does not pervade.

original: rigs mthun pa'i khra bo la sogs pa'i gong bu la gang zhig re re la yongs su rdzogs pa'i ba lang gi blo ni de'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i khra bo la sogs pa'i gong bu la gang zhig re re la yongs su rdzogs pa'i ba lang gi blo ni de'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
translated: Since it is not tenable that the entity that is the opposite of horse, etc. is a unique universal, then in all variegated wholes that are of a similar type, the cognition of cow that is complete in each individual cow is based on that.

original: de yang ba lang nyid ces bya ba'i spyi nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang ba lang nyid ces bya ba'i spyi nyid yin no //
translated: And that is the universal called cow.

original: de la ba lang ma yin pa sel ba'i sgras brjod pa'i phyir ming 'ba' zhig gzhan yin pas de'i phyir dam bca' ba grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon yin no //
analyzed: de la ba lang ma yin pa sel ba'i sgras brjod pa'i phyir ming 'ba' zhig gzhan yin pas de'i phyir dam bca' ba grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon yin no //
translated: Since the name is only different because of the expression of the cow‚Äôs exclusion by the word, therefore, the fault of the proof is in the thesis.

original: ci ste med par dgag pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i phyogs de la /
analyzed: ci ste med par dgag pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i phyogs de la /
translated: If the position is that the definition is a non-affirming negation,

original: gal te dgag tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te dgag tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the response is, ‚ÄúIf it is a mere negation, etc.üîΩ‚Äù

original: med pa sgra'i brjod bya zhes bya ba na sgra ba lang ma yin pa sel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi med pa rjod par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: med pa sgra'i brjod bya zhes bya ba na sgra ba lang ma yin pa sel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi med pa rjod par byed pa yin la /
translated: Since the object of the word is said to be a non-existent, the word expresses the non-existent that is defined as the exclusion of non-cow.

original: sgra de'i brjod bya phyi rol gyi don gyis stong pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra de'i brjod bya phyi rol gyi don gyis stong pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The object of that word would be emptiness of external objects,

original: dngos po'i ngo bo la ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo la ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it teaches the nature of things.

original: gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa tsam //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa tsam //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mere consciousness of another‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni sngar rnam par shes pa tsam du sgra ba dgod pa'i dus su khyed cag gis bkod la kho bo cag gis kyang bsal zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngar rnam par shes pa tsam du sgra ba dgod pa'i dus su khyed cag gis bkod la kho bo cag gis kyang bsal zin to //
translated: was previously posited by you at the time of positing mere consciousness and was also refuted by us.

original: yang sgra'i don bsam pa'i skabs 'dir grags pas grub pa'i don bkag pa'i phyir de nyid gzhan sel ba'i thabs kyis bstan to //
analyzed: yang sgra'i don bsam pa'i skabs 'dir grags pas grub pa'i don bkag pa'i phyir de nyid gzhan sel ba'i thabs kyis bstan to //
translated: In this context, where the meaning of the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is being considered, the meaning of ‚Äúestablished by common consensus‚Äù is refuted, and so that very [meaning] is taught by the method of other-exclusion.

original: de las skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the fault of that?

original: de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response, [the Autocommentary] states, ‚ÄúIn that case . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: de la ste stong pa nyid kyi brjod bya la sgra las byung ba'i rta la sogs pa blo'i bdag nyid kyi cha shas 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la ste stong pa nyid kyi brjod bya la sgra las byung ba'i rta la sogs pa blo'i bdag nyid kyi cha shas 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, with respect to the topic of emptiness, the aspect of the mind that arises from sound, such as the word ‚Äúhorse,‚Äù would be apprehended.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po'i ngo bo mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po'i ngo bo mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the nature of an external thing is not apprehended.

original: de lta yin na skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de lta yin na skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: If that is the case, what is the fault?

original: der ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: der ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response, [the Autocommentary] states, ‚ÄúIn that case . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: de la de ltar na gnas pa na sel ba brjod bya nyid ni brdzun par khas blangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la de ltar na gnas pa na sel ba brjod bya nyid ni brdzun par khas blangs par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, when abiding in that way, the exclusion that is the topic would be accepted as false.

original: phyi rol gyi don la mi ltos pa'i blo'i rnam pa ni sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sgra'i don du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la mi ltos pa'i blo'i rnam pa ni sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis sgra'i don du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the aspect of the mind that does not rely on an external object would be the meaning of the word by virtue of being the nature of the probandum.

original: de lta yin dang dam bca' ba la khas blangs pas gnod pa yin no snyam du bsams @324a * //
analyzed: de lta yin dang dam bca' ba la khas blangs pas gnod pa yin no snyam du bsams @324a * //
translated: If that were so, then the thesis would be undermined by the assertion.

original: pa'o // de nyid ston pa ni //
analyzed: pa'o // de nyid ston pa ni //
translated: To demonstrate just that, he says:

original: blo'i rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: blo'i rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The form of cognition, etc.

original: blo'i rnam pa nyid kyi dngos po'i ngo bo'i sgra'i don du 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: blo'i rnam pa nyid kyi dngos po'i ngo bo'i sgra'i don du 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: The form of cognition itself becomes the meaning of the word entity.

original: 'di snyam du blo de dmigs pa med pa yin na yang ba lang la sogs pa'i blo dag las rigs mi mthun pa dag las ldog pa'i ngo bor 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'di snyam du blo de dmigs pa med pa yin na yang ba lang la sogs pa'i blo dag las rigs mi mthun pa dag las ldog pa'i ngo bor 'jug ste /
translated: If you think that even though that cognition is without an object, it engages in the nature of an exclusion from what is dissimilar, such as the cognition of a cow, etc.

original: des na gzhan sel ba brtags pa mi rigs pa kho na'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: des na gzhan sel ba brtags pa mi rigs pa kho na'o snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, the postulation of an exclusion of other is simply illogical,

original: blo de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: blo de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThat cognition, etc.‚Äù

original: blo de zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa'i rta la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: blo de zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa'i rta la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat cognition‚Äù refers to the cognition of a horse, etc., which is without an object.

original: sgra'i don la zhes bya ba ni rta la sogs par zhen pa dag la'o //
analyzed: sgra'i don la zhes bya ba ni rta la sogs par zhen pa dag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe meaning of the word‚Äù refers to the attachment to a horse, etc.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i ngo bor zhen pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i ngo bor zhen pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of an entity‚Äù refers to the attachment to the nature of the probandum.

original: dngos po nyid ces bya ba ni rta la sogs pa'i gong bur nges pa'i blo'i bdag nyid do //üîΩnges par bzung ba'i 'bras bu ston pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po nyid ces bya ba ni rta la sogs pa'i gong bur nges pa'i blo'i bdag nyid do // nges par bzung ba'i 'bras bu ston pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe nature of an entity‚Äù refers to the nature of the cognition that ascertains the collection of parts, such as the head, etc., of a horse.

original: blo ni mi sel ba'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: blo ni mi sel ba'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The result of the ascertainment is shown in the phrase ‚Äúthe cognition that is not an exclusion.üîΩ‚Äù

original: brjod par bya ba gang la sel ba yod pa ma yin pa rta la sogs pa'i blo'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po de la de skad ces bya ste /üîΩblo'i sel ba med pa'i blo mi sel ba ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba gang la sel ba yod pa ma yin pa rta la sogs pa'i blo'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po de la de skad ces bya ste / blo'i sel ba med pa'i blo mi sel ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe cognition that is not an exclusion‚Äù refers to the entity that is the nature of the cognition of a horse, etc., which is not an exclusion of some other object of cognition.

original: blo gzhan sel ba dang bral ba //üîΩzhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: blo gzhan sel ba dang bral ba // zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The cognition that is not an exclusion is the cognition that is free from the exclusion of another cognition.üîΩThe meaning of the phrase ‚Äúfree from the exclusion of another cognition‚Äù is ‚Äúfree from the exclusion of another cognition.‚Äù

original: rnam pa gcig tu na sel bar byed pas sel ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na sel bar byed pas sel ba ste /
translated: In another way, the exclusion is that which excludes.

original: sel ba med pa ni mi sel ba'o //
analyzed: sel ba med pa ni mi sel ba'o //
translated: The absence of an exclusion is a nonexclusion.

original: blo'i sel ba med pa ni blo mi sel ba zhes bsdu'o //
analyzed: blo'i sel ba med pa ni blo mi sel ba zhes bsdu'o //
translated: The cognition that is not an exclusion is a cognition that is not an exclusion.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúthe cognition that is not an exclusion.‚Äù

original: gal te blo gzhan las rnam par bcad pa de lta na yang de blo gzhan rnam par gcod par nges par skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te blo gzhan las rnam par bcad pa de lta na yang de blo gzhan rnam par gcod par nges par skye ba ma yin no //
translated: This is the point that is being made: Even though a cognition is an exclusion of another cognition, it is not necessarily generated as an exclusion of another cognition.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: rta la sogs pa'i don la sgrub pa'i ngo bos zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: rta la sogs pa'i don la sgrub pa'i ngo bos zhen pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of horse and so on is conceived by the nature of the affirmation.

original: des na dngos po sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid brjod byar rtog pa rigs pa dang ldan pa yin gyi gzhan sel ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des na dngos po sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid brjod byar rtog pa rigs pa dang ldan pa yin gyi gzhan sel ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to conceive the nature of the affirmation of an entity as the meaning of a word, but not the exclusion of another,

original: blo gzhan gyis blo gzhan mi sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo gzhan gyis blo gzhan mi sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one cognition does not exclude another cognition.

original: gzhan yang khyed cag gis sel ba'i tshig gi don nyid du brtags pa gang yin pa de ni ngag las btus nas brtags pa'i tshig gi don du 'dod la /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed cag gis sel ba'i tshig gi don nyid du brtags pa gang yin pa de ni ngag las btus nas brtags pa'i tshig gi don du 'dod la /
translated: Moreover, the meaning of a word that you imagine to be an exclusion is asserted to be the meaning of a word that is imagined after it is extracted from speech.

original: ngag gi don ni snang ba'i mtshan nyid kho na ste /
analyzed: ngag gi don ni snang ba'i mtshan nyid kho na ste /
translated: The meaning of speech is only the appearance of an object.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: tshig ni ngag las btus pa la //
analyzed: tshig ni ngag las btus pa la //
translated: The word is extracted from speech.

original: rnam par dpen pas don 'di yin //
analyzed: rnam par dpen pas don 'di yin //
translated: The meaning is distinguished from that.

original: ngag don 'di ni snang bar brjod //
analyzed: ngag don 'di ni snang bar brjod //
translated: Speech is said to be the appearance of the meaning.

original: des na 'di ni bskyed bya yin //üîΩzhes smras pa bzhin no //
analyzed: des na 'di ni bskyed bya yin // zhes smras pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, it is what is produced.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, the opponent says:

original: ji ltar phyi rol don med kyang //
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol don med kyang //
translated: Just as external objects do not exist,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: ji ltar phyi rol gyi don sgra'i brjod bya nyid du med na yang khyed cag gi ngag gi don snang ba'i mtshan nyid du brjod kyi gzhan sel ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin pa de bzhin du @324b tshig gi don yang dag gi don bzhin du snang ba'i
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol gyi don sgra'i brjod bya nyid du med na yang khyed cag gi ngag gi don snang ba'i mtshan nyid du brjod kyi gzhan sel ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin pa de bzhin du @324b tshig gi don yang dag gi don bzhin du snang ba'i
translated: Just as external objects are not the referents of words, but you describe them as the referents of speech in the sense of appearing objects, not in the sense of being the referent of exclusion, in the same way, the referent of a word would be the referent of a real object in the sense of appearing as that object,

original: mtshan nyid du 'gyur bas de'i phyir sel ba sgra'i don nyid du ci'i phyir rtogs par byed /
analyzed: mtshan nyid du 'gyur bas de'i phyir sel ba sgra'i don nyid du ci'i phyir rtogs par byed /
translated: so why do you think that exclusion is the referent of a word?

original: tshig dang ngag gi don gnyi ga yang sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la rag mod snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: tshig dang ngag gi don gnyi ga yang sgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la rag mod snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: You may think that both the referent of a word and the referent of speech are established as the nature of the referent.

original: 'di snyam du snang ba yang snang ba gzhan gnyis pa las rnam par bcad pa yod pa'i phyir sel bar rtog go snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du snang ba yang snang ba gzhan gnyis pa las rnam par bcad pa yod pa'i phyir sel bar rtog go snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that an appearance is conceived to be an exclusion because it exists as the exclusion of another appearance,

original: de'i phyir blo ni gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo ni gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúThe mind is called other,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te 'di rtogs pa de lta na yang yod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di rtogs pa de lta na yang yod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you think that it exists in that way because it is cognized,

original: rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúIts own nature,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te yang blo blo gzhan las ldog pa yod pa de lta na yang de la sgra'i bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang blo blo gzhan las ldog pa yod pa de lta na yang de la sgra'i bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if the cognition were to cease from another cognition, still the word would not have any activity.

original: 'di ltar blo 'di sgra las skye bzhin pa na rang gi ngo bo skyed pa la ma rtogs pa gzhan gyis rnam par bcad pa 'di mtshan nyid sgra las zhen pa'i cha 'dzin par mngon par ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar blo 'di sgra las skye bzhin pa na rang gi ngo bo skyed pa la ma rtogs pa gzhan gyis rnam par bcad pa 'di mtshan nyid sgra las zhen pa'i cha 'dzin par mngon par ma yin no //
translated: For, when this cognition is arising from the word, it does not manifest the aspect of the word‚Äôs meaning, which is the exclusion of other non-cognized entities that produce its own nature.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: sgrub pa'i ngo bor zhen pa nyid skyed par byed do zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i ngo bor zhen pa nyid skyed par byed do zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: It produces the very apprehension of the word‚Äôs meaning. This is the meaning.

original: sgras ma zhen pa'i dngos po'i cha yang sgra'i don du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgras ma zhen pa'i dngos po'i cha yang sgra'i don du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that the aspect of an entity that is not apprehended by the word is the word‚Äôs meaning.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would lead to absurd consequences.

original: de lta bas na dam bca' ba grags par gnod pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //üîΩyang thal bar 'gyur ba sgrub pas grags pa dang 'ga' ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na dam bca' ba grags par gnod pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no // yang thal bar 'gyur ba sgrub pas grags pa dang 'ga' ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, he thinks that the thesis is undermined by what is commonly acknowledged.

original: gal te gzhan la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te gzhan la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Again, in order to demonstrate that the thesis is undermined by what is commonly acknowledged through the proof of the absurd consequence, he says, ‚ÄúIf it is said that the word is related to another word,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang dag ba lang rta la sogs pa tha dad pa'i spyi brjod pa dang / yang gang dag khra bo la sogs pa bye brag brjod pa de dag thams cad khyed la rnam grangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag ba lang rta la sogs pa tha dad pa'i spyi brjod pa dang / yang gang dag khra bo la sogs pa bye brag brjod pa de dag thams cad khyed la rnam grangs par 'gyur te /
translated: Those which express the universals of the different things, such as cow, horse, etc., and those which express the particulars, such as variegated, etc., all of them are synonyms for you,

original: don tha dad pa med pa'i phyir shing ldon pa dang rtsa bas 'thung la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: don tha dad pa med pa'i phyir shing ldon pa dang rtsa bas 'thung la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because there is no difference in meaning, like the words ‚Äúto be cut down‚Äù and ‚Äúto be drunk‚Äù with ‚Äúwood‚Äù and ‚Äúwater.‚Äù

original: yang ci'i phyir don tha dad pa med ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir don tha dad pa med ce na /
translated: Again, why is there no difference in meaning?

original: 'dres dang zhes bya pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dres dang zhes bya pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of mixing, etc.‚Äù

original: dngos po kho na la bsre ba nyid dang / gcig nyid dang / sna tshogs pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa srid pa yin gyi dngos po med pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po kho na la bsre ba nyid dang / gcig nyid dang / sna tshogs pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa srid pa yin gyi dngos po med pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is only in regard to things that the conceptual thoughts of mixing, identity, and variety, etc., are possible, but not in regard to non-things.

original: gzhan sel ba rnams ni dngos po med pa'i phyir phan tshun 'dre ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rigs pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: gzhan sel ba rnams ni dngos po med pa'i phyir phan tshun 'dre ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rigs pa ma yin no ;
translated: Since the exclusions are non-things, it is not reasonable to think of them as mixing, etc., with each other.

original: / de'i phyir ji ltar 'di dag gi phan tshun tha dad pa 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: / de'i phyir ji ltar 'di dag gi phan tshun tha dad pa 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how can their mutual difference be established?

original: ci ste de dag tha dad khas len par byed na /
analyzed: ci ste de dag tha dad khas len par byed na /
translated: If one accepts that they are different,üîΩthen in that case, they would definitely be entities.

original: de lta yin na nges par dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de lta yin na nges par dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: gal te thun mong zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te thun mong zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If they are called ‚Äúcommon,‚Äù etc.

original: dngos po yin zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya ston pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po yin zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya ston pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey would be entities‚Äù shows the probandum.

original: sbyor ba @325a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba @325a * //
translated: The syllogism is:

original: ni gang dag phan tshun tha dad pa de dag ni dngos po yin te /
analyzed: ni gang dag phan tshun tha dad pa de dag ni dngos po yin te /
translated: Those that are mutually different are entities,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid bzhin no //
translated: like their own characteristics.üîΩExclusion is also mutually different.

original: gzhan sel ba yang phan tshun tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba yang phan tshun tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: de lta yin dang dngos po nyid yin na sgrub pa kho na sgra'i don yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de lta yin dang dngos po nyid yin na sgrub pa kho na sgra'i don yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: If that is the case, then it is established that the meaning of the word is only the probandum, since it is an entity.

original: 'dis ni dam bca' ba la rjes su dpag bas gnod pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni dam bca' ba la rjes su dpag bas gnod pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the thesis is undermined by inference.

original: yang sel ba rnams dngos po med pa nyid du khas len pa ni de'i tshe sna tshogs pa nyid med pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin du rnam grangs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni nges so //
analyzed: yang sel ba rnams dngos po med pa nyid du khas len pa ni de'i tshe sna tshogs pa nyid med pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin du rnam grangs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni nges so //
translated: Moreover, it is certain that when one accepts the exclusions as non-entities, then, because of the absence of diversity, the consequence of being synonyms as before will ensue.

original: 'dir gzhan gyis sangs rgyas pa'i len gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyis sangs rgyas pa'i len gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Here, anticipating a doubt of the Buddhist, he says:

original: 'on te gsal bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te gsal bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBut if the exclusion is the object to be revealed, etc.‚Äù

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bsal bya'i dbye bas tha dad don //
analyzed: bsal bya'i dbye bas tha dad don //
translated: The object is differentiated by the differentiation of what is to be revealed.

original: rang don tha dad rtogs pa blun //
analyzed: rang don tha dad rtogs pa blun //
translated: The fool understands the object of self to be differentiated.

original: zhes bshad pa bzhin no //üîΩde lta yin dang rang las tha dad pa med na yang gsal bar bya ba'i rta la sogs pa tha dad pas ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa'i ngo bo'i sel ba tha dad du grub pa na rnam grangs pa 'di nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa bzhin no // de lta yin dang rang las tha dad pa med na yang gsal bar bya ba'i rta la sogs pa tha dad pas ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa'i ngo bo'i sel ba tha dad du grub pa na rnam grangs pa 'di nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This is as explained.

original: de ni rang las khyad par med //
analyzed: de ni rang las khyad par med //
translated: If that is so, then even though there is no difference from itself, because of the difference of what is to be revealed, such as a horse, etc., when the exclusion of the nature of non-cow is established as different, this is not a case of being synonyms.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas gzhan dag sun 'byin pa yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas gzhan dag sun 'byin pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not different from itself, etc.‚Äù is the refutation of others.

original: sel ba de ni rang las khyad par te sna tshogs pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sel ba de ni rang las khyad par te sna tshogs pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is eliminated does not exist as a variety that is different from itself.üîΩ

original: med pa ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That exclusion is not a multiplicity, that is, a variety, because it is nonexistent, since it is of one taste.

original: 'di gzhan las yin na yang kun brtag pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di gzhan las yin na yang kun brtag pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were different from that, it would be imaginary,

original: don dam pa ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not ultimate.

original: rang las tha dad pa med pa de ni gzhan las srid pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang las tha dad pa med pa de ni gzhan las srid pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that it is different from itself, and it is not tenable that it is different from another.

original: ci'i phyir rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not tenable?

original: gang phyir rten ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang phyir rten ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause the basis,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar 'dren pa ni 'brel pa ste khra bo la sogs pa nang gi yan lag yin na yang sel ba 'di ni ngo bo ste rang bzhin gyis dbye bar mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dren pa ni 'brel pa ste khra bo la sogs pa nang gi yan lag yin na yang sel ba 'di ni ngo bo ste rang bzhin gyis dbye bar mi nus te /
translated: Thus, even though the basis is related to the internal parts, such as the variegated, this exclusion is not divisible by nature, that is, by its own essence.

original: khra bo la sogs pa mang po dag la yang ba lang ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis sel ba gcig 'jug par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa mang po dag la yang ba lang ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis sel ba gcig 'jug par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because even in the case of many variegated things, it is asserted that the exclusion that has the character of excluding non-ox is one.

original: de ji ltar phyi rol gyi yan lag tu gyur pa gsal bar bya ba rta la sogs pa dag gi tha dad par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar phyi rol gyi yan lag tu gyur pa gsal bar bya ba rta la sogs pa dag gi tha dad par 'gyur /
translated: How could it be a different thing from the horse, etc., which are its external parts?

original: gang zhig nang gi yan lag gis kyang don tha dad par byed pa ma yin pa de phyi rol gyi yan lag gis 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig nang gi yan lag gis kyang don tha dad par byed pa ma yin pa de phyi rol gyi yan lag gis 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is not made different by its internal parts is not made different by its external parts,

original: phyi rol gyi yan lag nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yan lag nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that the external parts would be impaired.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni khyad par dang ldan par btags pa yin no zhes bzhad gang du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni khyad par dang ldan par btags pa yin no zhes bzhad gang du byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is a designation that has a distinction.

original: 'o na de lta na nang gi yan lag rten dang 'dres @325b pa tha dad du byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na nang gi yan lag rten dang 'dres @325b pa tha dad du byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well, in that case, the internal parts would be made different by the support.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is just like that, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan sel ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan sel ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the exclusion of other.

original: ci'i phyir mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi rigs she na /
translated: Why is it not correct?

original: 'brel pa can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'brel pa can ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe related, etc.‚Äù

original: de ni rang bzhin med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa gang yin pa 'brel pa can tha dad do zhes bya ba re zhig lta zhog / ji srid du dngos po la yang 'brel ba can tha dad pa tha dad par mi dmigs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa gang yin pa 'brel pa can tha dad do zhes bya ba re zhig lta zhog / ji srid du dngos po la yang 'brel ba can tha dad pa tha dad par mi dmigs pa kho na ste /
translated: Since it is essenceless, it is a non-thing.  Let us set aside for the moment the claim that the related object is different.  As long as the thing is not observed to be different from the different related object,

original: 'di ltar lha spyin la sogs pa dngos po gcig yin na yang rim mam cig car gyis sten la sogs pa du ma dang 'brel pa can tha dad pa mi sgrub pa nyid du dmigs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar lha spyin la sogs pa dngos po gcig yin na yang rim mam cig car gyis sten la sogs pa du ma dang 'brel pa can tha dad pa mi sgrub pa nyid du dmigs so //
translated: it is observed that even though Devadatta, etc., are one thing, they are related to many different things, such as his disciples, his cows, etc., either simultaneously or successively.

original: gang zhig gzhan las ldog pa'i dngos po ma yin pa dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir gang du yang ma 'dres pa ste ma 'dres pa dngos po med pa nyid kyis gzhan dag las te rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa ma yin pa lta smos kyang ci
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan las ldog pa'i dngos po ma yin pa dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir gang du yang ma 'dres pa ste ma 'dres pa dngos po med pa nyid kyis gzhan dag las te rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa ma yin pa lta smos kyang ci
translated: That which is not a thing because it is not different from another is not mixed with anything, because it is not mixed with itself.  How could it be different from others, that is, from heterogeneous things?

original: dgos / de nyid kyi phyir khyad par gyi cha shas ma gtogs pa de de 'dra ba'i 'brel pa can tha dad pas kyang ji ltar tha dad par 'gyur /
analyzed: dgos / de nyid kyi phyir khyad par gyi cha shas ma gtogs pa de de 'dra ba'i 'brel pa can tha dad pas kyang ji ltar tha dad par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could that which is related to it be different from it, except for its specific attributes?

original: gzhan yang 'brel pa can tha dad pas tha dad pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'brel pa can tha dad pas tha dad pa yin du chug mod /
translated: Moreover, even if it is accepted that difference is due to being different from that which is related,

original: de lta na yang gang zhig tha dad pas de tha dad par rtogs pa spyi dngos por gyur pa khas mi len na khyed cag gi sel ba'i rten 'brel pa can de nyid mi 'grub bo zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang gang zhig tha dad pas de tha dad par rtogs pa spyi dngos por gyur pa khas mi len na khyed cag gi sel ba'i rten 'brel pa can de nyid mi 'grub bo zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: still, if you do not accept that a real universal is understood to be different due to being different from that which is related, then your dependent, the exclusion, is not established.

original: 'dra ba nyid du ma grub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid du ma grub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is presented in the lines beginning ‚ÄúIf similarity does not exist.‚Äù

original: gal te ba lang la sogs pa'i dngos por gyur pa'i 'dra ba grub par gyur na de'i tshe 'di dag gi rta la sogs pa sel ba'i rten nyid khyad par med 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te ba lang la sogs pa'i dngos por gyur pa'i 'dra ba grub par gyur na de'i tshe 'di dag gi rta la sogs pa sel ba'i rten nyid khyad par med 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: If a real similarity that exists in things such as cows were established, then at that time, the basis of the exclusion of horse and so on would be different from that which is not a cow, but it would not be different from that which is not a horse and so on.

original: de lta yin dang 'di dag sel ba'i yul can du 'dod na gdon mi za bar 'dra ba khas blang bar bya dgos la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'di dag sel ba'i yul can du 'dod na gdon mi za bar 'dra ba khas blang bar bya dgos la /
translated: If you accept that these are the objects of the subjective aspect that eliminates, then you must accept that they are similar.

original: de nyid spyi dngos por gyur pa sgra'i brjod byar 'gyur ba'i phyir sel ba brtags pa don med pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid spyi dngos por gyur pa sgra'i brjod byar 'gyur ba'i phyir sel ba brtags pa don med pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Since that very thing becomes a real universal that is the object of expression of a word, it is pointless to investigate the object of elimination.

original: yul gyi sgra ni 'dir rten rjod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yul gyi sgra ni 'dir rten rjod par byed pa yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äúobject‚Äù here expresses the basis.

original: dper na nya yi yul ni chu yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nya yi yul ni chu yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the statement, ‚ÄúThe object of the fish is water.‚ÄùüîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúIf you think that the objects of expression are different, then that also would not be established without a real universal,‚Äù teaches that those who think that the objects of expression are different do not establish that a real universal exists.

original: gang dag gsal bya tha dad du rtog pa de dag ni de yang spyi dngos por gyur pa med par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: gang dag gsal bya tha dad du rtog pa de dag ni de yang spyi dngos por gyur pa med par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ston pa ni /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúIf the objects of expression are different, then that also would not be established without a real universal,‚Äù teaches that those who think that the objects of original: gsal bar bya ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩgal te rta la sogs pa thams cad la thun mong pa'i chos gcig po 'ga' zhig rjes su 'gro bar gyur na de'i tshe de dag thams cad la ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra dag gis gsal bar @326a * //
analyzed: gsal bar bya ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩgal te rta la sogs pa thams cad la thun mong pa'i chos gcig po 'ga' zhig rjes su 'gro bar gyur na de'i tshe de dag thams cad la ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra dag gis gsal bar @326a * //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúIf the objects of expression are different

original: 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: but not in any other way,

original: khyad par yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the distinction is not understood.

original: thun mong ba'i chos khas len na yang sel ba brtags pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thun mong ba'i chos khas len na yang sel ba brtags pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if you accept that the common property is the object, then it is pointless to investigate the exclusion.

original: des na ste de'i phyir sel ba mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: des na ste de'i phyir sel ba mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the exclusion is not established.

original: gzhan yang khyed cag gis sgra dang rtags dag gis sel ba rtogs par byed do zhes bya bar 'dod la /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed cag gis sgra dang rtags dag gis sel ba rtogs par byed do zhes bya bar 'dod la /
translated: Moreover, you maintain that the exclusion is understood through words and signs.

original: sgra dang rtags de dag spyi dngos por gyur pa med par 'jug par mi rigs te /
analyzed: sgra dang rtags de dag spyi dngos por gyur pa med par 'jug par mi rigs te /
translated: But it is not reasonable that those words and signs function without a real universal.

original: de lta bas na gang gis sel ba rtogs par byed ces bya ba 'di ston pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na gang gis sel ba rtogs par byed ces bya ba 'di ston pa ni /
translated: Therefore, this shows that by what means is the exclusion understood?

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang bral zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang bral zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The line ‚ÄúThey are devoid of concomitance‚Äù and so on.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang bral zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba med par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang bral zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba med par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúDevoid of concomitance‚Äù means ‚Äúwithout concomitance.‚Äù

original: de dag ces bya ba ni sgra dang rtags dag med na sel ba med do rtogs pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni sgra dang rtags dag med na sel ba med do rtogs pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to words and signs. ‚ÄúWithout‚Äù means that the exclusion is not understood without them.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba byas nas sgra dang rtags dag 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba byas nas sgra dang rtags dag 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that words and signs engage their referents by way of a universal that is a common locus of many particulars, then that is not so, because there is no common locus.

original: thun mong min la rjes 'gro med //üîΩces bya ba smos te /üîΩrang gi mtshan nyid thun mong ma yin pa gzhan la mi brten pa de ji ltar des rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur /
analyzed: thun mong min la rjes 'gro med // ces bya ba smos te / rang gi mtshan nyid thun mong ma yin pa gzhan la mi brten pa de ji ltar des rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur /
translated: If you say that words and signs engage their referents by way of a universal that is a common locus of many particulars, then that is not so, because there is no common locus.üîΩIf you say that words and signs engage their referents by way of a universal that is a common locus of many particulars, then that is not so, because there is no common locus.üîΩIf you say that words and signs engage their referents by way of a universal that is a common locus of many particulars, then that is not so, because there is no common locus.üîΩIf you say that words and signs engage their referents by way of a universal that is a common locus of many particulars, then that is not so, because there is no common locus.üîΩIf you say that words and signs engage their referents by way of a universal that is a common locus of many particulars, then that is not so, because there is no common locus.

original: de'i phyir de ltar sel ba brtags pa na sgra dang rtags dag 'jug pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'jug pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar sel ba brtags pa na sgra dang rtags dag 'jug pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro // 'jug pa yin du chug mod /
translated: If you say that words and signs engage their referents by way of a universal that is a common locus of many particulars, then that is not so, because there is no common locus.

original: de lta na yang 'di dag la tshad ma nyid du khas len pa nyams par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /üîΩsel ba yang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩrtogs par bya ba'i don la ma 'khrul pa yin na sgra dang rtags dag tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ro //üîΩrtogs par bya ba'i don yang khyod kyis sel ba la 'dod la /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di dag la tshad ma nyid du khas len pa nyams par 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni / sel ba yang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / rtogs par bya ba'i don la ma 'khrul pa yin na sgra dang rtags dag tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ro // rtogs par bya ba'i don yang khyod kyis sel ba la 'dod la /
translated: If you say that words and signs engage their referents by way of a universal that is a common locus of many particulars, then that is not so, because there is no common locus.üîΩIf you say that words and signs engage their referents by way of a universal that is a common locus of many particulars, then that is not so, because there is no common locus.üîΩIf you say that words and signs engage their referents by way of a universal that is a common locus of many particulars, then that is not so, because there is no common locus.

original: de yang dngos po med pa'i phyir ma grub ste /
analyzed: de yang dngos po med pa'i phyir ma grub ste /
translated: If you say that words and signs engage their referents by way of a universal that is a common locus of many particulars, then that is not so, because there is no common locus.üîΩIf you say that words and signs engage their referents by way of a universal that is a common locus of many particulars, then that is not so, because there is no common locus.

original: rang bzhin med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is just the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: de lta bas na sgra dang rtags dang lhan cig spyod pa ste ma 'khrul pa gang du ste yul gang la yin pa smros shig / smras pa /
analyzed: de lta bas na sgra dang rtags dang lhan cig spyod pa ste ma 'khrul pa gang du ste yul gang la yin pa smros shig / smras pa /
translated: Therefore, tell us which object, i.e., in regard to which object, there is non-erroneous, i.e., non-deviating, concomitance between the word and the reason.

original: des cig zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: des cig zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is the use of that?

original: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThose two,‚Äù etc.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni sgra dang rtags dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni sgra dang rtags dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThose two‚Äù refers to the word and the reason.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni lhan cig spyod pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni lhan cig spyod pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn regard to that‚Äù refers to the concomitance.

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni mi slu ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni mi slu ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The definition of valid cognition is that it is non-erroneous.

original: ci ste yang rigs mi mthun pa ma mthong ba tsam gyis sgra dang rtags dag gis lhan cig spyod pa ma bzung bar rang gi don rtogs par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang rigs mi mthun pa ma mthong ba tsam gyis sgra dang rtags dag gis lhan cig spyod pa ma bzung bar rang gi don rtogs par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if one thinks that just by not seeing a dissimilar instance, the concomitance between the word and the reason is not grasped, and the object is understood,

original: de dag ma mthong ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dag ma mthong ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe non-observation of those two,‚Äù etc.

original: tsam smos pa ni rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba rnam par bcad pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: tsam smos pa ni rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba rnam par bcad pa'i don du'o //
translated: The word ‚Äújust‚Äù is for the purpose of excluding the observation of the similar instance.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: thams cad ni zhes @326b bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thams cad ni zhes @326b bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù and so on.

original: thams cad la ste rigs mthun pa dang / rigs mi mthun pa dang / rang gi don la'o //üîΩde lta yin dang 'di ni rang gi don no //
analyzed: thams cad la ste rigs mthun pa dang / rigs mi mthun pa dang / rang gi don la'o // de lta yin dang 'di ni rang gi don no //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù refers to things of the same type, things of different types, and one‚Äôs own purpose.

original: 'di ni gzhan gyi don no zhes bya ba de lta bu rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan gyi don no zhes bya ba de lta bu rtogs pa ste /
translated: If that were so, then one would not understand that ‚Äúthis is one‚Äôs own purpose‚Äù and ‚Äúthat is the purpose of another.‚Äù

original: shes pa khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That is, one would not have a special understanding.

original: rang gi don yang mi rtogs na de la yang ma mthong ba'i phyir gzhan gyi don bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi don yang mi rtogs na de la yang ma mthong ba'i phyir gzhan gyi don bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one does not understand one‚Äôs own purpose, then, since one does not see it, one would not understand the purpose of another.

original: la lar rtogs par bya ba zhes 'don pa der ni rtogs par bya ba ste brjod par bya ba'i don khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: la lar rtogs par bya ba zhes 'don pa der ni rtogs par bya ba ste brjod par bya ba'i don khyad par du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In some editions, the text reads ‚Äúna buddhyate‚Äù . In that case, the meaning is that the object to be understood, that is, the object to be expressed, would not be special.

original: de'i phyir de ltar sgra dang rtags dag gi 'jug pa dang tshad ma khas blangs pa nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sel ba sgra'i don du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar sgra dang rtags dag gi 'jug pa dang tshad ma khas blangs pa nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sel ba sgra'i don du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the acceptance of the operation of words and reasons and of the validity of the means of knowledge would be undermined, it is not reasonable to accept that exclusion is the meaning of words.

original: gang yang 'dra ba nyid du ma grub bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa de la gzhan gyi len gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: gang yang 'dra ba nyid du ma grub bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa de la gzhan gyi len gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: In response to that, the opponent‚Äôs position is anticipated:

original: 'on te 'dra ba nyid med kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te 'dra ba nyid med kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: But even if there is no similarity, etc.

original: gal te 'dra ba med par khra bo la sogs pa sel ba rtogs par 'gyur na de'i tshe ba lang dang rta yang ci'i phyir rtogs par mi byed de /
analyzed: gal te 'dra ba med par khra bo la sogs pa sel ba rtogs par 'gyur na de'i tshe ba lang dang rta yang ci'i phyir rtogs par mi byed de /
translated: If the exclusion of multicolored, etc., is understood without similarity, then why don‚Äôt you understand the exclusion of cow and horse, etc.?

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference.

original: ba lang dang rta la sogs la yang zhes bya ba 'di'i mtshan nyid brjod pa'i phyir bram zes ba lang dang rta dag gi zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ba lang dang rta la sogs la yang zhes bya ba 'di'i mtshan nyid brjod pa'i phyir bram zes ba lang dang rta dag gi zhes bshad do //
translated: In order to state the definition of cow and horse, etc., the brahmin says, ‚ÄúCow and horse, etc.‚Äù

original: khyad par med pa de nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par med pa de nyid ston pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate that very absence of difference, he says:

original: khra bo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: khra bo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: From multicolored, etc.,

original: gang du ba lang min sel 'jug / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: gang du ba lang min sel 'jug / ces bya ba la /
translated: In the statement, ‚ÄúWhere the exclusion of non-cow is applied,‚Äù etc.,

original: ji ltar khra bo las mi 'dra ba'i phyir rta la mi 'jug pa de bzhin du ser zal la yang de dang mi mthun pa yod pa'i phyir de la yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar khra bo las mi 'dra ba'i phyir rta la mi 'jug pa de bzhin du ser zal la yang de dang mi mthun pa yod pa'i phyir de la yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the word ‚Äúhorse‚Äù does not apply to a variegated animal because it is unlike a horse, so it does not apply to a cow either, because it is unlike that as well.

original: de bzhin du khra bo la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du khra bo la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The same argument applies to the variegated animal and so on.

original: thams cad du mi 'dra bar khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa la brda mi srid pa'i phyir sgra'i don du mi rigs pa de bzhin du sel ba la yang ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad du mi 'dra bar khyad par med pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa la brda mi srid pa'i phyir sgra'i don du mi rigs pa de bzhin du sel ba la yang ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no difference in the fact that all are unlike the referent.

original: ba lang min sel dbang pos kyang //
analyzed: ba lang min sel dbang pos kyang //
translated: Moreover, just as it is not tenable that the word refers to the thing itself, because it is impossible to make a conventional symbol for the thing itself, it is also not tenable that the word refers to the exclusion.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:üîΩEven the exclusion of non-cow is not ascertained by the sense faculties.

original: rang gis nges pa'i don la brda byed pa pos brda byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gis nges pa'i don la brda byed pa pos brda byed pa yin te /
translated: The one who makes the conventional symbol makes the symbol for the object that is ascertained by oneself.

original: gzhan sel ba ni su zhig gis kyang dbang bo dag gis nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba ni su zhig gis kyang dbang bo dag gis nges pa ma yin no //
translated: But no one ascertains the exclusion by the sense faculties.

original: dang por te /
analyzed: dang por te /
translated: First,

original: tha snyad kyi dus las sngar ming dang ming can 'brel pa'i dus su zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dus las sngar ming dang ming can 'brel pa'i dus su zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of prior to the time of convention is the time of the relation between name and referent.

original: de ni dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir la dbang po rnams ni dngos po'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //üîΩ'di snyam du gzhan las ldog pa'i rang gi @327a * //
analyzed: de ni dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir la dbang po rnams ni dngos po'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no // 'di snyam du gzhan las ldog pa'i rang gi @327a * //
translated: This is because it is not a real thing, and because the senses have real things as their objects.

original: mtshan nyid dmigs nas sgra sbyor bar byed do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dmigs nas sgra sbyor bar byed do snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that one applies a word after observing an intrinsic identity that is the exclusion of other,üîΩthen it is said,

original: gzhan la sgra 'jug ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan la sgra 'jug ma yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: A word does not apply to another.

original: gzhan sel ba las gzhan rang gi mtshan nyid la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba las gzhan rang gi mtshan nyid la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that a word does not apply to an intrinsic identity that is other than an exclusion of other.

original: sel ba dngos pos nges pa ma yin mod kyi rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sel ba dngos pos nges pa ma yin mod kyi rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: One might say, Although a word is not ascertained by a real thing, it is inferred.

original: sngar bstan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To this it is said, The previously taught... and so on.

original: de la sngar bstan pa'i rnam pa rjes su 'gro ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de la sngar bstan pa'i rnam pa rjes su 'gro ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: Therein, the previously taught is the aspect of the exclusion of the absence of the forward process.

original: sgra dang rtags dag 'jug pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra dang rtags dag 'jug pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said, A word and a sign do not apply... and so on.

original: 'brel pa nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba la sgra dang lhan cig ces bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba la sgra dang lhan cig ces bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe experience of the relation‚Äù means that the word is simultaneous with the object.

original: sngar bstan pa'i mi 'dra ba la sogs pa mi 'thad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad ces yang gi sgra bstan to //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i mi 'dra ba la sogs pa mi 'thad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad ces yang gi sgra bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that not only is the previously explained difference, etc., untenable.

original: de na ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de ltar brda ma byas par yang sel ba yang sgra 'jug par khas blangs pa'i phyir brda ma byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar brda ma byas par yang sel ba yang sgra 'jug par khas blangs pa'i phyir brda ma byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, because it is accepted that the word is applied to the exclusion even without the convention, the reason ‚Äúbecause there is no convention‚Äù is shown to be indeterminate.

original: yang sel ba la brda mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩba lang min pa'i sgras brjod bya //
analyzed: yang sel ba la brda mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir / ba lang min pa'i sgras brjod bya //
translated: Again, in order to show that it is impossible to have a convention with regard to the exclusion,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe word ‚Äònon-cow‚Äô is not applicable to the cow itself,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar rta la sogs pa ba lang ma yin pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: ji ltar rta la sogs pa ba lang ma yin pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba nyid de /
translated: How is it that the horse, etc., are the referents of the word ‚Äúnon-cow‚Äù?

original: ba lang gi sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin par /
analyzed: ba lang gi sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin par /
translated: The cow itself is not the referent of the word ‚Äúcow.‚Äù

original: khyed cag gis rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di khyed cag gis brjod par 'os so //
analyzed: khyed cag gis rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di khyed cag gis brjod par 'os so //
translated: You should say, ‚ÄúYou should understand it.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas pas smras pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pas smras pa /
translated: The Buddhist says:

original: gang du 'brel pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'brel pa nyams su myong ba'i tshe zhes bya ba ni brda rtogs pa'i dus na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang du 'brel pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'brel pa nyams su myong ba'i tshe zhes bya ba ni brda rtogs pa'i dus na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the passage beginning ‚ÄúWhen the connection . . . ‚Äù the phrase ‚Äúwhen the connection is experienced‚Äù means ‚Äúwhen the convention is understood.‚Äù

original: 'o na ba lang zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol po sun 'byin pa 'chad de /üîΩgal te brda nyams su myong ba'i dus na dmigs pa gang yin de las gzhan du ba lang gi sgra 'jug par mi 'dod pa de'i brda'i yul du byas pa'i khra bo la sogs pa'i ba lang gi gong du gcig la gzhan gang yin pa ser zal la
