analyzed: 'o na ba lang zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol po sun 'byin pa 'chad de / gal te brda nyams su myong ba'i dus na dmigs pa gang yin de las gzhan du ba lang gi sgra 'jug par mi 'dod pa de'i brda'i yul du byas pa'i khra bo la sogs pa'i ba lang gi gong du gcig la gzhan gang yin pa ser zal la
translated: The opponent‚Äôs refutation is stated in the passage beginning ‚ÄúBut if the word cow . . . ‚ÄùüîΩIf you do not assert that the word cow is applied to the object that is observed when the convention is experienced, then the variegated cow and so on that is the object of that convention would be excluded from being a cow.

original: sogs pa de yang ba lang sel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sogs pa de yang ba lang sel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The cow that is the referent of the word cow would be excluded from being a cow.

original: de lta yin dang spyi brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de lta yin dang spyi brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba mi 'grub bo //
translated: If that were the case, it would not be established that the universal is the object of expression.

original: phan tshun bsten pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di las kyang sel ba la brda bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir grub na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phan tshun bsten pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba 'di las kyang sel ba la brda bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir grub na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one cannot make a convention in regard to the exclusion, he says, ‚ÄúEven if it were established,‚Äù and so on.

original: ba lang ma yin pa rnam par bcad nas ba lang rtogs la /
analyzed: ba lang ma yin pa rnam par bcad nas ba lang rtogs la /
translated: The cow is understood by the exclusion of the non-cow.

original: ba lang ma yin pa de yang ba lang bkag pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: ba lang ma yin pa de yang ba lang bkag pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: And that non-cow is the nature of the negation of the cow.

original: de lta yin dang gang gis ba lang @327b ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di la ba lang dgag pas 'gogs par 'gyur ba lang ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di la tshig phyi ma'i don brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de lta yin dang gang gis ba lang @327b ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di la ba lang dgag pas 'gogs par 'gyur ba lang ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di la tshig phyi ma'i don brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: If that were so, then in regard to this so-called non-cow, the meaning of the latter term would have to be stated, namely, the negation of the cow.

original: rang gi ngo bo mi shes pa ni dgag par nus pa ma yin no //üîΩci ste yang 'di la ci zhig brjod par bya /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo mi shes pa ni dgag par nus pa ma yin no // ci ste yang 'di la ci zhig brjod par bya /
translated: That which is not known by its own nature cannot be negated.

original: 'di'i ba lang zhes bya ba ni ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa'i bdag nyid yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'di'i ba lang zhes bya ba ni ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa'i bdag nyid yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think, ‚ÄúWhat is to be said about this? The so-called cow is the nature of the negation of the non-cow,‚ÄùüîΩthen in that case,

original: gal te de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is so, etc.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni ba lang ngo //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni ba lang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the cow.

original: 'di ltar ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ba lang ni ba lang ma yin pa rtogs pa'i sgo nas rtogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ba lang ni ba lang ma yin pa rtogs pa'i sgo nas rtogs pa la /
translated: Since the cow is the nature that is the opposite of non-cow, the cow is understood through the realization of non-cow.

original: ba lang ma yin pa yang ba lang dgag pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ba lang rtogs pa'i sgo nas rtogs pa'i phyir phan tshun bsten pa gsal bar rab tu 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: ba lang ma yin pa yang ba lang dgag pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ba lang rtogs pa'i sgo nas rtogs pa'i phyir phan tshun bsten pa gsal bar rab tu 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Since the non-cow is the nature that is the negation of the cow, the non-cow is understood through the realization of the cow. Therefore it is clear that they are mutually dependent.

original: ci ste yang ba lang ma yin pa'i sgras ba lang gang yin pa 'gegs pa na ba lang ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sel ba grub par bya ba'i don du sgrub pa'i ngo bo de nyid sel ba'i don du grub ste /
analyzed: ci ste yang ba lang ma yin pa'i sgras ba lang gang yin pa 'gegs pa na ba lang ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sel ba grub par bya ba'i don du sgrub pa'i ngo bo de nyid sel ba'i don du grub ste /
translated: But if the word non-cow negates the cow, then in order to establish the cow as the object of negation, which is characterized by the exclusion of non-cow, the nature of the proof is established as the object of negation.

original: des na phan tshun bsten par mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: des na phan tshun bsten par mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: Therefore they are not mutually dependent.

original: de'i phyir grub mtha' la'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir grub mtha' la'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond: Therefore, even in the philosophical tenet systems, etc.

original: gal te de lta yin na sgra thams cad sel ba'i don can zhes bya ba de lta bu'i sel ba rtogs pa don med pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na sgra thams cad sel ba'i don can zhes bya ba de lta bu'i sel ba rtogs pa don med pa yin te /
translated: If that were so, then it would be pointless to understand the exclusion that is called ‚Äúthe meaning of all words that exclude other things,‚Äù

original: sgrub pa'i ngo bo don yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i ngo bo don yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of the word would exist as an established entity.

original: de lta bas na grub pa'i ngo bo 'ga' zhig sgra'i don du grub par khas blang bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na grub pa'i ngo bo 'ga' zhig sgra'i don du grub par khas blang bar bya dgos te /
translated: Therefore, you must accept that the meaning of a word is an established entity.

original: de khas mi len na yang phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes pa bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: de khas mi len na yang phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes pa bzlog par dka'o //
translated: If you do not accept that, then it is difficult to avoid the error of mutual dependence.

original: phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes pa de nyid mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes pa de nyid mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to conclude that error of mutual dependence, he says,

original: ba ma grub na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ba ma grub na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the word is not established, etc.‚Äù

original: de med ces bya ba ni ba lang ma yin pa med na'o //
analyzed: de med ces bya ba ni ba lang ma yin pa med na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that does not exist‚Äù means if the non-ox does not exist.

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po bsgrub pa'i phyir autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra ni don gzhan la ldog pa'i sgra khyad par can brjod do zhes bya ba bshad pa de ni mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po bsgrub pa'i phyir autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra ni don gzhan la ldog pa'i sgra khyad par can brjod do zhes bya ba bshad pa de ni mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir
translated: To demonstrate that this is illogical,

original: / rten dang brten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: / rten dang brten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe relationship of support and supported and so on is not possible for that which is not an entity.‚Äù

original: gang zhig gang dang lhan cig dngos po pa'i 'brel pa yod pa de ni des khyad par du byas pa yin no zhes bya bar rigs la /üîΩsngon po dang autpala dag gi sngon po ma yin pa dang autpala ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dngos po med pa dag la ni rten dang brten pa la sogs pa'i 'brel pa srid pa @328a * //
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang lhan cig dngos po pa'i 'brel pa yod pa de ni des khyad par du byas pa yin no zhes bya bar rigs la / sngon po dang autpala dag gi sngon po ma yin pa dang autpala ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dngos po med pa dag la ni rten dang brten pa la sogs pa'i 'brel pa srid pa @328a * //
translated: It is logical that that which is related to another as a thing is qualified by it.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: But the nonblue and nonlotus, which are the negations of blue and lotus, do not exist as entities by way of their own nature, and so the relationship of support and supported and so on is not possible for them.

original: ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not entities.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni ldan pa dang 'du ba dang don gcig la 'du ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni ldan pa dang 'du ba dang don gcig la 'du ba la sogs pa'i 'brel pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the relation of inherence, which is the same as the relation of possession.

original: dngos po ba'i 'brel pa med na des khyad par du byas pa rtogs par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po ba'i 'brel pa med na des khyad par du byas pa rtogs par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: If there is no relation between the thing and the qualifier, then it is not reasonable to understand the thing as qualified by the qualifier.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: This would lead to an absurd conclusion.

original: / ci ste yang gang las skyon 'dir 'gyur ba kho bo cag ni sngon po ma yin pa las rtogs pas khyad par can gyi autpala la sogs pa rnam par gcod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / ci ste yang gang las skyon 'dir 'gyur ba kho bo cag ni sngon po ma yin pa las rtogs pas khyad par can gyi autpala la sogs pa rnam par gcod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúWe do not eliminate the lotus and so on that is qualified by a qualifier that is distinguished from that which is not blue.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩsngon po la ma yin ba dang autpala ma yin pa dag las ldog pa'i dngos po nyid de ltar rnam par gnas la /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / sngon po la ma yin ba dang autpala ma yin pa dag las ldog pa'i dngos po nyid de ltar rnam par gnas la /
translated: What, then, do we eliminate?üîΩWe eliminate the thing that is distinguished from that which is not blue and that which is not a lotus.

original: de las don gzhan las ldog pa'i khyad par can brjod do zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'dod do snyam na /
analyzed: de las don gzhan las ldog pa'i khyad par can brjod do zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'dod do snyam na /
translated: We assert that the thing that is distinguished from that which is not blue and that which is not a lotus exists in that way, and we say that it is distinguished from a thing that is different from that.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir thun mong min pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te rang gi mtshan nyid ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thun mong min pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te rang gi mtshan nyid ni brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThe uncommon object, etc.‚Äù He thinks that because the intrinsic identity is not an object of expression, and because the fault of the consequence of its presence in the subject would ensue.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po go bar bya ba yin la rag mod /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po go bar bya ba yin la rag mod /
translated: Granted that the uncommon object is the object of understanding,

original: de lta na yang de gzhan las ldog pas khyad par can nyid du mi 'grub po zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang de gzhan las ldog pas khyad par can nyid du mi 'grub po zhes ston pa ni /
translated: nevertheless, it is not established as the qualifier by the exclusion of the other.

original: dngos po dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúThe connection of the entity, etc.‚Äù

original: dngos po ni thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: The entity is the uncommon object.

original: dngos med ni sel ba'o //
analyzed: dngos med ni sel ba'o //
translated: The non-entity is the exclusion.

original: dngos bo dang dngos po med pa dag la 'brel pa rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos bo dang dngos po med pa dag la 'brel pa rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical for the connection of the entity and the non-entity to be a connection.

original: de'i rten ni dngos po gnyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rten ni dngos po gnyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the basis of that is the two entities.

original: 'brel ba yod du chug mod /
analyzed: 'brel ba yod du chug mod /
translated: Even if the connection were possible,

original: de lta na yang sel ba khyad par nyid du mi rigs so zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang sel ba khyad par nyid du mi rigs so zhes ston pa ni /
translated: nevertheless, the exclusion is not logical as the qualifier. To demonstrate this, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúThe connection of the entity, etc.‚Äù

original: rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of the thing itself‚Äù and so on.

original: sngon po la sogs pa yod pa tsam gyis autpala la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa yod pa tsam gyis autpala la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The mere presence of blue, etc. does not constitute the particularity of the lotus, etc.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What, then, does constitute it?

original: shes pa yin na ste /
analyzed: shes pa yin na ste /
translated: It is the cognition,

original: gang zhig rang gi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa'i blos khyad par can gsal bar byed pa de ni khyad par zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rang gi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa'i blos khyad par can gsal bar byed pa de ni khyad par zhes bya'o //
translated: that which is the cause of the cognition that is the image of the thing itself. That is called the particularity.

original: sel ba ni rnam pa 'di yod pa yang ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: sel ba ni rnam pa 'di yod pa yang ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The following is stated to show that exclusion is not a mode of that [particularity]:

original: rta la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rta la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition of horse, etc.‚Äù

original: rta la sogs pa'i blos ni sel ba nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rta la sogs pa'i blos ni sel ba nges pa ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of horse, etc. is not the ascertainment of exclusion.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What, then, is it?

original: dngos po nyid de /
analyzed: dngos po nyid de /
translated: It is the thing itself.

original: de ltar yin dang sel ba'i rtogs pa med pa'i phyir blo des rta la sogs pa gsal bar byed ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang sel ba'i rtogs pa med pa'i phyir blo des rta la sogs pa gsal bar byed ba ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, then because there is no cognition of exclusion, that cognition does not manifest the horse, etc.

original: 'di snyam du sel ba ma shes na yang khyad par du 'gyur ba yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sel ba ma shes na yang khyad par du 'gyur ba yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that even without knowing the exclusion, there is particularity,

original: @328b 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: @328b 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù and so on.

original: khyad par ma bzung bar ni khyad par can gyi blor 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par ma bzung bar ni khyad par can gyi blor 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Without apprehending a distinction, there is no cognition of a thing that is distinguished.

original: khyad par mi shes pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par mi shes pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: That which does not know the distinction is called ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: blo la yod pa'i sel ba yin du chug mod /
analyzed: blo la yod pa'i sel ba yin du chug mod /
translated: Even granting that the exclusion is in the cognition,

original: de lta na yang dngos po la de'i rnam pa'i blo med pa'i phyir de de'i khyad par du rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang dngos po la de'i rnam pa'i blo med pa'i phyir de de'i khyad par du rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: still, because there is no cognition of that form in the thing, it is not reasonable for that to be its distinction.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says ‚ÄúThe nature of another,‚Äù and so on.

original: khyad par thams cad ni khyad bar can la rang gi rnam pa rjes su byed pa'i blo skyed par byed pa mthong gi / khyad par mi 'dra ba ni khyad par can la mi 'dra ba'i blo skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par thams cad ni khyad bar can la rang gi rnam pa rjes su byed pa'i blo skyed par byed pa mthong gi / khyad par mi 'dra ba ni khyad par can la mi 'dra ba'i blo skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: All distinctions are seen to generate a cognition that conforms to the form of the distinguished thing; a dissimilar distinction does not generate a dissimilar cognition of the distinguished thing.

original: sngon po ni autpala dmar po zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: sngon po ni autpala dmar po zhes bya ba las /
translated: ‚ÄúRed‚Äù and ‚Äúlotus‚Äù are not dissimilar.

original: dbyig pa ni rna cha can zhes bya ba'i blo skyed par byed pa ma yin pa ltar 'di rta la sogs pa la med ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i sgra las byung ba'i blo skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dbyig pa ni rna cha can zhes bya ba'i blo skyed par byed pa ma yin pa ltar 'di rta la sogs pa la med ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i sgra las byung ba'i blo skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Just as a stick does not produce the cognition of an earring, so a cognition of a horse, etc. does not arise from a word that is not in conformity with it.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: dngos po'i rnam par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rnam par zhen pa yin no //
translated: It is the cognition of the form of the thing.

original: 'di snyam du mi 'dra ba'i shes pa skyed bar byed pa yang khyad par du brjod do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du mi 'dra ba'i shes pa skyed bar byed pa yang khyad par du brjod do snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that a cognition that produces a different cognition is also called a distinguishing cognition,

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúHow can a cognition, etc.‚Äù

original: mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par dang rjes su mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par dang rjes su mi mthun pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent‚Äù means distinguished, not in conformity.

original: gal te yin na skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te yin na skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: If it is so, what is the fault?

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs smos te /
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf, etc.‚Äù

original: ci ste gal te khyad cag gi khyad par rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi khyad par can la rnam pa gzhan du gnas na yang khyad par du rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: ci ste gal te khyad cag gi khyad par rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi khyad par can la rnam pa gzhan du gnas na yang khyad par du rtogs pa yin na /
translated: If, that is, if a distinguishing cognition is a distinguishing cognition even when it is in a different form from the distinguished thing,

original: de lta na ni sngon po la sogs pa thams cad thams cad kyi khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni sngon po la sogs pa thams cad thams cad kyi khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, everything, such as blue, would be the qualifier of everything.

original: de lta yin dang rnam par mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rnam par mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would not be a non-qualifier.

original: ci ste yang sel pas kyang rang gi blos khyad par du byas pa'i dngos po gsal bar byed pa kho na'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ci ste yang sel pas kyang rang gi blos khyad par du byas pa'i dngos po gsal bar byed pa kho na'o snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that the qualifier also clarifies the entity that is distinguished by its own cognition,

original: med pas go bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med pas go bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúThe object of understanding through nonexistence,‚Äù and so on.

original: med pa ni sel ba'o //
analyzed: med pa ni sel ba'o //
translated: Nonexistence is the qualifier.

original: med pa des go bar bya ba ni med pas go bya'o //
analyzed: med pa des go bar bya ba ni med pas go bya'o //
translated: The object of understanding through that nonexistence is the object of understanding through nonexistence.

original: med pas go bar bya ba'i rang bzhin rang gi ngo bo khyad par du bya ba'i dngos po gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: med pas go bar bya ba'i rang bzhin rang gi ngo bo khyad par du bya ba'i dngos po gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the nature of the object of understanding through nonexistence, the entity that is distinguished by its own nature, is so called.

original: gal te med pa'i ngo bos dngos po rtogs par 'gyur na de'i tshe de dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te med pa'i ngo bos dngos po rtogs par 'gyur na de'i tshe de dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If an entity were understood by means of the nature of nonexistence, then at that time it would not be an entity,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because entity and nonentity are mutually exclusive.

original: dkyus ma nyid mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dkyus ma nyid mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize the main point,üîΩNƒÅgƒÅrjuna says,

original: de phyir sel bas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de phyir sel bas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúby means of the exclusion of other.‚Äù

original: 'di snyam du gzhan las ldog pa nyid kyi dngos po la sgra dang rtags dag 'jug bar mthong gi gzhan sel ba dang @329a * //
analyzed: 'di snyam du gzhan las ldog pa nyid kyi dngos po la sgra dang rtags dag 'jug bar mthong gi gzhan sel ba dang @329a * //
translated: One might think as follows: One sees that words and signs operate in regard to things that are the negation of other,

original: bral ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bral ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in regard to that which is free from the exclusion of other.

original: des na sgra dang rtags dag gis sel ba bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: des na sgra dang rtags dag gis sel ba bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes brjod kyi /
translated: Therefore, words and signs do not indicate the exclusion of other.

original: med par dgag pa tsam bstan pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med par dgag pa tsam bstan pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: But they do not indicate a mere negative.

original: des na grags pa la sogs pa dang 'gal ba ji skad du bshad pa thams cad du 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: des na grags pa la sogs pa dang 'gal ba ji skad du bshad pa thams cad du 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Thus, all of the objections that have been raised, such as the contradiction with what is commonly accepted, will ensue.

original: gal te sel ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te sel ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Anticipating this, he says, ‚ÄúIf the exclusion of other . . . ‚Äù

original: gal te dngos po de gzhan las ldog pa yin pa de lta na yang de la sgra dang rtags las byung ba'i rtogs pa skye ba na gzhan las zlog pa yin na yang dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te dngos po de gzhan las ldog pa yin pa de lta na yang de la sgra dang rtags las byung ba'i rtogs pa skye ba na gzhan las zlog pa yin na yang dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even if that thing is the negation of other, when the cognition that arises from a word or sign in regard to that thing is the negation of other, it is not the observation of that.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it, then?

original: dngos po'i cha nyid la mngon par rgyugs pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i cha nyid la mngon par rgyugs pa yin te /
translated: It is the very part of the thing that is the object of the cognition that arises from the word or the sign,

original: de la rjes su chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rjes su chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is attached to that.

original: dngos po'i cha gang kho na sgra'am rtags las byung ba'i shes pas nges pa de kho na'i yul yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po'i cha gang kho na sgra'am rtags las byung ba'i shes pas nges pa de kho na'i yul yin gyi /
translated: The object of that cognition is only that part of the thing which is ascertained by the cognition that arises from the word or the sign.

original: yod na yang ma nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod na yang ma nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even if it exists, it is not ascertained.

original: me tog ma li ka la sogs pa'i sgra ni dri la sogs pa yod pa nyid kyis kyang brjod bya nyid du rnam par 'jog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me tog ma li ka la sogs pa'i sgra ni dri la sogs pa yod pa nyid kyis kyang brjod bya nyid du rnam par 'jog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äújasmine‚Äù and so on is not posited as the object of expression by the mere existence of smell and so on.

original: gang zhig gzhan las ldog pa'i dngos po la sgra dang rtags dag 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan las ldog pa'i dngos po la sgra dang rtags dag 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: It is also not reasonable to say that words and signs engage with things that are the negation of other.

original: thun mong ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not uncommon,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan las ldog pa'i dngos po yin na khyed kyi lugs kyis rang gi mtshan nyid thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan las ldog pa'i dngos po yin na khyed kyi lugs kyis rang gi mtshan nyid thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If it were a thing that is the negation of other, in your system it would be a unique particular.

original: de ni sgra dang rtags las byung ba'i blo la gsal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni sgra dang rtags las byung ba'i blo la gsal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not clear to the cognition that arises from words and signs.

original: khyed kyi lugs kyis de rtogs pa med pa'i blo gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / sgra dang rtags las byung ba'i blo'i yul yang spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyed kyi lugs kyis de rtogs pa med pa'i blo gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / sgra dang rtags las byung ba'i blo'i yul yang spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In your system, it is to be apprehended by a cognition that does not understand it, and the object of the cognition that arises from words and signs is the universal characteristic.

original: ci ste yang 'di rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du khas len pa de yang rigs pa dang 'brel pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste yang 'di rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du khas len pa de yang rigs pa dang 'brel pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: If you accept that it has a particular characteristic as its object, that also is not connected with logic.

original: rnam rtog med pa pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not non-conceptual,‚Äù and so on.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po ni sgra dang rtags las skyes pa'i shes pa rtogs par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po ni sgra dang rtags las skyes pa'i shes pa rtogs par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: An uncommon thing is not to be understood by a cognition that arises from words and signs.

original: der rtogs pa thams cad nub pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: der rtogs pa thams cad nub pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because all conceptualization has ceased in that.

original: 'di ltar rtogs pa ni rigs la sogs pa'i khyad par la reg pa nyid kyis 'jug gi dag pa'i dngos po 'dzin pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs pa ni rigs la sogs pa'i khyad par la reg pa nyid kyis 'jug gi dag pa'i dngos po 'dzin pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, conceptualization engages by merely touching the distinctions of the class and so on, but it does not apprehend the pure thing.

original: yang ci ste sgras go bar bya ba ma yin pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po yang ldog par khyad par can du brjod do snyam na /
analyzed: yang ci ste sgras go bar bya ba ma yin pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po yang ldog par khyad par can du brjod do snyam na /
translated: Moreover, if one thinks that a unique particular that is not to be understood through a word is also excluded, then the word ‚Äúunique‚Äù is mentioned.

original: sgra'i rtogs bya ma yin zhes bya @329b ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgra'i rtogs bya ma yin zhes bya @329b ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúNot the object of understanding through a word‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang spyi dngos po nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang spyi dngos po nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove that a universal is a real entity in another way,

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúWhen . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: gsal ba rnams zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po rnams te /
analyzed: gsal ba rnams zhes bya ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po rnams te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe particulars‚Äù are the unique particulars.

original: brjod bya ma yin pa'i phyir bsal bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod bya ma yin pa'i phyir bsal bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Because they are not to be expressed, they are not to be excluded,

original: ma brjod pa ni bsal bar bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma brjod pa ni bsal bar bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is not expressed cannot be excluded.

original: de tshe spyi ni bsal bya yin //
analyzed: de tshe spyi ni bsal bya yin //
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time, the universal is to be excluded.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is because it is to be expressed.

original: 'di snyam du gal te spyi bsal bar bya ba yin pa de lta na yang ji ltar de dngos po nyid du 'grub par 'gyur snyam du sems na /üîΩde'i phyir / med pa rnams ni bsal bya min //
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te spyi bsal bar bya ba yin pa de lta na yang ji ltar de dngos po nyid du 'grub par 'gyur snyam du sems na / de'i phyir / med pa rnams ni bsal bya min //
translated: If you think in this way, ‚ÄúEven if universals are to be eliminated, how could they be established as entities?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then to respond to that, he says, ‚ÄúNon-existent things are not to be eliminated,‚Äù and so on.

original: med pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gzhan sel ba rnams so //
analyzed: med pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gzhan sel ba rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-existent things‚Äù are the exclusions.

original: gal te yin na dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yin na dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are, they would be entities.

original: 'di la 'thad pa smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la 'thad pa smras pa /
translated: To explain this, he says,

original: med pa'i med pa spangs phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: med pa'i med pa spangs phyir ro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the non-existence of non-existence is relinquished.‚Äù

original: med pa rnams kyi med pa'i ngo bo der ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: med pa rnams kyi med pa'i ngo bo der ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: The meaning is that the nature of non-existence of non-existent things is relinquished.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: gal te sel ba rnams bsal bar bya ba nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sel ba rnams bsal bar bya ba nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: If exclusions were to be eliminated,

original: de'i tshe 'di dag gi med pa'i ngo bo bkag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di dag gi med pa'i ngo bo bkag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time the nature of their non-existence would be negated.

original: de bkag pa yin na yang med pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid dor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bkag pa yin na yang med pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid dor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And if that is negated, then non-existence would relinquish its nature of non-existence.

original: de lta bas na sel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi med pa nyid kyi ngo bo do yang dor ba'i phyir dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro zhes kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na sel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi med pa nyid kyi ngo bo do yang dor ba'i phyir dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro zhes kha cig zer ro //
translated: Therefore, since the nature of non-existence, which is the characteristic of the exclusion, is also abandoned, it becomes an entity.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: med pa'i med pa spangs phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i med pa spangs phyir ro //
translated: Because of the abandonment of the non-existence of non-existence.

original: zhes bya ba ni med pa rnams kyi med ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni med pa rnams kyi med ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This means because of the non-existence of non-existences.

original: med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sel ba ni bsal bar bya ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: med pa'i rang bzhin gyi sel ba ni bsal bar bya ba mi rigs te /
translated: The exclusion that has the nature of non-existence is not suitable to be excluded,

original: dgag pa ni dngos po'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dgag pa ni dngos po'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because negation has an entity as its object.

original: de lta bas na sel ba gzhan la ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na sel ba gzhan la ste /
translated: Therefore, the exclusion of another is in another,

original: rta la sogs pa la sel ba gzhan ba lang la sogs pa'i sel ba bsal ba ste gsal po yin te /
analyzed: rta la sogs pa la sel ba gzhan ba lang la sogs pa'i sel ba bsal ba ste gsal po yin te /
translated: the exclusion of another, such as a cow, is excluded in another, such as a horse, and it is clear.

original: spyir gyur pa nyid do zhes nges pa yin no //
analyzed: spyir gyur pa nyid do zhes nges pa yin no //
translated: It is ascertained to be a universal.

original: de'i phyir spyi'i dngos po nyid du grub ste bsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi'i dngos po nyid du grub ste bsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the nature of a universal is established because it is to be excluded.

original: gzhan yang gzhan sel ba rnams phan tshun mi 'dra ba'am 'dra ba yin grang /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan sel ba rnams phan tshun mi 'dra ba'am 'dra ba yin grang /
translated: Moreover, are the exclusions of others mutually different or the same?

original: de la re zhig phyogs dang po la nyes pa bshad pa ni med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig phyogs dang po la nyes pa bshad pa ni med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: First, the error in the first position is explained by ‚ÄúIf non-existence . . .

original: med pa ste ba lang ma yin pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i med pa gang yin la ni ba lang gi sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa ste ba lang ma yin pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i med pa gang yin la ni ba lang gi sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äù The non-existence that is the referent of the word ‚Äúnon-ox‚Äù is the referent of the word ‚Äúox.‚Äù

original: gal te sngar bshad pa'i med pa de las @330a * //
analyzed: gal te sngar bshad pa'i med pa de las @330a * //
translated: If that non-existence, as previously explained,

original: mi 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba ste /
translated: were different,

original: gzhan zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then it would have the meaning of ‚Äúother.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe dngos po nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, it would become an entity,

original: dngos po ni dngos po med pa ldog pa tsam gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ni dngos po med pa ldog pa tsam gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because an entity is the nature of the mere negation of non-entity.

original: gal te mi 'dra ba ma yin na de'i tshe khyed cag la ba lang yang ba lang ma yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mi 'dra ba ma yin na de'i tshe khyed cag la ba lang yang ba lang ma yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not different, then it would follow that even an ox would be a non-ox,

original: de dang mi 'dra ba ni de'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang mi 'dra ba ni de'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: because that which is not different is not understood to be its own nature.

original: 'di snyam du ba lang dang rta la sogs pa'i sgra dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid phan tshun ldog pa yin gyi sel ba gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: 'di snyam du ba lang dang rta la sogs pa'i sgra dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid phan tshun ldog pa yin gyi sel ba gzhan ni med do //
translated: One might think as follows: The intrinsic identity of terms such as ‚Äúcow‚Äù and ‚Äúhorse‚Äù are mutually exclusive, but there is no other exclusion.

original: des na bsal bar bya ba nyid yin pas de dag dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ni mi 'dod pa ma yin no snyam du bsams na /
analyzed: des na bsal bar bya ba nyid yin pas de dag dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ni mi 'dod pa ma yin no snyam du bsams na /
translated: Therefore, since they are the objects of exclusion, it follows that they are real entities, but that is not unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir gal te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To think this, he says, ‚ÄúEven if the term ‚Äòexistent‚Äô . . . ‚Äù

original: gal te yang yod pa'i sgra las gzhan pa ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra la dngos su ri la sogs pa bsal bar bya ba grub kyi yod pa'i sgra ni med par brjod pa'i bsal bar bya ba las gzhan ba'i bsal bar bya ba yod pa ma yin
analyzed: gal te yang yod pa'i sgra las gzhan pa ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra la dngos su ri la sogs pa bsal bar bya ba grub kyi yod pa'i sgra ni med par brjod pa'i bsal bar bya ba las gzhan ba'i bsal bar bya ba yod pa ma yin
translated: Even if the terms ‚Äúcow‚Äù and so on, which are different from the term ‚Äúexistent,‚Äù directly establish the exclusion of ‚Äúnon-existent‚Äù and so on, the term ‚Äúexistent‚Äù does not have an object of exclusion that is different from the object of exclusion of ‚Äúnon-existent.‚Äù

original: no // med pa kho na bsal bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: no // med pa kho na bsal bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The point is that ‚Äúnon-existent‚Äù is not the only object of exclusion.

original: yod pa'i sgra ni med pa rnam par bcad nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i sgra ni med pa rnam par bcad nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the term ‚Äúexistent‚Äù is used to exclude non-existent.

original: de las skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the problem with that?

original: de la med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, the root text states, ‚ÄúThere is no such thing as the absence of that . . . ‚Äù

original: snga ma bzhin du med pa'i med pa'i spangs pa'i phyir med pa'i sel ba dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du med pa'i med pa'i spangs pa'i phyir med pa'i sel ba dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: As before, because the absence of the absence is rejected, the absence of the absence would become an entity.

original: de lta yin dang sel ba smra ba rnams kyis med pa yang dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i khas blangs pa dang 'gal bas kye ma dka' ba chen por lhung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang sel ba smra ba rnams kyis med pa yang dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i khas blangs pa dang 'gal bas kye ma dka' ba chen por lhung ba yin no //
translated: If that were the case, then it would follow, absurdly, that the proponents of the absence of the absence would have to accept that the absence is an entity. Alas, you have fallen into a great pit of error.

original: med pa yang yin la dngos po nyid kyang yin la rag mod ce na /
analyzed: med pa yang yin la dngos po nyid kyang yin la rag mod ce na /
translated: You may say, ‚ÄúIt is indeed an entity and an absence.‚Äù

original: de ma grub na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ma grub na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, the root text states, ‚ÄúIf that absence were not established . . . ‚Äù

original: med pa de ma grub na dngos po 'ga' zhig gi yang yod pa 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa de ma grub na dngos po 'ga' zhig gi yang yod pa 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that absence were not established, then the existence of any entity would not be established.

original: khyed cag gi lugs kyis de'i mtshan nyid med pa rnam par bcad nas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyed cag gi lugs kyis de'i mtshan nyid med pa rnam par bcad nas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because, according to your system, the absence of the absence would be a characteristic that is excluded from the entity.

original: dngos po med pa de bsal bar bya ba nyid yin na dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa'i phyir med pa yang mi grub ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa de bsal bar bya ba nyid yin na dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa'i phyir med pa yang mi grub ste /
translated: If that non-thing were itself an object of refutation, it would follow that it is a thing, and because it is not established as its own nature, non-existence is not established.

original: de ni med pa rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / yod pa yang ji skad du bshad pas mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni med pa rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / yod pa yang ji skad du bshad pas mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of the exclusion of non-existence, and because existence is not tenable as previously explained.

original: bsal bya phyi rol gnas pa yis //
analyzed: bsal bya phyi rol gnas pa yis //
translated: The external object that is the object of refutationüîΩis not different from the refuting cognition.

original: de ni 'byed ces bya ba la sogs pa sngar smras pa gang yin pa dang / gang yang /
analyzed: de ni 'byed ces bya ba la sogs pa sngar smras pa gang yin pa dang / gang yang /
translated: This is what was said previously, and also:

original: sel ba rnams kyi tha dad pa //
analyzed: sel ba rnams kyi tha dad pa //
translated: The difference of exclusions

original: yod min dngos po min @330b phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la sangs rgyas pa kha cig gis lan smras pa /
analyzed: yod min dngos po min @330b phyir ro // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la sangs rgyas pa kha cig gis lan smras pa /
translated: does not exist because they are not things.

original: bsal bar bya ba tha dad pa'i rten tha dad pas sel ba rnams tha dad pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bsal bar bya ba tha dad pa'i rten tha dad pas sel ba rnams tha dad pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: In response to that, some Buddhists say: The difference of exclusions is not due to the difference of the bases that are the objects of refutation.

original: 'on kyang thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'jug pa sna tshogs pa don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro bas de kho na nyid du yul med na yung yul tha dad pa lta bur dmigs
analyzed: 'on kyang thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'jug pa sna tshogs pa don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro bas de kho na nyid du yul med na yung yul tha dad pa lta bur dmigs
translated: However, since beginningless time, it has been associated with the special latent propensities of various kinds of non-factual conceptual thoughts. Therefore, if the object does not exist in reality, it is perceived as if it were a separate object.

original: pa'i shes ba dag gis phyi rol gyi don tha dad pa dag la tha dad pa lta bu dang don gyi bdag nyid lta bu'i rang bzhin med pa'i sel ba sgro 'dogs par byed de /üîΩde dag kyang de dag gis de ltar sgro btags pa'i tha dad pa dang yod par snang la /
analyzed: pa'i shes ba dag gis phyi rol gyi don tha dad pa dag la tha dad pa lta bu dang don gyi bdag nyid lta bu'i rang bzhin med pa'i sel ba sgro 'dogs par byed de / de dag kyang de dag gis de ltar sgro btags pa'i tha dad pa dang yod par snang la /
translated: However, since beginningless time, consciousness has been conditioned by the habitual tendencies of various kinds of thoughts that do not correspond to the way things are. Therefore, if the object does not exist in reality, the consciousnesses that perceive it as if it were a separate object superimpose a nature of separateness and the nature of an object onto separate external objects.üîΩSince they appear to be separate and existent in that way, the superimposition of separateness and existence is due to the different habitual tendencies.

original: des na sel ba rnams bag chags tha dad bas tha dad pa dang yod pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la yod pa'i ngo bo'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: des na sel ba rnams bag chags tha dad bas tha dad pa dang yod pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la yod pa'i ngo bo'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is what the opponent thinks, and so the root text says, ‚ÄúBut if the nature of existence is . . .‚Äù

original: 'di snyam du dngos po med pa la ni bag chags zhes bya ba yod pa min no snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dngos po med pa la ni bag chags zhes bya ba yod pa min no snyam du sems te /
translated: The opponent thinks that if something is nonexistent, it cannot be a habitual tendency.

original: yul med pa'i shes pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par shes pa smra ba dpyad par gtan la phab zin to //
analyzed: yul med pa'i shes pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par shes pa smra ba dpyad par gtan la phab zin to //
translated: There is no consciousness without an object. This has been established in the investigation of the proponents of consciousness.

original: de lta yin dang don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams mi rung ba'i phyir des bsgom pa'i bag chags su yang ga las 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta yin dang don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams mi rung ba'i phyir des bsgom pa'i bag chags su yang ga las 'gyur /
translated: If that were so, then it would be impossible for there to be conceptual consciousnesses that do not correspond to real things. How could there be predispositions created by such conceptual consciousnesses?

original: med la zhes bya ba ni dmigs par 'gyur ba'i dngos po med pa la ste /
analyzed: med la zhes bya ba ni dmigs par 'gyur ba'i dngos po med pa la ste /
translated: ‚Äú In the absence of‚Äù means in the absence of an object that would be its object.

original: yul med pa'i shes pa mi rung bas bag chags 'jog par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir bag chags ga la yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul med pa'i shes pa mi rung bas bag chags 'jog par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir bag chags ga la yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since it is impossible for there to be a consciousness without an object, how could there be predispositions, since there is no consciousness that deposits predispositions?

original: de lta yin dang bag chags med pa'i phyir bag chags kyis byas pa'i sel ba rnams kyi tha dad pa'am yod pa'i ngo bor ga las 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang bag chags med pa'i phyir bag chags kyis byas pa'i sel ba rnams kyi tha dad pa'am yod pa'i ngo bor ga las 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: If that were so, then since there would be no predispositions, how could there be the different effects of predispositions, such as the elimination of the afflictions?

original: de ltar re zhig brjod par bya bar mngon par 'dod pa'i sel ba bsal nas rjod par byed par mngon par 'dod pa yang bsal bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig brjod par bya bar mngon par 'dod pa'i sel ba bsal nas rjod par byed par mngon par 'dod pa yang bsal bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Thus, having eliminated the object of expression that is desired to be expressed, the one who desires to express also should be eliminated.

original: khyed kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyed kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúYour words,‚Äù and so on.

original: sgra dag gi tha dad pa spyi brjod pa dang khyad par brjod pa phan tshun du tha dad pa ni sgra'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: sgra dag gi tha dad pa spyi brjod pa dang khyad par brjod pa phan tshun du tha dad pa ni sgra'i dbye ba'o //
translated: The difference of the words is the difference of the expression of the general and the expression of the particular.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan can zhes bya ba ni bag chags tha dad pa'am brjod par bya bsal ba tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can de rgyu 'di la yod pas de'i rgyu mchan can no //üîΩ'on te sgra rnams kyi rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir dang / 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir @331a * //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan can zhes bya ba ni bag chags tha dad pa'am brjod par bya bsal ba tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can de rgyu 'di la yod pas de'i rgyu mchan can no // 'on te sgra rnams kyi rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir dang / 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir @331a * //
translated: The reason for that is the reason for the difference of the latent potentialities or the difference of the object of expression. Since that reason exists in this cause, it is the reason for that.

original: tha dad du mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa yin na zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad du mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa yin na zhe na /
translated: But if the difference is established by direct perception because the causes of the words are different and because they possess contradictory properties,

original: thun mong min sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thun mong min sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then he says, ‚ÄúThe uncommon words,‚Äù and so on.

original: rjod par byed pa'i sgra'i dbang du byas nas 'di brjod de /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa'i sgra'i dbang du byas nas 'di brjod de /
translated: The following is stated from the perspective of the sound that expresses:

original: gang zhig rna ba'i rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid thun mong ma yin pa'i sgra ni rjod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig rna ba'i rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid thun mong ma yin pa'i sgra ni rjod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The sound that is the uncommon specific characteristic that is apprehended by auditory consciousness does not express.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngar ma mthong ba'i phyir ra zhas bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sngar ma mthong ba'i phyir ra zhas bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it was not seen before, it is said.

original: tha snyad kyi dus su gnas pa'i sgra gang yin pa de ni tha snyad kyi dus su sngar brda'i dus su ma mthong la /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dus su gnas pa'i sgra gang yin pa de ni tha snyad kyi dus su sngar brda'i dus su ma mthong la /
translated: The sound that exists at the time of conventional activity was not seen at the time of the convention, at the time of the convention.

original: ma mthong ba gang yin pa de ni 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba gang yin pa de ni 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which was not seen is long past, having ceased.

original: des na tha snyad du byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: des na tha snyad du byed pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore it is not used in conventional activity.

original: brda'i dus na ma mthong ba gang yin pa des tha snyad du byed pa rigs pa yang ma yin to /
analyzed: brda'i dus na ma mthong ba gang yin pa des tha snyad du byed pa rigs pa yang ma yin to /
translated: It is also not logical that that which was not seen at the time of the convention is used in conventional activity.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: de lta bas na rang gi mtshan nyid rjod par byed pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na rang gi mtshan nyid rjod par byed pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore it is not the specific characteristic that expresses.

original: 'di la ni khyed cag dang yang rtsod pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ni khyed cag dang yang rtsod pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But you do not dispute this.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: don dang sgra yi khyad par ni //
analyzed: don dang sgra yi khyad par ni //
translated: The difference between the referent and the word

original: brjod bya rjod byed nyid mi 'dod //
analyzed: brjod bya rjod byed nyid mi 'dod //
translated: is not accepted as the expressed and the expresser.

original: de ni snga rol ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: de ni snga rol ma mthong phyir //
translated: Because it is not seen prior to that,

original: spyi nyid nye bar bstan pa yin //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: spyi nyid nye bar bstan pa yin // zhes bshad do //
translated: the universal itself is taught.

original: de lta bas na rjod par byed pa'i sgra'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na rjod par byed pa'i sgra'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Thus, since we are speaking from the perspective of the expressing word, there is no fault.

original: de la de ltar gnas pa la ji ltar don gzhan sal ba'i don gyi spyi yin pa bzhin du gal te sgra gzhan sel ba sgra'i don spyi yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de la de ltar gnas pa la ji ltar don gzhan sal ba'i don gyi spyi yin pa bzhin du gal te sgra gzhan sel ba sgra'i don spyi yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: In that case, just as the referent is the universal of the exclusion of other things, if the word is the universal of the exclusion of other words, then, as explained earlier,

original: 'dres dang gcig nyid sna tshogs kyi //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis brjod bya'i sel ba bzhin du sgra'i sel ba yang phan tshun tha dad pa grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dres dang gcig nyid sna tshogs kyi // zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis brjod bya'i sel ba bzhin du sgra'i sel ba yang phan tshun tha dad pa grub pa ma yin te /
translated: the expressed and the expresser are mixed,üîΩand the various words are the same, and so on.

original: ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The exclusion of the expressed is established as mutually distinct, but the exclusion of the word is not established as mutually distinct, because it has no nature.

original: ji ltar rjod par byed pa rnams phan tshun tha dad pa mi 'thad pa de bzhin du brjod par bya ba dang rjod bar byed pa phan tshun gcig la gcig tha dad du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ji ltar rjod par byed pa rnams phan tshun tha dad pa mi 'thad pa de bzhin du brjod par bya ba dang rjod bar byed pa phan tshun gcig la gcig tha dad du mi 'thad de /
translated: Just as it is untenable that the expressions are mutually different, so it is untenable that the expressed and the expression are mutually different from each other,

original: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are essenceless.

original: 'di snyam du bsal bar bya ba tha dad pas tha dad par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du bsal bar bya ba tha dad pas tha dad par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that they are different because the objects are different,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩIf the objects are different,

original: bsal bar bya ba tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bsal bar bya ba tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the expressions would be different.üîΩBut the expressions are not different.üîΩHow could the objects be different?

original: ji ltar bsal bar bya ba tha dad pas kyang tha dad du mi 'thad pa de ltar ni /üîΩde ni rang las khyad par med //
analyzed: ji ltar bsal bar bya ba tha dad pas kyang tha dad du mi 'thad pa de ltar ni / de ni rang las khyad par med //
translated: Just as it is untenable that they are different because the objects are different,üîΩit has already been explained that

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas bstan zin to //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas bstan zin to //
translated: ‚Äúit is not different from itself.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de ltar dam bca' ba la grags pa dang khas blangs pas gnod par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dam bca' ba la grags pa dang khas blangs pas gnod par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus it has been shown that the thesis is undermined by what is commonly acknowledged and by what the opponent accepts.

original: da ni brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa med pas thal bar 'gyur bas @331b khas blangs pas gnod pa la sogs pa'i skyon bstan par 'dod nas tshang ma dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa med pas thal bar 'gyur bas @331b khas blangs pas gnod pa la sogs pa'i skyon bstan par 'dod nas tshang ma dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: by the consequence of the nonexistence of the expressed and the expresser,

original: khyed kyi phyogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyed kyi phyogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn your position, etc.‚Äù

original: gang dag dngos po med pa de dag la ni go bar bya ba dang go bar byad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag dngos po med pa de dag la ni go bar bya ba dang go bar byad pa ma yin te /
translated: Those which are non-entities are not the expressed and the expresser,

original: nam mkha'i me tog dang ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog dang ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: like a sky-flower and a rabbit‚Äôs horns.

original: khyed cag gi brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i sel ba yang dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: khyed cag gi brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i sel ba yang dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The exclusion of the expressed and the expresser in your position is a non-entity. This is the observation of a contradictory exclusion.

original: 'on te sprin med pa las char ba med par rtogs pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sprin med pa las char ba med par rtogs pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But, if one understands that there is no rain from a cloudless sky, is the reason not indeterminate?

original: gal te char dang sprin med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te char dang sprin med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúIf there is no rain, etc.,‚Äù

original: char dang sprin dag med pa ni yod pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: char dang sprin dag med pa ni yod pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The absence of rain and clouds is not existent,

original: med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which is to say, it is nonexistent.

original: bstan pa ni dngos po gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa ni dngos po gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching is primary, because it is the principal thing.

original: char 'bab pa dang sprin med pa de dag mthong na ste /
analyzed: char 'bab pa dang sprin med pa de dag mthong na ste /
translated: When rain and clouds are seen,

original: go bya go byed ces bya ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: go bya go byed ces bya ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: the one who understands and the one who is understood are taken as the subject.

original: gal te sangs rgyas pa dngos po med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges so zhes smra ba de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas pa dngos po med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges so zhes smra ba de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the reason ‚Äúbecause of the nonexistence of things‚Äù is indefinite, that is also unreasonable.

original: 'di ltar de dag gis dben pa'i nam mkha' dang snang ba'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'dor nged kyi phyogs la char 'bab pa dang sprin med pa'i sbyor ba la yang yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gis dben pa'i nam mkha' dang snang ba'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'dor nged kyi phyogs la char 'bab pa dang sprin med pa'i sbyor ba la yang yod pa nyid de /
translated: Because in our position, the entity that is the nature of the sky and light that is devoid of those is established as existent in the proof of the absence of rain and clouds.

original: med pa ni dngos po nyid du bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa ni dngos po nyid du bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nonexistence is already established as an entity.

original: khyed cag sangs rgyas pa'i phyogs la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khyed cag sangs rgyas pa'i phyogs la 'di lta ste /
translated: In your Buddhist position,

original: char 'bab pa dang sprin med pa dag go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa ga las te ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: char 'bab pa dang sprin med pa dag go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa ga las te ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: How could the absence of rain and the absence of clouds be the object understood and the means of understanding? They could not!

original: 'ang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan du 'di zhes bya ba'i mjug tu 'brel par bya'o //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan du 'di zhes bya ba'i mjug tu 'brel par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù should be connected to the end of the phrase ‚Äúit is not tenable.‚Äù

original: des na don 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na don 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: khyed cag gi rtsod pa gzhir 'gyur ba'i sel ba dag go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa nyid du mi rigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad /
analyzed: khyed cag gi rtsod pa gzhir 'gyur ba'i sel ba dag go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa nyid du mi rigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad /
translated: Not only is it that the exclusion that is the basis of your debate is not tenable as the object understood and the means of understanding,

original: char mi 'bab pa dang sgrin med pa 'di dag kyang go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa nyid du mi rigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba min no //
analyzed: char mi 'bab pa dang sgrin med pa 'di dag kyang go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa nyid du mi rigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba min no //
translated: it is also that the absence of rain and the absence of clouds are not tenable as the object understood and the means of understanding.üîΩMoreover, you say that words and signs in which the reverse is primary and the forward pervasion is not primary are the means of understanding their objects.

original: gzhan yang khyed cag gi gang zhig rjes su 'gro ba gtso bo ma yin zhing ldog pa gtso che ba'i sgra dang rtags dag rang gi yul rtogs par byed pa nyid du smra ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed cag gi gang zhig rjes su 'gro ba gtso bo ma yin zhing ldog pa gtso che ba'i sgra dang rtags dag rang gi yul rtogs par byed pa nyid du smra ste /
translated: You also say:

original: gang yang / ma mthong gzhan gyi sgra don la //
analyzed: gang yang / ma mthong gzhan gyi sgra don la //
translated: The meaning of the words of others that are not seen

original: rang don cha yang mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rang don cha yang mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: because it is seen to have a part for one‚Äôs own benefit.

original: sgra yi 'brel pa nges pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sgra yi 'brel pa nges pa'i phyir //
translated: because the connection with the word is ascertained,

original: 'khrul pa yod pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yod pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: and because there is no error.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de gzhan sel ba khas len na mi rigs so zhes bya ba 'di bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de gzhan sel ba khas len na mi rigs so zhes bya ba 'di bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: If one accepts the exclusion of other, this is unreasonable.

original: gang gis bsgrub pa'i zhes bya ba la @332a * //
analyzed: gang gis bsgrub pa'i zhes bya ba la @332a * //
translated: In order to prove this, he says, ‚ÄúBy what is it proved? ‚Äù

original: sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: de sngon 'gro zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de sngon 'gro zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: He means that the proof is a prerequisite.

original: ldog pa ni sgrub pa las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa ni sgrub pa las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The definition of the exclusion is the opposite of the proof.

original: gzhan yang sel ba smra ba rnams kyi autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra dag gi khyad par dang / khyad par can gyi dngos po dang gzhi mthun pa'i 'jig rten na grags pa gang yin pa de la bsnyon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang sel ba smra ba rnams kyi autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra dag gi khyad par dang / khyad par can gyi dngos po dang gzhi mthun pa'i 'jig rten na grags pa gang yin pa de la bsnyon par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, for those who advocate the exclusion, the distinction of the words ‚Äúblue lotus‚Äù and so on, and the common locus of the distinguished and the distinguisher, which is well known in the world, would be denied.

original: de yang 'di skad du khyad par can dang gzhi mthun pa bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad du khyad par can dang gzhi mthun pa bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: And that is because, in order to prove the distinguished and the common locus,

original: gsal bya'i dbye bas phye ba'i don //
analyzed: gsal bya'i dbye bas phye ba'i don //
translated: The meaning distinguished by the distinction of what is to be manifested

original: rang don tha dad rtogs la blun //
analyzed: rang don tha dad rtogs la blun //
translated: Is foolish with respect to the realization of the individual meanings.

original: gcig phyir 'bras bu tha dad phyir //
analyzed: gcig phyir 'bras bu tha dad phyir //
translated: Because of unity, because of the difference of effects,

original: khyad par khyad par can dag gi / de tsam zhig ni 'dod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: khyad par khyad par can dag gi / de tsam zhig ni 'dod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the mere assertion of the distinction and the distinguished,

original: rang spyis tha dad spangs pa yin //
analyzed: rang spyis tha dad spangs pa yin //
translated: The difference of the individual and the universal is abandoned.

original: the tsham za phyir mi 'dzin pa //
analyzed: the tsham za phyir mi 'dzin pa //
translated: Because of doubt, it is not apprehended.

original: de dag mtshungs pas don gcig nyid //
analyzed: de dag mtshungs pas don gcig nyid //
translated: Because of the similarity of those, there is the very identity of meaning.

original: ces brjod pa ni de mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ces brjod pa ni de mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is not tenable, he says,

original: gal te gzhan sel ba tsam zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: gal te gzhan sel ba tsam zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: If it is said that ‚Äúit is the mere exclusion of other,‚Äù etc.

original: sngar don dag gi khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po bkag nas /
analyzed: sngar don dag gi khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po bkag nas /
translated: Previously, the nature of the distinction and the distinguished with regard to objects was refuted.

original: nga ni sgra dag gi yang 'gegs pa'i phyir zlog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nga ni sgra dag gi yang 'gegs pa'i phyir zlog pa ma yin no //
translated: I am not refuting the words themselves.

original: de la phan tshun rnam par gcad par bya ba dang gcod par byed pa'i dngos po ni khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po yin no //
analyzed: de la phan tshun rnam par gcad par bya ba dang gcod par byed pa'i dngos po ni khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po yin no //
translated: In this regard, the nature of mutual exclusion and that which is to be excluded is the nature of the distinction and the distinguished.

original: de yang dper na autpala sngon po zhes bya ba lta bu'i ngag nyid la rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: de yang dper na autpala sngon po zhes bya ba lta bu'i ngag nyid la rnam par gzhag la /
translated: For example, the word ‚Äúblue-lotus‚Äù is established in relation to the word ‚Äúblue‚Äù and the word ‚Äúlotus.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du gzhi tha dad pa la yang yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhi tha dad pa la yang yin te /
translated: Similarly, it is also the case with different bases.

original: dper na rgyal po'i skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyal po'i skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the word ‚Äúking‚Äôs man‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dug pa'i rgyu mtshan tha dad pa'i sgra dag don gcig la 'jug pa ni gzhi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'dug pa'i rgyu mtshan tha dad pa'i sgra dag don gcig la 'jug pa ni gzhi mthun pa'o //
translated: The words that have different bases for their causes of designation are synonyms.

original: de yang autpala sngon po la sogs pa lta bur bsdu ba nyid la 'jog go //
analyzed: de yang autpala sngon po la sogs pa lta bur bsdu ba nyid la 'jog go //
translated: And that is established as the inclusion of the word ‚Äúblue-lotus‚Äù and so on.

original: de la tshogs pa'i don brjod pa'i autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra dag la de'i gzhi mthun pa gang yin pa de nyid mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de la tshogs pa'i don brjod pa'i autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra dag la de'i gzhi mthun pa gang yin pa de nyid mi 'grub ste /
translated: In that regard, the word ‚Äúblue-lotus‚Äù and so on that express the meaning of a collection do not establish a common locus.

original: tshogs pa'i don ni sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i don ni sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of a collection is a variety.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: tshogs pa brjod par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: tshogs pa brjod par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to express a collection,üîΩit is not just blue.üîΩIt is not just a lotus.

original: de ni sngon po 'ba' zhig min //
analyzed: de ni sngon po 'ba' zhig min //
translated: It is not just a stalk.üîΩIt is not just a leaf.üîΩIt is not just a filament.üîΩIt is not just a flower.üîΩIt is not just a fruit.üîΩIt is not just a tree.üîΩIt is not just a grove.üîΩIt is not just a pond.üîΩIt is not just a lake.üîΩIt is not just a river.üîΩIt is not just a stream.üîΩIt is not just a spring.üîΩIt is not just a cloud.üîΩIt is not just a rain.üîΩIt is not just a water-wheel.üîΩIt is not just a water-mill.üîΩIt is not just a water-mill-wheel.üîΩIt is not just a water-mill-wheel-hole.üîΩIt is not just a water-mill-wheel-hole-water-drop.üîΩIt is not just a water-drop-hole.

original: autpala gcig pu'ang ma yin te //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: autpala gcig pu'ang ma yin te // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is not just a hole.üîΩIt is not just a water-mill-wheel.üîΩIt is not just a water-mill.üîΩIt is not just a stream.üîΩIt is not just a spring.üîΩIt is not just a river.üîΩIt is not just a lake.üîΩIt is not just a pond.üîΩIt is not just a grove.üîΩIt is not just a tree.

original: ci'i phyir 'grub par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'grub par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: It is not just a fruit.üîΩIt is not just a flower.üîΩIt is not just a filament.üîΩIt is not just a leaf.üîΩIt is not just a stalk.üîΩIt is not just a lotus.üîΩIt is not just blue.

original: sngon po min pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgang gi phyir sngon po ma yin pa nyid bkag pa na autpala ma yin pa bkag pa ma yin la /
analyzed: sngon po min pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang gi phyir sngon po ma yin pa nyid bkag pa na autpala ma yin pa bkag pa ma yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúNot blue,‚Äù etc.üîΩBecause when ‚Äúnot blue‚Äù is refuted, ‚Äúnot lotus‚Äù is not refuted.

original: de la autpala ma yin pa bkag pa na cig shos sngon po ma yin @332b pa bkag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de la autpala ma yin pa bkag pa na cig shos sngon po ma yin @332b pa bkag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And when ‚Äúnot lotus‚Äù is refuted, ‚Äúnot blue‚Äù is not refuted.

original: la lar cig shos ma zhes mo rtags su 'don pa de ni gsal ba'i sgra la ltos par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: la lar cig shos ma zhes mo rtags su 'don pa de ni gsal ba'i sgra la ltos par blta bar bya ste /
translated: In some places, ‚Äúnot the other‚Äù is taken as a negative particle. That should be regarded as depending on the term ‚Äúmanifest.‚Äù

original: cig shos sngon po ma yin pa bkag pa min zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cig shos sngon po ma yin pa bkag pa min zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: ‚Äúnot the other, not blue, is not refuted.‚Äù

original: 'di dag la phan tshun rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag la phan tshun rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And these two do not have the relation of mutual support,

original: ngo bo med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngo bo med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because they do not exist.

original: 'brel pa med par yang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa med par yang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: And without a relation, the relation of qualifier and qualificand is not tenable,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that anything could be related to anything.

original: 'di ni khyed kyi lugs kyi sgra rnams tshogs pa'i don brjod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni khyed kyi lugs kyi sgra rnams tshogs pa'i don brjod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: This is because, according to your system, the meaning of the collection of words is not expressed.

original: thams cad kyang med ba brjod par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang med ba brjod par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because all of them express the nonexistent.

original: de lta bas na khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the relation of qualifier and qualificand is not tenable.

original: 'di snyam du don dag khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos por ma gyur mod /
analyzed: 'di snyam du don dag khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos por ma gyur mod /
translated: If you think that although the meanings are not the relation of qualifier and qualificand,

original: de rjod par byed pa'i sgra'i sgra dag ci'i phyir mi 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de rjod par byed pa'i sgra'i sgra dag ci'i phyir mi 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: why are the words that express them not that?

original: brjod par bya ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause of the object to be expressed, etc.‚Äù

original: brjod par bya ba'i sgo nas de rjod par byed pa'i sgra dag gi khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos por btags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i sgo nas de rjod par byed pa'i sgra dag gi khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos por btags pa yin gyi /
translated: The relation of qualifier and qualificand is imputed to the words that express them because of the object to be expressed.

original: de'i bya ba med na rjod par byed pa yang ga las yin /
analyzed: de'i bya ba med na rjod par byed pa yang ga las yin /
translated: If there is no activity of that, how could there be an expression?

original: gzhi mthun ba sun dbyung ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: gzhi mthun ba sun dbyung ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to refute a common locus, he says,

original: tha dad phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tha dad phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúBecause they are different, etc.

original: don gcig la 'jug pa yin na gzhi mthun par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: don gcig la 'jug pa yin na gzhi mthun par 'gyur gyi /
