translated: If they applied to the same object, they would have a common locus.

original: autpala dang sngon po'i sgra dag ni don gcig la 'jug pa srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: autpala dang sngon po'i sgra dag ni don gcig la 'jug pa srid pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not possible for the words ‚Äúlotus‚Äù and ‚Äúblue‚Äù to apply to the same object,

original: de'i brjod par bya ba autpala ma yin pa dang sngon po ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis sel ba dag ni tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i brjod par bya ba autpala ma yin pa dang sngon po ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis sel ba dag ni tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their referents are different, since they are distinguished by the exclusion of what is not a lotus and what is not blue.

original: 'di ltar khyed cag nyid kyis na //üîΩgsal bya'i dbye bas tha dad don //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed cag nyid kyis na // gsal bya'i dbye bas tha dad don //
translated: In this way, you yourself have explained:

original: zhes bshad do ;
analyzed: zhes bshad do ;
translated: The object is different, due to the difference in what is to be expressed.

original: / sbyor ba ni sngon po dang autpala la sogs pa'i sgra dag ni gzhi mthun pa'i tha snyad kyi yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: / sbyor ba ni sngon po dang autpala la sogs pa'i sgra dag ni gzhi mthun pa'i tha snyad kyi yul can ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: The words ‚Äúblue‚Äù and ‚Äúlotus‚Äù are not the objects of a convention that has a common locus,

original: yul tha dad pa'i phyir bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa'i phyir bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //
translated: because they have different referents, like the words ‚Äúpot‚Äù and ‚Äúcloth.‚Äù

original: ci ste yang don gang kho na la autpala ma yin pa rnam par gcod par 'jug ba kho na la sngon po ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa yang gnas pas de'i phyir sngon po dang autpala'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i sel ba dag don gcig la 'jug
analyzed: ci ste yang don gang kho na la autpala ma yin pa rnam par gcod par 'jug ba kho na la sngon po ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa yang gnas pas de'i phyir sngon po dang autpala'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i sel ba dag don gcig la 'jug
translated: But if you think that the exclusion of non-blue is present in just that object to which the word ‚Äúlotus‚Äù is applied, then the exclusion of the expressible object of the words ‚Äúblue‚Äù and ‚Äúlotus‚Äù would be present in the same object.

original: ba'i phyir sgra dag kyang don gyi sgo can gzhi mthun par bstan par bya'o snyam na /
analyzed: ba'i phyir sgra dag kyang don gyi sgo can gzhi mthun par bstan par bya'o snyam na /
translated: Therefore, the words would also be shown to have a common locus, since they have the same object.üîΩTo respond:üîΩ‚ÄúIf the exclusion of otherüîΩis the object of words,

original: de'i phyir gal te don las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te don las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the words ‚Äòblue‚Äô and ‚Äòlotus‚ÄôüîΩwould have a common locus.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa'o //üîΩde @333a * //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa'o // de @333a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the common locus.

original: dag ces bya ba ni sngon po ma yin pa dang autpala ma yin pa bkag ba ngag go //
analyzed: dag ces bya ba ni sngon po ma yin pa dang autpala ma yin pa bkag ba ngag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the exclusion of non-blue and the exclusion of non-lotus.

original: de dag gi rten dang brten pa dngos po ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi rten dang brten pa dngos po ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The actual basis and that which is based on it do not exist at all.

original: ngo bo med pa la gang du yang rten mi srid pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: ngo bo med pa la gang du yang rten mi srid pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: Because it is impossible for anything to be based on that which is essenceless, like the son of a barren woman.

original: gzhan yang autpala sngon po la sogs pa dag la de dag rten dang brten pa yin pa de lta na yang de yod na yang sgra dag gis bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang autpala sngon po la sogs pa dag la de dag rten dang brten pa yin pa de lta na yang de yod na yang sgra dag gis bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Moreover, even though the blue lotus and so on are the basis and the based, even when they exist, they are not the referents of words.

original: thun mong min dngos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thun mong min dngos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúThe uncommon thing,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir re zhig autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i dngos po de nyid sgras go bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir re zhig autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i dngos po de nyid sgras go bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Because the thing itself, such as the blue lotus, is not the referent of words,

original: der rnam par rtog pa thams cad nub pa'i phyir zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: der rnam par rtog pa thams cad nub pa'i phyir zhes bstan zin to //
translated: it has been demonstrated that all conceptualization has subsided in that.

original: de lta yin dang rten du gyur pa'i dngos po de la shes par de'i rten gyi sel ba dag de'i don nyid du ji ltar gzung bar nus /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rten du gyur pa'i dngos po de la shes par de'i rten gyi sel ba dag de'i don nyid du ji ltar gzung bar nus /
translated: If that is so, how can the exclusion of that which is the basis be apprehended as the referent of the word, since the thing that is the basis is not the referent of the word?

original: chos 'dzin pa ni chos can 'dzin pa med pa na 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'dzin pa ni chos can 'dzin pa med pa na 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The reason is because the apprehension of the property is not possible without the apprehension of the subject.

original: yang ci ste thun mong ma yin pa las ldog pa de dag las gzhan pa'i rten nyid yod de /
analyzed: yang ci ste thun mong ma yin pa las ldog pa de dag las gzhan pa'i rten nyid yod de /
translated: But if the uncommon thing is the basis of the exclusion of that which is other than it,

original: des na skyon 'dir mi 'gyur ro snyam na /üîΩkhyed la gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: des na skyon 'dir mi 'gyur ro snyam na / khyed la gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you think that this fault does not arise, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says:üîΩMoreover, for you

original: khyed la zhes bya ba ni khyed cag gi'o //
analyzed: khyed la zhes bya ba ni khyed cag gi'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúfor you‚Äù means ‚Äúfor you Proponents of Entity.‚Äù

original: 'di snyam du gal te don gcig la rtog pa de na yang dngos po gnas pas gnas pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te don gcig la rtog pa de na yang dngos po gnas pas gnas pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that if there is a conceptual thought about a single object, then it is an entity that abides, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says:

original: go bya min pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: go bya min pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is not an object of knowledge.

original: don gcig ces bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: don gcig ces bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa nyid la'o //
translated: A single object refers to a common locus.

original: gang du nye bar mkho zhes bya ba ni gang du yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: gang du nye bar mkho zhes bya ba ni gang du yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Where is it useful? Nowhere.

original: yod na yang mi shes pa ni sgra'i tha snyad la yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod na yang mi shes pa ni sgra'i tha snyad la yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it exists, it is not known because it is not a part of linguistic conventions.

original: ci ste yang gal te ldog pa tsam sgras brjod pa de'i tshe skyon 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste yang gal te ldog pa tsam sgras brjod pa de'i tshe skyon 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: But if you think that if a word expresses mere negation, then this fault arises,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says:

original: gang gi phyir ldog pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po brjod bya yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ldog pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po brjod bya yin te /
translated: For you, the object of expression is an entity that possesses negation.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa gnyis kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i sgra dag sel ba dang ldan pa'i dngos po gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid yod pa kho na'o snyam na de'i phyir /üîΩci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa gnyis kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i sgra dag sel ba dang ldan pa'i dngos po gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid yod pa kho na'o snyam na de'i phyir / ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, since the words that have the distinction of the two negations apply to the one thing that has the exclusion, there is a common locus.üîΩTo respond to that, he says, ‚ÄúBut if you accept that the thing that has the exclusion is the object of expression, then it is difficult to find the basis for the application of the word blue to the blue lotus, etc.‚Äù

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni sel ba dang ldan pa'i dngos po brjod bya nyid du khas len na sngon po la sogs pa tha dad pa dag dang autpala la sogs pa dag gi sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra dag gis khyad par de 'phen pa rnyed
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni sel ba dang ldan pa'i dngos po brjod bya nyid du khas len na sngon po la sogs pa tha dad pa dag dang autpala la sogs pa dag gi sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra dag gis khyad par de 'phen pa rnyed
translated: There, ‚Äúbut‚Äù means that if you accept that the thing that has the exclusion is the object of expression, then it is difficult to find the basis for the application of the words blue, etc., to the different things, such as the blue lotus, etc.

original: par dka'o // ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: par dka'o // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i @333b sgra ni gzhan dbang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i @333b sgra ni gzhan dbang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the words blue, etc., are dependent.

original: de ni bzlog pa nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i don brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni bzlog pa nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i don brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: That is because the word blue indicates the opposite, and it expresses the object that has that.

original: dngos su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos su ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not direct.

original: des na dngos su ma brjod pa'i phyir de la yod pa'i khyad par 'phen pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na dngos su ma brjod pa'i phyir de la yod pa'i khyad par 'phen pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, since it is not directly expressed, it does not imply a distinction that exists in it.

original: mngar ba'i sgras dkar ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mngar ba'i sgras dkar ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the word sweet.

original: gal te yang dkar po la sogs pa la mngar ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gnas pa yod ba de lta na yang sgras dngos su brjod pa'i don la yod pa'i khyad par 'phen par nus kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang dkar po la sogs pa la mngar ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gnas pa yod ba de lta na yang sgras dngos su brjod pa'i don la yod pa'i khyad par 'phen par nus kyi /
translated: Even if there were a distinction of sweetness, etc. in white, etc., still the word is able to imply a distinction that exists in the object that is directly expressed by it.

original: gzhan gyi dbang la don la yod pa ma brjod pa ni ma yin no sam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la don la yod pa ma brjod pa ni ma yin no sam du bsams pa'o //
translated: But it is not able to imply that which exists in the object of another word.

original: de lta yin dang sngon po la sogs pa'i sgras de la yod pa'i khyad par mi spong ba'i phyir autpala la sogs pa rnams la de'i khyad par nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang sngon po la sogs pa'i sgras de la yod pa'i khyad par mi spong ba'i phyir autpala la sogs pa rnams la de'i khyad par nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If that were so, then since the word blue, etc. does not exclude the distinction that exists in it, the distinction of that would not exist in the lotuses, etc.

original: de'i khyad par nyid ma yin na gzhi mthun pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /üîΩde ni rigs dang ldan pa tsam gyi phyogs la /
analyzed: de'i khyad par nyid ma yin na gzhi mthun pa nyid du mi 'gyur te / de ni rigs dang ldan pa tsam gyi phyogs la /
translated: If it were not that distinction, there would be no common locus.

original: sgra yis de ldan rjod byed min //
analyzed: sgra yis de ldan rjod byed min //
translated: That is, the word does not express that which possesses it, merely as a member of the same class.

original: rang dbang can gyi yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang dbang can gyi yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is independent.

original: zhes khyed kyis skyon brjod pa gang yin pa de ldog pa dang ldan pa tsam gyi phyogs la yang mtshungs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes khyed kyis skyon brjod pa gang yin pa de ldog pa dang ldan pa tsam gyi phyogs la yang mtshungs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Whatever fault you have stated is similar in the case of the position that it is mere possession of the opposite.üîΩIn this way, the meaning of the word is mere possession of the class, and the substance that indicates the nature of the class is stated, but not directly, because it does not imply the particularities of the pot that exist in it.

original: 'di ltar rigs dang ldan pa tsam gyi sgra'i don la rigs kyi rang gi ngo bo nye bar mtshon pa'i rdzas brjod kyi dngos su ni ma yin pa'i phyir de la yod pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i khyad par mi 'phen pa'i phyir de'i khyad par nyid ma
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs dang ldan pa tsam gyi sgra'i don la rigs kyi rang gi ngo bo nye bar mtshon pa'i rdzas brjod kyi dngos su ni ma yin pa'i phyir de la yod pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i khyad par mi 'phen pa'i phyir de'i khyad par nyid ma
translated: Therefore, the particularity itself is not the referent of the word.

original: yin pa na gzhi mthun pa med par thar bar 'gyur ba smras pa de ni ldog pa dang ldan pa tsam gyi phyogs la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: yin pa na gzhi mthun pa med par thar bar 'gyur ba smras pa de ni ldog pa dang ldan pa tsam gyi phyogs la yang mtshungs so //
translated: When you say that there is no common locus, that is similar in the case of the position that it is mere possession of the opposite.

original: de la yang yod ba sgras ldog par nye bar mtshan pa'i rdzas brjod kyi /
analyzed: de la yang yod ba sgras ldog par nye bar mtshan pa'i rdzas brjod kyi /
translated: In that case also, the substance that indicates the opposite is stated by the word existence,

original: dngos su ni ma yin pa'i phyir de la yod pa'i tha dad pa mi 'phen pa'i 'di la yang mtshungs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: dngos su ni ma yin pa'i phyir de la yod pa'i tha dad pa mi 'phen pa'i 'di la yang mtshungs pa kho na ste /
translated: but not directly. Therefore, it is exactly the same in this case, because it does not imply the difference that exists in it.

original: 'dir rigs dang ldan pa dang ldog pa dang ldan pa dag la khyad par ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'dir rigs dang ldan pa dang ldog pa dang ldan pa dag la khyad par ci zhig yod /
translated: Here, what is the difference between those who possess a type, those who do not possess a type, and those who possess and do not possess a type?

original: skyon gzhan smas ba ni /
analyzed: skyon gzhan smas ba ni /
translated: Another fault is stated:

original: rtags dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtags dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The connection with a mark, etc.

original: rtags ni pho dang / mo dang / ma ning dag go //
analyzed: rtags ni pho dang / mo dang / ma ning dag go //
translated: A mark is male, female, or neuter.

original: grangs ni gcig dang / gnyis dang / mang po nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: grangs ni gcig dang / gnyis dang / mang po nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: A number is one, two, many, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bya ba dang dus la sogs pa'i 'brel pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bya ba dang dus la sogs pa'i 'brel pa gzung ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the connection with action, time, etc.

original: sel ba ni dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir 'di dag dang 'brel pa med la /
analyzed: sel ba ni dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir 'di dag dang 'brel pa med la /
translated: Since an absence is not a thing, it is not connected with these.

original: rtags la sogs pas dben pa'i dngos po ni sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rtags la sogs pas dben pa'i dngos po ni sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: A thing that is devoid of a mark, etc. is not expressed by a word.

original: de'i phyir dam bca' ba la grags pas gnod par thal bar @334a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir dam bca' ba la grags pas gnod par thal bar @334a * //
translated: Therefore, it follows that the proposition is undermined by what is commonly perceived.

original: 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is what he thinks.

original: ci ste yang gsal ba ldog pa'i rten du gyur pa dngos po yin pa'i phyir rtags la sogs pa dang 'brel pa yod la /
analyzed: ci ste yang gsal ba ldog pa'i rten du gyur pa dngos po yin pa'i phyir rtags la sogs pa dang 'brel pa yod la /
translated: But if a thing is the basis of the exclusion of an instance, then it is connected with a mark, etc.

original: de'i phyir de'i sgo nas sel ba la yang rnam par gzhag go snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i sgo nas sel ba la yang rnam par gzhag go snyam na /
translated: Therefore, it is thought that the exclusion is also established by means of that.

original: gsal ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gsal ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: bsal ba de ni rtogs pa med pa'i phyir rtags dang grangs la sogs pa dang 'brel pas bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: bsal ba de ni rtogs pa med pa'i phyir rtags dang grangs la sogs pa dang 'brel pas bstan par mi nus te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe exclusion is not taught by means of a sign, number, etc., because it is not understood.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir ji ltar sel ba de'i sgo nas de rnam par gzhag ba grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar sel ba de'i sgo nas de rnam par gzhag ba grub par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could the exclusion be established by means of that?

original: sel ba sgra'i don du rnam par gzhag pa ma khyab par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sel ba sgra'i don du rnam par gzhag pa ma khyab par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the establishment of the exclusion as the meaning of a word is not universal, it is said:

original: kun bshad dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;üîΩkun bshad dag ste ti ngan nye 'tshed do //
analyzed: kun bshad dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ; kun bshad dag ste ti ngan nye 'tshed do //
translated: ‚ÄúIn all explanations, etc.‚ÄùüîΩIn all explanations, i.e., in all statements, the exclusion is not taught by means of a sign, number, etc.

original: 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bya ba gtso bo'i sgra dag la gzhan sel ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bya ba gtso bo'i sgra dag la gzhan sel ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúGo, etc.‚Äù are words that express the principal action. They do not have an exclusion of other.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩIn response to that, it is said:

original: de la ma yin par dgag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la ma yin par dgag pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that, the exclusion of non-cow, etc.‚Äù

original: dper na su pa'i mtha' can bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra dag la bum pa ma yin pa la sogs pa grub pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa dgag par bya ba yod pa de bzhin du 'tshed pa la sogs pa dgag par bya ba yod pa ma yin
analyzed: dper na su pa'i mtha' can bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra dag la bum pa ma yin pa la sogs pa grub pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa dgag par bya ba yod pa de bzhin du 'tshed pa la sogs pa dgag par bya ba yod pa ma yin
translated: For example, in the case of words such as ‚Äúvase‚Äù that end in a vowel, the negatee that is the opposite of ‚Äúnon-vase‚Äù does exist.

original: te / grub pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di snyam du mi 'tshed pa ma yin zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa dag la ma yin par dgag pa'i ngo bo dgag par bya ba yod par ma gyur mod /
analyzed: te / grub pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // 'di snyam du mi 'tshed pa ma yin zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa dag la ma yin par dgag pa'i ngo bo dgag par bya ba yod par ma gyur mod /
translated: But in the case of ‚Äúdo not cook‚Äù and so on, the negatee does not exist, because nothing is established.üîΩIf you think that in such expressions as ‚Äúnot non-cook,‚Äù the negatee that is the opposite of ‚Äúnon-‚Äù does not exist,

original: 'tshed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i med par dgag pa'i dgag par bya ba yod par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'tshed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i med par dgag pa'i dgag par bya ba yod par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: but the negatee of the negation in ‚Äúcook‚Äù and so on does exist,

original: min pa min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: min pa min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: Not not arisen and so on.

original: blo bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mi 'tshed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu brjod na yang med par dgag pa'i dgag pa nyid brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo bskyed par bya ba yin pa'i phyir mi 'tshed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu brjod na yang med par dgag pa'i dgag pa nyid brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say ‚Äúnot non-cook‚Äù in order to generate understanding, then you are still expressing a negation that is an external negation.

original: de las skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Since the object of negation is established,

original: 'tshed do zhes bya'i dgag med pa //
analyzed: 'tshed do zhes bya'i dgag med pa //
translated: the meaning of the word is established.üîΩSince the object of negation is established,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the meaning of the word is established.üîΩSince the object of negation is established,üîΩthe meaning of the word is established.üîΩSince the object of negation is established,üîΩthe meaning of the word is established.üîΩSince the object of negation is established,

analyzed: dgag pa gnyis kyi yul sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir 'tshed do zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis rig par bya ba'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir sgrub pa nyid sgra'i don du 'gyur ro // gzhan yang 'dir 'tshed do zhes bya ba la sogs par bya ba gang zhig yan lag kha cig grub la yan lag kha cig ma grub pa de ni snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa'i yan lag gi bya ba bsgrub bya nyid du shes pa'i yul yin pa
translated: the meaning of the word is established.üîΩSince the object of negation is established,üîΩthe meaning of the word is established.üîΩSince the object of negation is established,üîΩthe meaning of the word is established.üîΩSince the object of negation is established,üîΩthe meaning of the word is established.
