original: phyi rol nyid du zhen pa'i blo'i rnam pa de nyid gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba dang / sgra'i don zhes phyi rol gyi spyi dngos por gyur pa bzhin du brjod do//
analyzed: phyi rol nyid du zhen pa'i blo'i rnam pa de nyid gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba dang / sgra'i don zhes phyi rol gyi spyi dngos por gyur pa bzhin du brjod do//
translated: The form of the cognition that is attached to external objects is called ‚Äúexclusion‚Äù and ‚Äúthe meaning of a word,‚Äù as if it were an external universal that is a real entity.

original: de la rgyu bshad pa /
analyzed: de la rgyu bshad pa /
translated: The cause of that is explained:

original: de ltar 'khrul pas nges phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'khrul pas nges phyir ro // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because of the ascertainment of that by error.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ngo bo nyid dang dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ngo bo nyid dang dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the ascertainment of the nature of a universal and the nature of a real thing.

original: sgra'i don nyid dang sel ba'i ngo bo nyid dag gi rgyu ni /üîΩphyi rol don du zhen pa yis /
analyzed: sgra'i don nyid dang sel ba'i ngo bo nyid dag gi rgyu ni / phyi rol don du zhen pa yis /
translated: The cause of the meaning of a word and the nature of exclusion is

original: blo ni sgar las 'byung phyir ro //
analyzed: blo ni sgar las 'byung phyir ro //
translated: because the cognition arises from the attachment to external objects.

original: snang ba gzhan la tha dad phyir //
analyzed: snang ba gzhan la tha dad phyir //
translated: Because of the difference in other appearances,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po nyid du bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po nyid du bshad zin to //
translated: and so on.

original: yang ci'i phyir don dam par de spyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir don dam par de spyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Moreover, why is it not a universal in the ultimate sense?

original: yang dag tu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang dag tu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn reality,‚Äù and so on.

original: don dam par blo las tha mi dad pa 'di dag gis don gzhan du gyur nas spyir 'gyur ba de ci ltar don gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs pa yin /
analyzed: don dam par blo las tha mi dad pa 'di dag gis don gzhan du gyur nas spyir 'gyur ba de ci ltar don gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs pa yin /
translated: But since they are not different from the mind, how can they be different objects that are the objects of the mind?

original: ji skad du /üîΩshes las tha dad ma yin pa //üîΩji ltar don gzhan 'brang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji skad du / shes las tha dad ma yin pa // ji ltar don gzhan 'brang bar 'gyur //
translated: As it is said:üîΩHow can that which is not different from consciousness

original: zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: Be a different object?

original: de lta bas na grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the error of proving what is already established does not arise.

original: khyed cag gis ba lang nyid ces bya ba'i spyi rnam pa dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i ngo bor ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: khyed cag gis ba lang nyid ces bya ba'i spyi rnam pa dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i ngo bor ni mi 'dod do //
translated: You do not assert that the universal called ‚Äúoxness‚Äù is a real entity that is not an entity.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: phyi rol gyi khra bo la sogs pa la gnas pa gcig rjes su 'gro ba don dam pa pa'i ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i spyi btags pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi khra bo la sogs pa la gnas pa gcig rjes su 'gro ba don dam pa pa'i ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i spyi btags pa yin te /
translated: It is an ultimate universal such as ‚Äúoxness‚Äù that exists in a single, unitary external object such as a multicolored object.

original: de'i phyir grub pa la bsgrub pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir grub pa la bsgrub pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, you think that the error of proving what is already established does not arise.

original: gal te dgag pa tsa ma ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de ni khas ma blangs pa nyid kyi phyir skyon med do //üîΩgang yang rta sogs blo rnams kyi //
analyzed: gal te dgag pa tsa ma ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de ni khas ma blangs pa nyid kyi phyir skyon med do // gang yang rta sogs blo rnams kyi //
translated: If you say that the mere negation is called ‚Äúintrinsic reality,‚Äù etc., then there is no fault, because we do not accept that.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa gang yin pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa gang yin pa de la /
translated: As for what you said, ‚ÄúThe cognitions of horse, etc.,‚Äù

original: gal te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: we reply, ‚ÄúIf it is a cognition, etc.‚Äù

original: go bar zad do //
analyzed: go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning is clear.

original: gang yang sgra don du 'gyur na don la mi ltos pa'o zhes bya ba smras pa de la /
analyzed: gang yang sgra don du 'gyur na don la mi ltos pa'o zhes bya ba smras pa de la /
translated: As for what you said, ‚ÄúIf it is a word-meaning, it does not depend on an object,‚Äù

original: de ni don la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni don la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: we reply, ‚ÄúIt is not the case that it does not depend on an object.‚Äù

original: gang la brgyud nas dngos po la 'brel pa yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa de ni 'khrul pa yin yang no ra bu'i 'od la nor bu'i bzhin du phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa med pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la brgyud nas dngos po la 'brel pa yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa de ni 'khrul pa yin yang no ra bu'i 'od la nor bu'i bzhin du phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa med pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: A conceptual cognition that is indirectly related to an object is mistaken, but it is not the case that it does not depend on an external object, like the cognition of a mirage.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa med pa nyid ma grub po //üîΩgang yang / blo de sgra yi don dag la //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa med pa nyid ma grub po // gang yang / blo de sgra yi don dag la //
translated: Therefore, it is not established that it does not depend on an external object.

original: zhes @341a * //
analyzed: zhes @341a * //
translated: As for what you said, ‚ÄúThat cognition of the word-meaning,‚Äù

original: bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /
translated: The opponent may say that the above refutation does not apply to him, for he does not say that the object of refutation is a thing that exists by virtue of its own characteristic.üîΩ

original: bdag nyid de yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgal te yang blo dngos po'i ngo bo yin pa de lta na yang de phyi rol gyi bdag nyid de dang blo gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyis dngos po nyid ma yin no zhes /üîΩde bdag gzhan gyi bdag nyid min //
analyzed: bdag nyid de yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gal te yang blo dngos po'i ngo bo yin pa de lta na yang de phyi rol gyi bdag nyid de dang blo gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyis dngos po nyid ma yin no zhes / de bdag gzhan gyi bdag nyid min //
translated: In response to the statement of the opponent, ‚ÄúThe object is the cause of the cognition of the object,‚ÄùüîΩthe root text states, ‚ÄúThe object is not the cause of the cognition of the object.‚ÄùüîΩEven if the cognition is the entity of the object, it is not the object itself, because it is the entity of something external to it, and it is the entity of a cognition that is different from the object.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan zin to //üîΩdes na blo ni mi sems pa'i //üîΩdngos nyid brjod pa nyid du brtags //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan zin to // des na blo ni mi sems pa'i // dngos nyid brjod pa nyid du brtags //
translated: This is what is demonstrated by the statement, ‚ÄúThe object is not the entity of the cognition, nor is the cognition the entity of the object.‚Äù

original: zhes bya bar mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: zhes bya bar mi 'grub ste /
translated: Therefore, the statement, ‚ÄúThe object is the cause of the cognition of the object,‚Äù is not established.

original: shugs kyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //üîΩji ltar phyi rol don med kyang //
analyzed: shugs kyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no // ji ltar phyi rol don med kyang //
translated: This is because the object is understood by implication.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: In response to the statement, ‚ÄúEven though external objects do not exist,‚Äù

original: gzugs brnyan bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the root text states, ‚ÄúThe cognition of an object is like the cognition of a reflection.‚Äù

original: ji ltar gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid snang ba zhes bya ba'i sel ba kho bo cag gis ngag gi don du brjod pa de bzhin du tshig gi don yang yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid snang ba zhes bya ba'i sel ba kho bo cag gis ngag gi don du brjod pa de bzhin du tshig gi don yang yin te /
translated: Just as the exclusion that has the nature of a reflection is the meaning of the word for us, so too it is the meaning of the phrase.

original: gang gi phyir tshig las kyang gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid kyi sel ba 'thad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshig las kyang gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid kyi sel ba 'thad pa nyid yin no //
translated: For, even from the phrase, the exclusion that has the nature of a reflection is tenable.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag gi gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid sel ba yin no //üîΩyang gi sgra ni ngag gi don 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag gi gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid sel ba yin no // yang gi sgra ni ngag gi don 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, for us, the exclusion that has the nature of a reflection is the meaning of the word and the meaning of the phrase.

original: tshig gi don yang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don yang zhes bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äútoo‚Äù indicates that it is not only the meaning of the word but also the meaning of the phrase.

original: des na log par rtog pa med pa'i phyir klan ka mi rigs so snyam du bsams pa'o //üîΩblo ni blo gzhan pa dag las //
analyzed: des na log par rtog pa med pa'i phyir klan ka mi rigs so snyam du bsams pa'o // blo ni blo gzhan pa dag las //
translated: Therefore, because there is no misconception, it is unreasonable to object.üîΩThe cognition does not understand the exclusion

original: rnam par gcod pa rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa rtogs ma yin //
translated: from other cognitions.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: This is what is said.

original: rang gi ngo bo skyes tsam las //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo skyes tsam las //
translated: From the mere arising of its own nature,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: gang kho na'i phyir rang gi ngo bo skye ba tsam las gzhan gyi cha blo des mi 'dzin pa de kho na'i phyir rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pas blo blo gzhan las rnam par gcod pa rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang kho na'i phyir rang gi ngo bo skye ba tsam las gzhan gyi cha blo des mi 'dzin pa de kho na'i phyir rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pas blo blo gzhan las rnam par gcod pa rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is precisely because the mind does not apprehend any other factor apart from the mere arising of its own nature that it is precisely because it abides in its own nature that the mind is understood to be distinguished from other minds.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo 'dzin na ji ltar de las rnam par bcad pa rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo 'dzin na ji ltar de las rnam par bcad pa rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: how could the mind be understood to be distinguished from that if it apprehended the nature of another?

original: des na zhes bya ba ni rang las tha dad pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid nges par mi 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni rang las tha dad pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo nyid nges par mi 'dzin pas so //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means that the mind does not apprehend the nature of a thing that is different from itself.

original: gal te gzhan sel brjod bya na //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te gzhan sel brjod bya na //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If the exclusion of other is the object of expression,üîΩthen how could the mind apprehend the exclusion of other?

original: ji ltar gzhan sel ba rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo la phan tshun tha dad pa med par brjod pa de bzhin du tha dad med pa yang yin pas de'i phyir ji ltar tha mi dad pa'i don med na rnam grangs pa
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan sel ba rang bzhin med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo la phan tshun tha dad pa med par brjod pa de bzhin du tha dad med pa yang yin pas de'i phyir ji ltar tha mi dad pa'i don med na rnam grangs pa
translated: Just as it is said that since other-exclusion does not intrinsically exist, it is not an entity, and it is not mutually different, so too it is not different.üîΩTherefore, how could it follow that it is nominal

original: nyid du thal bar byed /
analyzed: nyid du thal bar byed /
translated: if the meaning of nondifference does not exist?

original: 'di nyid gsal por bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal por bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to clarify this point,üîΩhe says,

original: tha dad med pa'ang dngos gcig nyid //üîΩces bya @341b ba smos so //
analyzed: tha dad med pa'ang dngos gcig nyid // ces bya @341b ba smos so //
translated: Nondifference is also a single entity.

original: gal te med pa dag la dngos po gcig med pa de lta na yang ci'i phyir rnam grangs pa nyid du mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te med pa dag la dngos po gcig med pa de lta na yang ci'i phyir rnam grangs pa nyid du mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If nonentities are not a single entity, then why would it not follow that they are nominal?üîΩIn response to this, he says,

original: don gcig nyid na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don gcig nyid na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If they are the same object, etc.

original: gal te 'di snyam du med pa dag la gcig gi ngo bo nying yang dag par med pa de lta na yang brtags pa po yod de /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du med pa dag la gcig gi ngo bo nying yang dag par med pa de lta na yang brtags pa po yod de /
translated: If you think that although nonentities do not have a single entity, the one who imputes them exists,

original: des na rnam grangs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar rigs so snyam du sems na /
analyzed: des na rnam grangs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar rigs so snyam du sems na /
translated: then it is logical that it follows that they are nominal.

original: de'i phyir / ji ltar ngo bo med na yang //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩngo bo med na yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir / ji ltar ngo bo med na yang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / ngo bo med na yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúEven though they are essenceless‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: rang bzhin med na yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin med na yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even though they are essenceless means even though they are natureless.

original: gal te de lta na ji ltar sgra dag ni rnam grangs pa yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa sgrub snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ji ltar sgra dag ni rnam grangs pa yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa sgrub snyam na /
translated: If that is so, then how do you posit the existence of synonyms?

original: rjod byed dngos su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rjod byed dngos su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It says, ‚ÄúThe expression is direct‚Ä¶‚ÄùüîΩIf, ultimately, the objects of expression of words were either different or non-different things, then they would be synonyms.üîΩBut as long as they have no object of expression at all,üîΩAs has been explained:üîΩBecause the expression of the object

original: gal te don dam par sgra rnams kyi brjod par bya ba tha dad pa'am tha dad pa ma yin pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig tu gyur na de'i tshe rnam grangs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par sgra rnams kyi brjod par bya ba tha dad pa'am tha dad pa ma yin pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig tu gyur na de'i tshe rnam grangs par 'gyur na /
translated: Is not tenable,üîΩThe object is not tenable.üîΩAnd:üîΩBecause the object is not tenable,üîΩThe consciousness is not tenable.üîΩAnd:üîΩBecause the object and the consciousnessüîΩAre not tenable,üîΩThe three realms are mind only.

original: ji srid du 'di dag gi brjod par bya ba cung zad yod pa ma yin no zhes /
analyzed: ji srid du 'di dag gi brjod par bya ba cung zad yod pa ma yin no zhes /
translated: And:üîΩBecause the object and the consciousnessüîΩAre not tenable,üîΩThe three realms are mind only.üîΩAnd:

original: gang phyir rang gi mtshan nyid rigs //
analyzed: gang phyir rang gi mtshan nyid rigs //
translated: Because the object and the consciousnessüîΩAre not tenable,üîΩThe three realms are mind only.üîΩAnd:

original: de 'brel rigs ldan de bzhin du /
analyzed: de 'brel rigs ldan de bzhin du /
translated: Because the object and the consciousnessüîΩAre not tenable,üîΩThe three realms are mind only.üîΩAnd:üîΩBecause the object and the consciousnessüîΩAre not tenable,üîΩThe three realms are mind only.

original: zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: zhes bstan zin to //
translated: And:üîΩBecause the object and the consciousnessüîΩAre not tenable,üîΩThe three realms are mind only.üîΩAnd:

original: 'o na ji ltar rnam grangs la sogs par rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rnam grangs la sogs par rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Because the object and the consciousnessüîΩAre not tenable,üîΩThe three realms are mind only.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúBut, etc.‚Äù

original: de la spyi med na yang spyi'i sgra rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la spyi med na yang spyi'i sgra rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'di yin te /
translated: Even though there is no universal, this is the reason for positing the word ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù:

original: mang po rnams kyi don bya ba gcig byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mang po rnams kyi don bya ba gcig byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which performs the same function for many.

original: dngos po kha cig ni rang bzhin gyis mang po yin na yang don gyi bya ba gcig byed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dngos po kha cig ni rang bzhin gyis mang po yin na yang don gyi bya ba gcig byed par 'gyur la /
translated: Some things, even though they are many by nature, perform the same function for the sake of a single purpose.

original: don gcig byed par nus pa de dag bstan pa'i phyir tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams kyis tshegs chung bar bya ba'i phyir gcig gi ngo bor sgro btags nas sgra gcig sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: don gcig byed par nus pa de dag bstan pa'i phyir tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams kyis tshegs chung bar bya ba'i phyir gcig gi ngo bor sgro btags nas sgra gcig sbyor ba yin te /
translated: In order to indicate those that are capable of performing a single function, the users of the conventional, in order to do so with little difficulty, superimpose a single nature and apply a single word.

original: dper na sbrang rtsi dang chu la sogs pa sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don gcig byed par nus pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mang po dag la bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di sbyor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sbrang rtsi dang chu la sogs pa sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don gcig byed par nus pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mang po dag la bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di sbyor ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like applying the word ‚Äúpot‚Äù to many things, such as form, that are capable of performing the function of a single purpose, such as the characteristic of combining honey, water, etc.

original: de'i yang ci'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba gcig med par mang po dag la sgra gcig sbyor bar byed ce na /
analyzed: de'i yang ci'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba gcig med par mang po dag la sgra gcig sbyor bar byed ce na /
translated: Why is it that many things are designated by a single term without a single universal that pervades all of them?

original: dper na rjes 'gro gcig med na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na rjes 'gro gcig med na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For example, even though there is no single universal that pervades all of them,

original: 'dod pa tsam la rag las te sgra rnams don la sbyor te /üîΩ'di ltar gzugs kyi rnam par shes par 'bras bu gcig pa can gyi ming dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa dag la gal te 'ga' zhig 'dod pa'i dbang @342a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa tsam la rag las te sgra rnams don la sbyor te / 'di ltar gzugs kyi rnam par shes par 'bras bu gcig pa can gyi ming dang gzugs dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa dag la gal te 'ga' zhig 'dod pa'i dbang @342a * //
translated: terms are applied to objects in dependence on mere desire.üîΩThus, in regard to name-and-form, light, and attention, which are the causes of the single effect of eye consciousness, if a single universal that pervades all of them does not exist due to the power of desire,

original: gis rjes su 'gro ba'i spyi gcig med na yang tshang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: gis rjes su 'gro ba'i spyi gcig med na yang tshang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra sbyor bar byed de /
translated: terms such as ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù are applied to them.

original: des na su zhig de 'gegs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na su zhig de 'gegs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, who would refute that?

original: mig la sogs pa de dag la mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i spyi gcig yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa de dag la mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i spyi gcig yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no single universal that produces eye consciousness in those eyes and so on.

original: 'di ltar khyed cag gis spyi dang bye brag dang 'du ba dag kyang ming gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed cag gis spyi dang bye brag dang 'du ba dag kyang ming gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed par 'dod de /
translated: Thus you assert that universals, particulars, and composites generate the consciousness of names.

original: de dag la spyi dang 'du ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag la spyi dang 'du ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But they do not exist as universals and composites,

original: spyi ni spyi med pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'du ba yang 'du ba gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi ni spyi med pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'du ba yang 'du ba gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a universal is not a universal and a composite does not have a second composite.

original: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa ji ltar 'bras bu gcig par byed par brjod /
analyzed: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa ji ltar 'bras bu gcig par byed par brjod /
translated: But how do you say that a pot and so on are the cause of a single effect?

original: ji srid du de'i 'bras bu chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pas tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji srid du de'i 'bras bu chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pas tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: As long as its effect, such as holding water, and the consciousness that apprehends it are different, they are different because their intrinsic identity is different.

original: gal te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúEven though they are different,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te yang rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pas de dag gi 'bras bu tha dad pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te yang rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pas de dag gi 'bras bu tha dad pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even though they are different because their intrinsic identity is different, their effect is not different.

original: re zhig shes pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu don gcig tu zhes pa'i sre ba'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid kyis gcig ces brjod la /
analyzed: re zhig shes pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu don gcig tu zhes pa'i sre ba'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid kyis gcig ces brjod la /
translated: For the time being, the effect called cognition is said to be the same as the object, because it is the cause of the cognition of the same.

original: shes pa de'i rgyu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir don kyang yin te /
analyzed: shes pa de'i rgyu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir don kyang yin te /
translated: And it is an object because it is the cause of that cognition.

original: sbrang rtsi dang chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i mtshun nyid kyi bum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang tha dad med pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi dang chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i mtshun nyid kyi bum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang tha dad med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: And the pot, etc., which have the characteristic of holding honey, water, etc., are also said to be not different from the characteristic.

original: de ston pa ni /üîΩde bzhin de yi rgyu yi phyir //
analyzed: de ston pa ni / de bzhin de yi rgyu yi phyir //
translated: The teaching of that is:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the same way, because it is the cause of that.

original: rjod pa yin zhes bya ba'i rnal ma'i tshig yongs su bsgyur nas mang bo'i tshig gi mtha' can du sbyar bar bya la /
analyzed: rjod pa yin zhes bya ba'i rnal ma'i tshig yongs su bsgyur nas mang bo'i tshig gi mtha' can du sbyar bar bya la /
translated: The word ‚Äúis‚Äù is a normal word that should be supplied, having changed the word ‚Äúexpression‚Äù to have the ending of a plural word.

original: yang gi sgra ni rim pa tha dad ba ste /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni rim pa tha dad ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is a different order.

original: don zhes bya ba'i 'og tu sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba'i 'og tu sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: It should be supplied after the word ‚Äúobject.‚Äù

original: des na don gyi bya ba gcig byed pa 'thad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na don gyi bya ba gcig byed pa 'thad pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is tenable that they perform the same function of object.

original: 'on te de lta na thug pa med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te de lta na thug pa med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But if that is so, isn‚Äôt there an infinite regress?

original: 'di ltar 'di'i sre ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de yang rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pas tha dad par 'gyur pa'i phyir gcig nyid du mi 'grub la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di'i sre ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de yang rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pas tha dad par 'gyur pa'i phyir gcig nyid du mi 'grub la /
translated: Thus, since the consciousnesses of the word are different by way of their own characteristics, they are different, and therefore cannot be established as one.

original: de lta yin dang de la yang gcig nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang de la yang gcig nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And if that were so, then in order to establish that they are one,

original: gcig gi rnam pa can sre'i 'bras bu gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang bas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig gi rnam pa can sre'i 'bras bu gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang bas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: the effect of the consciousness of the word would follow after another, and there would be an infinite regress.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu gcig pa nyid du mi gnas pas gang du yang sgra gcig sbyor bar 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu gcig pa nyid du mi gnas pas gang du yang sgra gcig sbyor bar 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since they do not abide as having one effect, it is not established that the word is applied to any one of them.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so, because

original: sre ba'i shes pa 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyis gcig pa brjod pa ni ma yin @342b no ;
analyzed: sre ba'i shes pa 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyis gcig pa brjod pa ni ma yin @342b no ;
translated: the consciousness of the word is not said to be one by virtue of having one effect.

original: /'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: /'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: don gcig tu zhen pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: don gcig tu zhen pa nyid kyis so //
translated: It is by virtue of apprehending one object.

original: des na thug pa med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na thug pa med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore there is no infinite regress,

original: sre ba'i shes pa thams cad don gcig tu zhen pa nyid du rang nyid las grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sre ba'i shes pa thams cad don gcig tu zhen pa nyid du rang nyid las grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all consciousnesses of the word are established by themselves as apprehending one object.

original: des na don na 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don na 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning:

original: rnam pa gcig pa can gyi sre ba'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig pa can gyi sre ba'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the cognition of a universal that has one aspect.

original: shes spang zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu gcig ces bya la /
analyzed: shes spang zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu gcig ces bya la /
translated: The one effect is called ‚Äúto be abandoned by the path of seeing.‚Äù

original: de'i rgyu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa'i don yang gcig nyid du tha snyad du bya ba'i snod yin na //
analyzed: de'i rgyu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa'i don yang gcig nyid du tha snyad du bya ba'i snod yin na //
translated: Because it is the cause of that, the object, such as a pot, is also called ‚Äúone.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir spyi dngos por gyur pa med na yang bum pa la sogs pa spyi brjod par grub par 'gyur ro zhes mjug bsdu ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi dngos por gyur pa med na yang bum pa la sogs pa spyi brjod par grub par 'gyur ro zhes mjug bsdu ba'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, even though a universal does not exist as a real entity, it is established that a pot, etc. is described as a universal.üîΩIn order to summarize,

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù etc.

original: dngos po gcig la spyi dang bye brag med na yang sgra du ma ma 'chol bar 'jug par 'gyur ba nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po gcig la spyi dang bye brag med na yang sgra du ma ma 'chol bar 'jug par 'gyur ba nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though there is no universal and no particular in one real entity, many words are applied without confusion.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúJust like,‚Äù etc.

original: 'ga' zhig gcig yin na yang rang bzhin gyis tshogs pa gzhan gyi nang du gtogs pa'i dbang gis don gyi bya ba du ma byed par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gcig yin na yang rang bzhin gyis tshogs pa gzhan gyi nang du gtogs pa'i dbang gis don gyi bya ba du ma byed par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Even if something is one, it performs many actions in terms of the referent because it is included in the nature of another collection.

original: de la spyi dngos por gyur pa la sogs pa'i chos tha dad pa med na yang de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa'i dngos po las tha dad pa mang po ste chos du ma sgro btags pa las sgra du ma sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la spyi dngos por gyur pa la sogs pa'i chos tha dad pa med na yang de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa'i dngos po las tha dad pa mang po ste chos du ma sgro btags pa las sgra du ma sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Even though there is no difference in the nature of a universal and so on, many different things that are not its effect are imputed to be many phenomena, and many terms are applied to them.

original: 'di la dper brjod pa bshad pa ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la dper brjod pa bshad pa ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs ba ste /
translated: An example is stated:

original: gzugs ni rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir thogs bcas zhes bya la /
analyzed: gzugs ni rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i gegs byed pa'i phyir thogs bcas zhes bya la /
translated: For example, form is called obstructive because it obstructs the arising of another object in its own place.

original: bstan pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa yin la de bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa yin la de bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: It is demonstrable because it generates eye consciousness.

original: de dang lhan cig tu 'jug pas bstan du yod pa'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu 'jug pas bstan du yod pa'o //
translated: It is demonstrable because it engages simultaneously with that.

original: dper brjod pa gnyis pa yang ston pa ni /
analyzed: dper brjod pa gnyis pa yang ston pa ni /
translated: A second example is stated:

original: dper na sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dper na sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: For example, sound is not demonstrable because it is not the object of eye consciousness.

original: dper na sgra gcig yin na yang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir /üîΩmnyan par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: dper na sgra gcig yin na yang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir / mnyan par bya ba yin la /
translated: For example, even though sound is one, it is called ‚Äúto be heard‚Äù because it is the effect of the ear consciousness.

original: mnyan pa ni sgra ste /
analyzed: mnyan pa ni sgra ste /
translated: ‚ÄúTo be heard‚Äù is sound.

original: nyan pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyan pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for the consciousness of hearing.

original: de la snang ba nyid kyis de'i dngos po ni mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de la snang ba nyid kyis de'i dngos po ni mnyan par bya'o //
translated: It is to be heard because it is the object of hearing.

original: yang na mnyan pas gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir mnyan par bya ba yin la brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i shes pa 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yang na mnyan pas gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir mnyan par bya ba yin la brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i shes pa 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Or, it is to be heard because it is to be grasped by hearing. It is called ‚Äúthe consciousness that arises immediately upon the exertion of effort‚Äù because it is the effect of the consciousness that arises immediately upon the exertion of effort.

original: de ltar de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa las tha dad pas gcig la yang sgra du ma sbyor ro zhes ston to /üîΩda ni de ma yin pa @343a * //
analyzed: de ltar de'i 'bras bu ma yin pa las tha dad pas gcig la yang sgra du ma sbyor ro zhes ston to / da ni de ma yin pa @343a * //
translated: Thus, he shows that because it is different from that which is not its effect, many words are applied to one thing.

original: las tha dad pas kyang 'ga' zhig tu sgra sbyor bar byed do zhes ston pa ni /üîΩde rgyu min las tha dad pas //
analyzed: las tha dad pas kyang 'ga' zhig tu sgra sbyor bar byed do zhes ston pa ni / de rgyu min las tha dad pas //
translated: Now, in order to show that because it is different from that which is not it, sometimes words are applied, he says:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because it is different from that which is not its cause, etc.

original: sbrang bu las byung zhes bya ba ni ra ro bar byed pa'i sbrang rgod las byung ba'i sbrang rtsi las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: sbrang bu las byung zhes bya ba ni ra ro bar byed pa'i sbrang rgod las byung ba'i sbrang rtsi las ldog pa'o //
translated: The phrase not from bees excludes honey that comes from honeybees that cause intoxication.

original: de ltar de'i 'bras bu dang rgyu ma yin pa'i dngos po las tha dad pas dngos po gcig la sgra tha dad par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar de'i 'bras bu dang rgyu ma yin pa'i dngos po las tha dad pas dngos po gcig la sgra tha dad par bstan to //
translated: Thus, by the difference in the thing that is the effect and the thing that is the cause, the difference in the words is demonstrated in regard to a single thing.üîΩNow, wishing to teach the mere exclusion of the thing that is the effect and the thing that is the cause, he says,

original: da ni de'i 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po rnam par bcad pa tsam bstan par 'dod nas spyi med par yang sgra tha dad pas sbyor bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni de'i 'bras bu dang rgyu'i dngos po rnam par bcad pa tsam bstan par 'dod nas spyi med par yang sgra tha dad pas sbyor bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to demonstrate the application of the difference in the words even without a universal,

original: de 'bras zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de 'bras zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The effect of those, etc.

original: sngar bshad pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those that have the cause and effect that were explained earlier are called that.

original: de dag ma 'dres pa ni ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ma 'dres pa ni ldog pa'o //
translated: Their non-mixture is the exclusion.

original: yang sgra 'di yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: yang sgra 'di yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the word also?

original: gzugs ni mnyan bya min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzugs ni mnyan bya min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, Form is not audible, etc.,

original: 'bras bu mnyan pa'i shes pa rnam par bcad pa'i sgo nas gzugs mnyan par bya ba ma yin zhes brjod la de bzhin du rtsol ba'i rgyu bum pa'i dngos po rnam par bcad nas glog gi rtsol ba las ma byung ba'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu mnyan pa'i shes pa rnam par bcad pa'i sgo nas gzugs mnyan par bya ba ma yin zhes brjod la de bzhin du rtsol ba'i rgyu bum pa'i dngos po rnam par bcad nas glog gi rtsol ba las ma byung ba'o zhes brjod do //
translated: In the same way, having eliminated the entity of a pot, the cause of effort, one says, ‚ÄúIt does not arise from the effort of lightning.‚Äù

original: de ltar spyi la sogs pa dngos por gyur pa med par yang sgra rnams tha dad du sbyor ba ni ldog pas byas pa nyid yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar spyi la sogs pa dngos por gyur pa med par yang sgra rnams tha dad du sbyor ba ni ldog pas byas pa nyid yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, even though universals and so on do not exist as entities, words are applied to them as different, and this is done by way of exclusion.

original: rnam grangs pa nyid thal bar 'gyur ba med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam grangs pa nyid thal bar 'gyur ba med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no entailment of being a mere synonym,

original: de lta bu sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bu sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says ‚Äúlike that and so on,‚Äù and so forth.

original: sogs pa smos pas gnas skabs kyi khyad par rjod par byed pa byas pa la sogs pa'i sgra dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i sgra gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas gnas skabs kyi khyad par rjod par byed pa byas pa la sogs pa'i sgra dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i sgra gzung ngo //
translated: By saying ‚Äúand so on,‚Äù one should understand the words ‚Äúmade‚Äù and so on, which express a particular state, and the words ‚Äúselfless‚Äù and so on.

original: tha dad don gyi rgyu mtshan can //
analyzed: tha dad don gyi rgyu mtshan can //
translated: They have different meanings and are the basis for exclusion.

original: zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa ni de dang de las ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan ldog pa gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa ni de dang de las ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan ldog pa gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has a reason for exclusion from this and that is called that.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i ldog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i ldog pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the exclusion ‚Äúthus.‚Äù

original: de'i mthar thug ces bya ba ni ldog pa'i don gyi mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mthar thug ces bya ba ni ldog pa'i don gyi mthar thug pa ste /
translated: The end of that is the end of the meaning of exclusion.

original: 'ol phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ol phyir rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause for understanding a thing of that kind.

original: mnyan pa zhes bya ba ni sgra rnams so //
analyzed: mnyan pa zhes bya ba ni sgra rnams so //
translated: Sound is hearing.

original: 'di snyam du don tha dad du btags pa'i phyir 'di dag rnam grangs pa nyid du ma gyur mod /
analyzed: 'di snyam du don tha dad du btags pa'i phyir 'di dag rnam grangs pa nyid du ma gyur mod /
translated: One might think: ‚ÄúSince they are designated as different meanings, they are not synonyms.

original: spyi dang bye brag med par 'di dag gi spyi dang bye brag gi rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: spyi dang bye brag med par 'di dag gi spyi dang bye brag gi rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: Without a general and a particular, how can their arrangement as general and particular be established?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir mang dang nyung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mang dang nyung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said ‚Äúmany and few,‚Äù etc.

original: shing gi sgra ni seng ldeng dang da ba dang pa la sha la sogs pa @343b thams cad la shing ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa tsam gyi gzugs brnyan skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: shing gi sgra ni seng ldeng dang da ba dang pa la sha la sogs pa @343b thams cad la shing ma yin pa rnam par bcad pa tsam gyi gzugs brnyan skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äútree‚Äù produces a reflection that is the mere exclusion of non-tree with regard to all trees such as teak, oak, and birch.

original: des na 'di'i yul mang po yin pa'i phyir spyi brjod byar brjod la /
analyzed: des na 'di'i yul mang po yin pa'i phyir spyi brjod byar brjod la /
translated: Therefore, since it has many objects, it is said to express a universal.

original: da ba la sogs pa'i sgra ni seng ldeng la sogs pa shing gi ldog pa cung zad cig zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i phyir khyad par brjod byar brjod do //
analyzed: da ba la sogs pa'i sgra ni seng ldeng la sogs pa shing gi ldog pa cung zad cig zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i phyir khyad par brjod byar brjod do //
translated: The words ‚Äúoak‚Äù and so on produce a conceptual cognition that apprehends a slight exclusion of tree from teak and so on. Therefore, it is said to express a particular.

original: 'on te bsal bya tha dad pas //
analyzed: 'on te bsal bya tha dad pas //
translated: But if you say that the object of exclusion is different,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: rnam rtog bzo yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam rtog bzo yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúConceptual fabrication is artificial,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te don dam par bsal bar bya ba tha dad pa dang rten tha dad pas sel ba tha dad par 'dod par 'gyur na de'i tshe skyon der 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par bsal bar bya ba tha dad pa dang rten tha dad pas sel ba tha dad par 'dod par 'gyur na de'i tshe skyon der 'gyur na /
translated: If you say that the object of exclusion is different and the basis is different, then the exclusion would be different. If that were so, then there would be a fault.

original: ji srid du rnam par rtog pas rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa'i dngos po las tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi ldog pa tha dad pa rtog par byed kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji srid du rnam par rtog pas rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa'i dngos po las tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi ldog pa tha dad pa rtog par byed kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: As long as there is conceptualization, there are different isolates that are the reasons for the difference of things that are of the same type and of different types. But not ultimately.

original: de dag kyang rtog pa'i dbang gis dngos po las tha dad pa nyid snang gi don dam par ni ma yin no zhes ston pa de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang rtog pa'i dbang gis dngos po las tha dad pa nyid snang gi don dam par ni ma yin no zhes ston pa de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And those are also different from things only by the power of thought, not ultimately. To teach that, he says, ‚ÄúThose,‚Äù and so on.

original: ci'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin zhe na /üîΩtha dad tha dad med pa ni //
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin zhe na / tha dad tha dad med pa ni //
translated: Why are they not real?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúDifference and non-difference,‚Äù and so on.

original: don dam par rnam par rtog pa kho na tha dad par 'gyur ba yin no zhes ston pa ni //
analyzed: don dam par rnam par rtog pa kho na tha dad par 'gyur ba yin no zhes ston pa ni //
translated: To teach that ultimately it is only conceptualization that is different, he says,

original: shing gi sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: shing gi sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

original: don ni ma yin te /

A single thing is not the cause for the realization of a different thing. A different thing is not the cause for the realization of a single thing. A different thing is not the cause for the realization of a different thing.

original: gal te yang spyi dngos por gyur pa med pa de lta na yang rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin mtshan nyid tsam nyid kyis rjes su byed par 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gal te yang spyi dngos por gyur pa med pa de lta na yang rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin mtshan nyid tsam nyid kyis rjes su byed par 'gal ba med do //
translated: Even if the universal does not exist as a real entity, there is no contradiction in its being the mere characteristic that is the nature of the exclusion of the dissimilar class.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúWhere there is . . .‚Äù

original: gang na zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs gang na'o //
analyzed: gang na zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs gang na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhere there is‚Äù means in whatever place.

original: 'di na yang du ba ma yin pa las tha dad pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs la chos nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di na yang du ba ma yin pa las tha dad pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs la chos nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, the particular characteristic that is different from non-smoke exists. This is the presentation of the property in the subject.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshad ma'i 'bras bu nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshad ma'i 'bras bu nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore . . .‚Äù and so on presents the result of the valid knowledge.

original: yang na ngang gi mtshan nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba byed pa na yan lag lnga yang bstan par nus pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yang na ngang gi mtshan nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba byed pa na yan lag lnga yang bstan par nus pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Or, when it is said that it is possible to present the five parts by the mere characteristic of the nature of the reason,

original: 'di yang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs bshad pa'o //
translated: this is also an explanation of the result of the reason.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs smras pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs smras pa /
translated: The reason of nature is stated:

original: mi'i rva sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi'i rva sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe horns of a human, etc.‚Äù

original: med pa las ldog pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de thams cad ni de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir bstan pa las kyang ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: med pa las ldog pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de thams cad ni de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir bstan pa las kyang ldog pa yin te /
translated: Whatever is the intrinsic identity of the negation of non-existence, all that is not the intrinsic reality of that, and therefore it is also taught as the negation of that.

original: blo dang sgron ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: blo dang sgron ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the mind, the lamp, etc.

original: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'di yang med pa'i ngo bo ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'di yang med pa'i ngo bo ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the intrinsic identity of sound, etc. is not the reality of non-existence.

original: de'i phyir rigs pa 'dis khyad par la ma @344b reg pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba byed pa na mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs pa 'dis khyad par la ma @344b reg pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba byed pa na mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, by this reasoning, since it does not touch the distinction, there is no contradiction in making the universal follow the intrinsic identity.

original: 'di yang yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: And this is the demonstration of the universal in the proof of the reason, ‚Äúbecause it exists.‚Äù

original: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba de lta na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba de lta na /
translated: If the universal follows the intrinsic identity,

original: da ni ji ltar rjes su dpag pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid yul can du 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar rjes su dpag pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid yul can du 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how is it established as the subject of the inference?

original: de'i phyir / khyad par brjod par mi 'dod pa'i //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / khyad par brjod par mi 'dod pa'i // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe specific is not intended to be expressed.‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de nyid khyad par brjod par mi 'dod pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de nyid khyad par brjod par mi 'dod pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The specific characteristic is called the general characteristic because the specific is not intended to be expressed.

original: khyad par yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i spyir mtshon cing nges par byed pas spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: khyad par yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i spyir mtshon cing nges par byed pas spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The general characteristic is so called because it is a general indication and ascertainment of the specific that does not grasp the specific.

original: gzhan yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni mu stegs byed kyis mngon par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni mu stegs byed kyis mngon par 'dod pa ste /
translated: Moreover, ‚Äúnot other‚Äù is what is asserted by the tƒ´rthikas.

original: de mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is not asserted.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de nyid rang gzhan ngo bo yis //
analyzed: de nyid rang gzhan ngo bo yis //
translated: Because it is realized by the nature of itself and others,

original: rtogs phyir gzhal bya gnyis su 'dod //
analyzed: rtogs phyir gzhal bya gnyis su 'dod //
translated: the object of comprehension is asserted to be twofold.

original: ces bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is as explained.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang /üîΩde min rang bzhin las ldog pa'i //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang / de min rang bzhin las ldog pa'i //
translated: Moreover,

original: dngos po tsam zhig rab bsgrub phyir //
analyzed: dngos po tsam zhig rab bsgrub phyir //
translated: in order to establish mere things that are the opposite of that nature,

original: rtags spyi'i yul can du brjod de //
analyzed: rtags spyi'i yul can du brjod de //
translated: the reason is said to have a general object,

original: khyad par gnas pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par gnas pa med phyir ro //
translated: because the specific does not abide.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: This is explained.

original: de yang sgra dang rtags dag gi lhan cig spyod pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bstan te /
analyzed: de yang sgra dang rtags dag gi lhan cig spyod pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis bstan te /
translated: Moreover, the concomitance of the reason and the predicate is also taught by intrinsic identity.

original: kho bo cag gis ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs med par nges par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs med par nges par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: We do not ascertain that there is no reason in the discordant side merely by not seeing it.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: mi dmigs pa'i khyad par las so snyam du bsams pa yin no //üîΩgang yang / khra bo las ni tha dad nyid //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i khyad par las so snyam du bsams pa yin no // gang yang / khra bo las ni tha dad nyid //
translated: We think that it is due to the particular nonobservation.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smras pa gang yin pa de la khra mo'i bu las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smras pa gang yin pa de la khra mo'i bu las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: As for the statement, ‚ÄúDistinct from the multicolored,‚Äù and so on, he says, ‚ÄúDistinct from the offspring of the multicolored,‚Äù and so on.

original: ser skya'i bu dang rta gnyis khra mo'i bu las tha dad par mtshungs na yang ci'i phyir rta yongs su spangs nas khra mo la sogs pa de dag nyid la ba lad nyid 'jug gi rta la ni ma yin zhes bya ba 'di khyed cag gis brjod par
analyzed: ser skya'i bu dang rta gnyis khra mo'i bu las tha dad par mtshungs na yang ci'i phyir rta yongs su spangs nas khra mo la sogs pa de dag nyid la ba lad nyid 'jug gi rta la ni ma yin zhes bya ba 'di khyed cag gis brjod par
translated: Even though the offspring of the multicolored and the two, the son of Kapila and the horse, are similar in being distinct from the offspring of the multicolored, why is it that, having completely abandoned the horse, you apply the term ‚Äúcow‚Äù to just those, the offspring of the multicolored and so on, and not to the horse?üîΩThis is something that you should say.

original: 'os so // 'di snyam du 'di la ci zhig brjod par bya /
analyzed: 'os so // 'di snyam du 'di la ci zhig brjod par bya /
translated: What is there to say about this?

original: de'i ba lang nyid de mngon par gsal ba la khra bo la sogs pa nyid nus kyi /üîΩrta la sogs pa ni ma yin te de'i phyir de nyid la 'jug gi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i ba lang nyid de mngon par gsal ba la khra bo la sogs pa nyid nus kyi / rta la sogs pa ni ma yin te de'i phyir de nyid la 'jug gi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: The universal of cow is able to manifest the particular cow, but not the horse, etc.üîΩTherefore, it engages only that, not others.

original: ci'i phyir de mngon par gsal ba la khra bo la sogs pa nyid nus pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang brgal zhing brtag par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de mngon par gsal ba la khra bo la sogs pa nyid nus pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang brgal zhing brtag par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Why is it that the universal of cow is able to manifest the particular cow, but not others?

original: 'di ltar 'di ni dngos po'i rang bzhin so sor nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni dngos po'i rang bzhin so sor nges pa yin no //
translated: This is also not a proper question, because this is the nature of things, which is individually distinct.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin la ni brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin la ni brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of things is not suitable to be questioned.

original: @345a * // de dag gi rang bzhin tha dad pa so sor des pa ni rang gi rgyu brgyud pas byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: @345a * // de dag gi rang bzhin tha dad pa so sor des pa ni rang gi rgyu brgyud pas byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The nature of those things, which is individually distinct, is produced by their own individual causes.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: gal te de gsal zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te de gsal zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is said that it manifests that,

original: de zhes bya ba ni ba lang nyid do /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni ba lang nyid do /
translated: that refers to the universal of cow.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni khra bo la sogs pa ste rta ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni khra bo la sogs pa ste rta ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù refers to the variegated, etc., but not to the horse.

original: gal te de lta na tha dad kyang spyi med par yang mtshungs par rtog pa skyed pa la khra bo la sogs pa kho na nus kyi /
analyzed: gal te de lta na tha dad kyang spyi med par yang mtshungs par rtog pa skyed pa la khra bo la sogs pa kho na nus kyi /
translated: If that is so, then it is the same in the case of the variegated, etc., that they generate the conception even without a universal.

original: rta ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di kho bo cag gi phyogs la mi 'gal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: rta ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di kho bo cag gi phyogs la mi 'gal ba kho na'o //
translated: The horse is not able to do so. This is not contradictory in our system.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What follows from this?

original: dngos po gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn regard to any entity,‚Äù etc.

original: khra bo la sogs pa'i dngos po gang la ba lad ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu'i gcig tu rtog pa'i shes pa skye ba de nyid la dngos por gyur pa'i ba lang gi rigs med na yang ba lang ma yin pa sel ba gzugs brnyan gyi bdagüîΩnyid 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa'i dngos po gang la ba lad ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu'i gcig tu rtog pa'i shes pa skye ba de nyid la dngos por gyur pa'i ba lang gi rigs med na yang ba lang ma yin pa sel ba gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid 'jug pa yin no //
translated: In regard to any entity, such as the variegated, etc., a cognition conceiving it to be a single entity, such as a cow, arises in regard to that itself, even though the class of cow does not exist as an entity.

original: ba lang min sel dbang pos kyang //
analyzed: ba lang min sel dbang pos kyang //
translated: The exclusion of non-cow, which has the nature of a reflection, is engaged.üîΩThe sense faculty that excludes non-cow

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de ni ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de ni ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: What was said, etc., is taught in order to show that this is not established.

original: ba lang min ldog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ba lang min ldog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The words ‚Äúnot a cow‚Äù and so on.

original: de la re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sel ba ni dbang pos nges par bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sel ba ni dbang pos nges par bya ba kho na'o //
translated: First, the exclusion of intrinsic identity is ascertained by the senses alone.

original: gang yang don gyi gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid kyi sel ba de ni don dam par blo'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid kyis grub po //
analyzed: gang yang don gyi gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid kyi sel ba de ni don dam par blo'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid kyis grub po //
translated: And the exclusion that is the nature of the image of the object is established by reflexive awareness, because it is ultimately the nature of the mind.

original: kyang gi sgra ni ma bshad pa'i don sdud pa ste /
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni ma bshad pa'i don sdud pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù includes other unexpressed meanings.

original: des na med par dgag pa'i bdag nyid kyang shugs kyis rtogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: des na med par dgag pa'i bdag nyid kyang shugs kyis rtogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the nature of an external negation is also understood by implication,

original: de'i bdag nyid ni gzhan gyi bdag nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni gzhan gyi bdag nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: because that nature is not the nature of another.

original: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i sel ba 'di nyid mthong na ste shes nas 'jig rten gyi sgra sbyor gyi spyi dngos por gyur pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i sel ba 'di nyid mthong na ste shes nas 'jig rten gyi sgra sbyor gyi spyi dngos por gyur pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, when this exclusion of intrinsic identity and so on is seen, that is, known, the world applies terms, but not to an entity that is a universal,

original: de med pa'i phyir dang / mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir dang / mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that does not exist and because it does not appear.

original: gang kho na mthong nas 'jig rten gyi sgra sbyor ba de nyid kyis de'i 'brel pa rtogs kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin te //
analyzed: gang kho na mthong nas 'jig rten gyi sgra sbyor ba de nyid kyis de'i 'brel pa rtogs kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin te //
translated: The very same thing that is seen by which the worldly convention is applied, by that very thing its relation is understood, not by any other,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the absurdity of the consequence.

original: ba lang min pa'i sgras rjod byed //
analyzed: ba lang min pa'i sgras rjod byed //
translated: The word non-cow is the expresser,

original: ji ltar yang ni go bar bya //
analyzed: ji ltar yang ni go bar bya //
translated: but how is it understood?

original: zhes gang smras pa 'di la /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa 'di la /
translated: This is what is said.

original: dngos po gang la de 'dra ba'i //
analyzed: dngos po gang la de 'dra ba'i //
translated: Whatever thing has such a nature,üîΩand so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: And also,

original: gang yang / grub na 'ang ba lang min bsal bya //
analyzed: gang yang / grub na 'ang ba lang min bsal bya //
translated: If established, the non-cow is to be excluded,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: and so on.

original: ba lang la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams ni rang nyid kyis tha dad du rtogs pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa na yang rnam par phye nas yang dag par @345b nges pa yin la /
analyzed: ba lang la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams ni rang nyid kyis tha dad du rtogs pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa na yang rnam par phye nas yang dag par @345b nges pa yin la /
translated: When things such as cows produce the cognition that understands their difference by themselves, it is a correct ascertainment through differentiation.

original: de la tha snyad kyi don du tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams kyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du ma grub pa'i sgra sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de la tha snyad kyi don du tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams kyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du ma grub pa'i sgra sbyor ba yin no //
translated: And in that, the application of words that are not established according to the desire of those who make conventions for conventional objects is a convention.

original: 'di ltar gal te dngos po tha dad pa'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs par bya ba'i don du dngos po gzhan 'dzin pa la ltos ba de'i tshe phan tshun bsten pa'i skyon du 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dngos po tha dad pa'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs par bya ba'i don du dngos po gzhan 'dzin pa la ltos ba de'i tshe phan tshun bsten pa'i skyon du 'gyur na /
translated: As such, if in order to understand the distinct nature of a thing, one relies on the apprehension of another thing, then the error of mutual dependence would ensue.

original: ji srid du gzhan 'dzin pa med pa kho nar dngos po'i tha dad pa rigs pa yin la /
analyzed: ji srid du gzhan 'dzin pa med pa kho nar dngos po'i tha dad pa rigs pa yin la /
translated: But as long as the distinctness of a thing is understood only without the apprehension of another,

original: de la tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa can gyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyis rnam par phye nas grub pa na ba lang dang ba lang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dod par brda byed pa'i phyir ji ltar /
analyzed: de la tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa can gyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyis rnam par phye nas grub pa na ba lang dang ba lang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dod par brda byed pa'i phyir ji ltar /
translated: then, since it is the cause of the conception of distinctness, it is established by being distinguished, and one can use the conventions ‚Äúcow‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-cow‚Äù as one wishes. So how could there be the error of mutual dependence?

original: phan tshun bsten pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: phan tshun bsten pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: How could there be the error of mutual dependence?

original: rig pa la zhes bya ba rig pa'i don du'o //üîΩgang yang / rten dang brten par 'jug sogs kyi //
analyzed: rig pa la zhes bya ba rig pa'i don du'o // gang yang / rten dang brten par 'jug sogs kyi //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of awareness‚Äù means in the case of the object of awareness.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /
translated: Someone might say, ‚ÄúThe error of mutual dependence ensues because of such things as the relation of the basis and the based.‚Äù

original: sgra las byung ba'i blo 'di ni //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i blo 'di ni //
translated: In response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúThis cognition that arises from sound . . .‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: don dam par sel bar bya ba'i khyad par 'ga' zhig sgra dag gis brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par sel bar bya ba'i khyad par 'ga' zhig sgra dag gis brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: In reality, some particular thing to be eliminated is not expressed by words.

original: gang gi phyir ji ltar sgras dngos po 'ga' zhig la yang reg pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji ltar sgras dngos po 'ga' zhig la yang reg pa ma yin te /
translated: Because, just as a word does not touch any thing,üîΩit has not been conventionally agreed upon anywhere.

original: gang du yang brda ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni bshad zin to //üîΩ'di ltar sgra las byung ba'i blo'i phyir rol gyi don yul ma yin na yang rang gi gzung ba ste /
analyzed: gang du yang brda ma byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni bshad zin to // 'di ltar sgra las byung ba'i blo'i phyir rol gyi don yul ma yin na yang rang gi gzung ba ste /
translated: This has already been explained.üîΩThus, although the object of the external thing is not the object of the cognition that arises from a word, it produces the ascertainment of its own apprehended aspect as external.

original: rang gi rnam pa phyi rol nyid du nges pa skyed par byed kyi don dam par dngos po'i rang bzhin la reg pa ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa phyi rol nyid du nges pa skyed par byed kyi don dam par dngos po'i rang bzhin la reg pa ni ma yin te ;
translated: It does not touch the nature of the thing in reality,

original: de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the way things really are is not ascertained.

original: gal te de lta ji ltar slob dpon gyis autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgras don gzhan las ldog pa'i khyad par can gyi don brjod do zhes bshad ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta ji ltar slob dpon gyis autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i sgras don gzhan las ldog pa'i khyad par can gyi don brjod do zhes bshad ce na /
translated: If that is so, how can the master explain that the words ‚Äúblue lotus‚Äù express a meaning that is qualified by the exclusion of other?üîΩTherefore, he says:

original: de'i phyir / mtshan nyid byed pa dag gis ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / mtshan nyid byed pa dag gis ni //
translated: By the function of the definition,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: 'di brjod par 'dod pa yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'di brjod par 'dod pa yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is it that is being said?

original: dngos gang gzhan las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos gang gzhan las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is this: ‚ÄúWhatever entity is dependent on another . . .‚Äù

original: don ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: don ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The meaning is twofold:

original: phyi dang blo la yod pa'o //
analyzed: phyi dang blo la yod pa'o //
translated: external and internal.

original: de la phyi rol ni don dam par sgra rnams kyis brjod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la phyi rol ni don dam par sgra rnams kyis brjod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Regarding that, external objects are not ultimately expressed by words.

original: de nges par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i phyir nye bar btags nas sgra'i don du brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: de nges par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i phyir nye bar btags nas sgra'i don du brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: However, in order to generate the conceptual consciousness that ascertains them, they are merely imputed and said to be the referents of words.üîΩThe purpose of the imputation is to eliminate the expression of the universal.

original: btags pa'i dgos pa yang rigs brjod pa sel bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to /
analyzed: btags pa'i dgos pa yang rigs brjod pa sel bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to /
translated: This is the general meaning.

original: // / yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now I will explain the meaning of the individual words.

original: gzhan las gzhan zhas bya ba ni gzhan las gzhan nyid de ldog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan las gzhan zhas bya ba ni gzhan las gzhan nyid de ldog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOther than another‚Äù means other than another, that is, the opposite.

original: gzhan las gzhan pa'i rgyu'am lhan @346a * //
analyzed: gzhan las gzhan pa'i rgyu'am lhan @346a * //
translated: The cause of the otherness of the other, or the cooperating conditions,

original: cig byed pa des shing la sogs pa'i dngos po'i khyad par nges te /
analyzed: cig byed pa des shing la sogs pa'i dngos po'i khyad par nges te /
translated: are the particular entities such as wood.

original: gzhan las ldog pa des zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan las ldog pa des zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúfrom another‚Äù is ‚Äúin contrast to another.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni / don gzhan la ni ldog pa yis //
analyzed: 'dis ni / don gzhan la ni ldog pa yis //
translated: This is because:

original: khyad par can zhes bya ba yi //üîΩtha tshig 'di la ldog pa yis //
analyzed: khyad par can zhes bya ba yi // tha tshig 'di la ldog pa yis //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdistinctive‚ÄùüîΩis ‚Äúin contrast to another object.‚Äù

original: gsum pa'i don du bshad pa yin //
analyzed: gsum pa'i don du bshad pa yin //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthird‚Äù is explained

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: by ‚Äúin contrast to this.‚Äù

original: sgra yis zhes bya ba ni ming gis so //üîΩblo la yod pa'i don gang yin pa de ni dngos su sgra dag gis brjod pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: sgra yis zhes bya ba ni ming gis so // blo la yod pa'i don gang yin pa de ni dngos su sgra dag gis brjod pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBy means of a word‚Äù means by means of a name.üîΩThe meaning that exists in the mind is actually expressed by words.

original: gang yang blo la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang blo la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúThat which is in the mind,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni sgra'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni sgra'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù means a word.

original: 'di dag gis don gzhan las ldog pa'i khyad par can nyid ji ltar sbyar bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag gis don gzhan las ldog pa'i khyad par can nyid ji ltar sbyar bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one apply the distinctive in contrast to another object?

original: 'di'i ldog pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i ldog pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBy means of its contrast,‚Äù and so on.

original: de ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúImmediately‚Äù means

original: dngos gang gzhan las gzhan pa yin //
analyzed: dngos gang gzhan las gzhan pa yin //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is real is distinct from another.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste //
translated: And so on.

original: blo la yod pa'i don de dag kyang gzhan las ldog pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo la yod pa'i don de dag kyang gzhan las ldog pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those objects that exist in the mind appear as the opposite of others.

original: gal te sgras dngos po'i cha 'ga' zhig kyang mi rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sgras dngos po'i cha 'ga' zhig kyang mi rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that a word does not understand any aspect of a thing?

original: de ji ltar slob dpon gyis don gzhan las ldog pa'i dngos po'i cha 'ga' zhig rtogs par 'gyur zhes bshad ce na /üîΩde'i phyir / don gzhan las ni ldog pa yis //
analyzed: de ji ltar slob dpon gyis don gzhan las ldog pa'i dngos po'i cha 'ga' zhig rtogs par 'gyur zhes bshad ce na / de'i phyir / don gzhan las ni ldog pa yis //
translated: How could the master say that one understands some aspect of a thing that is the opposite of another object?üîΩTherefore he says, ‚ÄúBy the exclusion of other objects . . .‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: 'on te gzugs brnyan ni blo'i chos yin pa'i phyir ji ltar dngos po'i cha nyid du 'thad ce na /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs brnyan ni blo'i chos yin pa'i phyir ji ltar dngos po'i cha nyid du 'thad ce na /
translated: But since a reflection is a property of the mind, how could it be tenable as an aspect of a thing?

original: don gzhan las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don gzhan las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBy the exclusion of other objects . . .‚Äù

original: don gzhan la ldog pa'i dngos po mthong ba rig pa'i phyir dang / don gzhan ldog pa'i dngos po de la 'khrul pas de'i bdag nyid du sgro btags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don gzhan la ldog pa'i dngos po mthong ba rig pa'i phyir dang / don gzhan ldog pa'i dngos po de la 'khrul pas de'i bdag nyid du sgro btags pa'i phyir /
translated: and so on. Because one sees the thing that is the opposite of another object, and because one is mistaken about that thing that is the opposite of another object, one superimposes its nature.

original: gzugs brnyan de nyid nye bar sgro btags nas dngos po'i cha zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de nyid nye bar sgro btags nas dngos po'i cha zhes bstan to //
translated: The image itself is designated as the aspect of the entity.

original: 'di yang don gzhan las ldog pas zhes gsungs pa'i don du sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di yang don gzhan las ldog pas zhes gsungs pa'i don du sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: And this is also applied to the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúIt is the exclusion of other objects.‚Äù

original: rgyu'i don na ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyu'i don na ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The meaning of cause is stated in the line beginning ‚ÄúThe cause is called non-deceptive.‚Äù

original: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar don gzhan las ldog pa'i khyad par brjod do zhes bya ba 'dir /üîΩdngos gang gzhan las gzhan pa yi //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar don gzhan las ldog pa'i khyad par brjod do zhes bya ba 'dir / dngos gang gzhan las gzhan pa yi //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúas before‚Äù means that, just as it was said that the exclusion of other objects is described as a distinguishing feature,üîΩso too, in this case, the cause is described as a distinguishing feature.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes byi don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes byi don to //
