translated: The meaning of the statement is that it should be applied in the same way as it was explained in the passage beginning ‚ÄúThe entity that is different from other things . . . ‚Äù

original: yang na 'di thams cad du de lta bu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid gsum pa yin no zhes ston pa ni bdag nyid des zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na 'di thams cad du de lta bu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid gsum pa yin no zhes ston pa ni bdag nyid des zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or else, the phrase ‚Äúin that way‚Äù shows that all of this has the characteristic of being a threefold exclusion.

original: 'on te don gzhan las ldog pa'i phyi rol gyi dngos po'i chos ma yin nam @346b de ji ltar gzugs brnyan rtogs pa'i rgyu'i dngos po'am /
analyzed: 'on te don gzhan las ldog pa'i phyi rol gyi dngos po'i chos ma yin nam @346b de ji ltar gzugs brnyan rtogs pa'i rgyu'i dngos po'am /
translated: But if it is not an external entity that is the exclusion of other objects, how can it be the cause of the understanding of a reflection?

original: byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur zhen /
analyzed: byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur zhen /
translated: It is a thing that is done.üîΩ

original: de'i phyir / gal te rigs mi mthun las dngos //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gal te rigs mi mthun las dngos //
translated: If it is thought that the thing is the opposite of the dissimilar class,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩIf the thing is the opposite of the dissimilar class,

original: gal te dngos po rigs mi mthun pa'i dngos po las ldog par 'gyur na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rigs mi mthun pa'i dngos po las ldog par 'gyur na de'i tshe /
translated: then at that time,

original: de ste gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de ste gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid de /
translated: it would be the nature of a reflection.

original: de bzhin te rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur na //
analyzed: de bzhin te rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid du mi 'gyur na //
translated: If it were not the nature of a thing that is the opposite of the dissimilar class,üîΩthen it would be the nature of a reflection.

original: de lta bas na don gzhan las ldog pa'i dngos po'i byed pa'i dngos po'i rig pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na don gzhan las ldog pa'i dngos po'i byed pa'i dngos po'i rig pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the thing that is the opposite of the other object is the thing that is the opposite of the dissimilar class.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo'i khyad par ni //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo'i khyad par ni //
translated: The difference in the nature of the other

original: mi 'dra'i shes pa byed pa min //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mi 'dra'i shes pa byed pa min // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: is not the cause of a dissimilar cognition.

original: ba lang min pas ldog gzhan nyid //
analyzed: ba lang min pas ldog gzhan nyid //
translated: If the thing that is the opposite of the other is the difference in the nature of the thing,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩThe difference in the nature of the otherüîΩis not the cause of a dissimilar cognition.

original: gal te gzhan las ldog pa med pa'i ngo bo dngos po'i khyad par nyid du mngon par 'dod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan las ldog pa med pa'i ngo bo dngos po'i khyad par nyid du mngon par 'dod par gyur na /
translated: If the thing that is the opposite of the other is the difference in the nature of the thing, then the thing that is the opposite of the other would be the cause of a dissimilar cognition.

original: de'i tshe sun 'byin pa 'di thams cad 'thad pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i tshe sun 'byin pa 'di thams cad 'thad pa yin na /
translated: At that time, if all of these refutations are tenable,

original: ji srid du gzhan las ldog pa dngos po'i khyad par nyid du nye bar len pa yin te /
analyzed: ji srid du gzhan las ldog pa dngos po'i khyad par nyid du nye bar len pa yin te /
translated: then for as long as the exclusion of other is taken to be a particular of an existent,

original: des na khyad par can khyad par dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi blor 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na khyad par can khyad par dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi blor 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: then the cognition of the particular and the exclusion of other will be in accordance with each other.

original: 'di ltar ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa'i pa lang du brjod pa gang yin pa de rta la sogs pa las gzhan pa nyid kyi ba lang gang yin pa ni de'i rang bzhin nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa'i pa lang du brjod pa gang yin pa de rta la sogs pa las gzhan pa nyid kyi ba lang gang yin pa ni de'i rang bzhin nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: In this way, the cow that is described as the exclusion of non-cow is the cow that is different from horse and so on. It is the nature of that cow and not something else.

original: de lta yin dang gang yang khyad par gzhan spangs pa tsam gzhan shes par 'dod pa la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang gang yang khyad par gzhan spangs pa tsam gzhan shes par 'dod pa la /
translated: If that were so, then for one who wishes to know the mere exclusion of other particulars,

original: 'di tha dad pas ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa'i ba lang zhes brjod pa de lta na yang don dam par de ba lang de'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di tha dad pas ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa'i ba lang zhes brjod pa de lta na yang don dam par de ba lang de'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa kho na yin te /
translated: even though it is said that the cow is the exclusion of non-cow due to being different from that, still ultimately it is only understood as having the nature of that cow.

original: dper na gzhan nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gzhan nyid bzhin no //
translated: This is just like difference.

original: gzhan nyid ces bya ba gzhan pa'i dngos po las gzhan ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de nyid yin te de lta ma yin na dngos po de de las gzhan du 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ces bya ba gzhan pa'i dngos po las gzhan ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de nyid yin te de lta ma yin na dngos po de de las gzhan du 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúDifference‚Äù is not different from the entity that is different; rather, it is that itself. Otherwise, that entity would not be established as different from that.

original: de ni ste de las khyad par gyi dngos po yin na yang gzhan las ldog pa ni khyad par can la dngos po ni blor 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni ste de las khyad par gyi dngos po yin na yang gzhan las ldog pa ni khyad par can la dngos po ni blor 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: And that is, that is, the entity that is the difference, but the exclusion from the other is the entity that is the basis of the difference.

original: 'di snyam du 'jig rten na khyad par can la khyad par tha mi dad par grags te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'jig rten na khyad par can la khyad par tha mi dad par grags te /
translated: If you think that in the world, the basis of the difference is known to be non-different from the difference,

original: dper na skyes bu dang dbyig pa bzhin no /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu dang dbyig pa bzhin no /
translated: for example, like a man and his stick,

original: ldog pa yang dngos po yin na /
analyzed: ldog pa yang dngos po yin na /
translated: and the exclusion is an entity,

original: des na 'di ji ltar 'di de'i khyad par du rigs snyam du sems na /
analyzed: des na 'di ji ltar 'di de'i khyad par du rigs snyam du sems na /
translated: then how could it be reasonable that this is the difference of that?

original: tha dad pa med na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tha dad pa med na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If there is no difference, etc.

original: don dam par 'ga' zhig gi khyad par 'ga' yang rigs pa ma yin @347a * //
analyzed: don dam par 'ga' zhig gi khyad par 'ga' yang rigs pa ma yin @347a * //
translated: ultimately, it is not reasonable for anything to be the difference of anything.

original: te ; phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa ni khyad par nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: te ; phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa ni khyad par nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: That which does not provide benefit becomes the difference.

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du khas len par byed pa na yang 'bras bu'i dus na rgyu mi gnas pa'i phyir dus cig car 'byung ba ma yin pa ni khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos por rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du khas len par byed pa na yang 'bras bu'i dus na rgyu mi gnas pa'i phyir dus cig car 'byung ba ma yin pa ni khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos por rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: When you accept that they are helpful, since the cause does not endure at the time of the effect, it is not logical that they are the entities of the qualifier and the qualified, since they do not occur at the same time.

original: dus cig car 'byung na yang de'i tshe bdag nyid thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dus cig car 'byung na yang de'i tshe bdag nyid thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if they did occur at the same time, since they would be complete in themselves,

original: phan tshun phan 'dogs par byed pa med pas khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po'i rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun phan 'dogs par byed pa med pas khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po'i rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not logical that they are the entities of the qualifier and the qualified, since they would not be mutually helpful.

original: de ltar na dngos po thams cad rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa nyid kyis lcags kyi thur ma dang mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po thams cad rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa nyid kyis lcags kyi thur ma dang mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since all things are just what they are, like a metal spoon,

original: 'di dag rtog pas bsre bar byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'di dag rtog pas bsre bar byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: it is only imagination that mixes them up.

original: des na gal te yang don dam par rtog pa dang de dang ldan pa tha mi dad pa de lta na yang rtags bkod pa'i tha dad pa la brten nas khyad par can dang khyad par gyi dngos por 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gal te yang don dam par rtog pa dang de dang ldan pa tha mi dad pa de lta na yang rtags bkod pa'i tha dad pa la brten nas khyad par can dang khyad par gyi dngos por 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though ultimately the conception and the one possessing it are not different, still, in dependence on the difference of the statement of the reason, there is a qualifier and a thing qualified.

original: gang yang / gang tshe gsal ba rnams sgra yi //
analyzed: gang yang / gang tshe gsal ba rnams sgra yi //
translated: Also, someone says:üîΩSince the manifest is not the object of expression,

original: brjod bya min phyir gsal bya min //
analyzed: brjod bya min phyir gsal bya min //
translated: it is not manifest.üîΩIn response to that, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la snang ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la snang ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Even though the manifest is not the object of expression,üîΩit is manifest.üîΩSince the manifest is not the object of expression, it is not manifest.

original: gsal ba rnams brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ma grub ste 'di ltar kho bo cag gis gsal ba rnams brjod par bya ba ma yin par brjod pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa bsams pa na yin gyi kun rdzob tuüîΩyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba rnams brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ma grub ste 'di ltar kho bo cag gis gsal ba rnams brjod par bya ba ma yin par brjod pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa bsams pa na yin gyi kun rdzob tuüîΩyang ma yin no //
translated: That is not established because in this way, whatever we say is not the object of expression, that is when the ultimate is considered, but not conventionally.

original: kun rdzob tu ni ma brtags na nyams dga' ba nyid kyis gsal ba rnams nyid brjod par bya ba nyid yin par grags pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni ma brtags na nyams dga' ba nyid kyis gsal ba rnams nyid brjod par bya ba nyid yin par grags pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
translated: In the relative, it is well known that the manifest, which is delightful when not examined, is what is to be expressed. Therefore, the reason is not established.

original: snang ba ni phyi rol te rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: snang ba ni phyi rol te rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The appearance is external, having the nature of particularities.

original: brtags pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa la gnas pa'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: brtags pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa la gnas pa'i snang ba'o //
translated: The imagined is the appearance that is based on the consciousness of imagination.

original: ci ste don dam par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid gtan tshigs nyid du khas len par byed na /
analyzed: ci ste don dam par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid gtan tshigs nyid du khas len par byed na /
translated: But if you accept that the reason is that it is not to be expressed ultimately,

original: de'i tshe gsal ba rnams kyi gsal bar bya ba nyid kyang don dam par mi 'dod pas de'i phyir grub pa la bsgrub pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe gsal ba rnams kyi gsal bar bya ba nyid kyang don dam par mi 'dod pas de'i phyir grub pa la bsgrub pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: then, since the manifest is not accepted as being manifest ultimately, therefore, it is the establishment of what is already established.

original: de nyid du na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid du na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To show this, he says, ‚ÄúIn reality, etc.‚ÄùüîΩWith ‚ÄúThus, etc.,‚Äù he concludes that the reason is not established.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: And also:

original: gang yang / de'i tshe spyi ni gsal bya nyid //
analyzed: gang yang / de'i tshe spyi ni gsal bya nyid //
translated: At that time, the universal is what is to be manifested.

original: de ni gsal bya'i dngos po nyid //
analyzed: de ni gsal bya'i dngos po nyid //
translated: That is the entity to be revealed.

original: ces smras pa de la yang /
analyzed: ces smras pa de la yang /
translated: In response to that, he says,

original: bsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di @347b ma grub pa dang / ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes ston pa ni spyi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di @347b ma grub pa dang / ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes ston pa ni spyi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe reason ‚Äòbecause of being the object of exclusion‚Äô is unestablished and indeterminate,‚Äù and he says, ‚ÄúThe universal . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: sel ba ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bsal ba rnams kyi sel ba bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsel ba yang dngos po nyid ma yin zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gtan tshigs gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sel ba ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bsal ba rnams kyi sel ba bstan zin pa'i phyir ro // sel ba yang dngos po nyid ma yin zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gtan tshigs gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not an exclusion‚Äù because the exclusion of the exclusions has already been explained.üîΩ‚ÄúExclusion is not an entity‚Äù because there is no valid knowledge that contradicts the probandum.

original: gang yang / med pa rnams ni gsal bya min //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /
analyzed: gang yang / med pa rnams ni gsal bya min // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la /
translated: Also, in response to the statement, ‚ÄúNon-entities are not revealed,‚Äù

original: de ltar med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúNon-entities are not revealed . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gis med pa'i ngo bo nyid dor bar bya bar 'gyur ba med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i med pa gsal bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis med pa'i ngo bo nyid dor bar bya bar 'gyur ba med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i med pa gsal bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the non-existent is not to be expressed in that way.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What, then, is it?

original: dngos po gang yin pa de bsgrub pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir med pa'i ngo bos dben par gnas pas shugs kyis med pa de gsal bar bya ba nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: dngos po gang yin pa de bsgrub pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir med pa'i ngo bos dben par gnas pas shugs kyis med pa de gsal bar bya ba nyid du 'dod do //
translated: That which is an entity is established as an entity, and because it is devoid of the nature of non-existence, the non-existence is implicitly expressed by the mere statement of the entity.

original: 'di nyid gsal por bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal por bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to make this clear,

original: gang zhig gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThat which is the non-existence of that . . .‚Äù

original: de sel ba na zhes bya ba ni med pa de nyid sel ba na dngos po nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de sel ba na zhes bya ba ni med pa de nyid sel ba na dngos po nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: When it is said that ‚Äúit is not the case that the non-existence of that is an entity,‚Äù the non-existence is not an entity.

original: 'dir gnyi ga'i phyogs la grub pa'i dpe bstan pa'i sgo nas ma nges pa nyid bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir gnyi ga'i phyogs la grub pa'i dpe bstan pa'i sgo nas ma nges pa nyid bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to remove the uncertainty that arises from the presentation of an example that is established for both parties here,

original: rang bzhin dbang phyug ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin dbang phyug ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe nature, ƒ™≈õvara . . .‚Äù

original: 'di ltar khyed cag spyod pa pa rnams kyis kyang rang bzhin dang dbang phyug dang dus la sogs pas dngos po rnams byas pa nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed cag spyod pa pa rnams kyis kyang rang bzhin dang dbang phyug dang dus la sogs pas dngos po rnams byas pa nyid du 'dod do //
translated: In this way, you proponents of action also assert that things are created by intrinsic nature, ƒ™≈õvara, time, and so on.

original: de 'gegs pa yin na yang ji ltar dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur ba bzhin du med pa bsal bar bya ban yid yin na yang dngos po nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ma nges so //
analyzed: de 'gegs pa yin na yang ji ltar dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur ba bzhin du med pa bsal bar bya ban yid yin na yang dngos po nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ma nges so //
translated: If you refute that, then just as things are not established, nonthings are also not established. Therefore your reason is not established.

original: de la med pa'i dngos po nyid ces bya ba ni ngal ba che por 'gyur zhes smras pa de yang ma nges par bstan pa 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de la med pa'i dngos po nyid ces bya ba ni ngal ba che por 'gyur zhes smras pa de yang ma nges par bstan pa 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: If you say that the statement ‚ÄúThe nonexistence of things is called nihilism‚Äù is a great deal of effort, that is also not established. This is taught by the following:

original: de'i phyir med pa'i dngos po nyid //
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa'i dngos po nyid //
translated: Therefore the nonexistence of things

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Is not tenable.

original: de ma grub na yod pa med //
analyzed: de ma grub na yod pa med //
translated: If that is not established, existence is not established.

original: med pa'ang grub pa ma yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: med pa'ang grub pa ma yin no // zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: Nonexistence is also not established.

original: de grub na yang yod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de grub na yang yod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you say that the statement ‚ÄúIf that is established, existence is not established‚Äù and so on is a great deal of effort, that is also not established. This is taught by the following:

original: dngos po med pa de ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par grub pa na med pa'i yod pa grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa de ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par grub pa na med pa'i yod pa grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: When a non-thing is established in the manner explained, the existence of non-existence is established.

original: de ni rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it abides in its own nature.

original: gang yang dngos po med pa ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas grub pa de kho na med pa'o zhes grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang dngos po med pa ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pas grub pa de kho na med pa'o zhes grub pa yin no //
translated: And whatever is established as a non-thing in the manner explained, that is established as non-existence.

original: 'di yang len gdab pa mtshungs pa'i phyir 'dir gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang len gdab pa mtshungs pa'i phyir 'dir gsal ba yin no //
translated: This is also clarified here because the response is the same.

original: @348a * // da ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du lan gdab pa'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩde la / med pa'i med pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: @348a * // da ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du lan gdab pa'i phyir bshad pa / de la / med pa'i med pa gang yin pa //
translated: Now, in order to respond in the proper sequence, it is said:üîΩAs for what was said, ‚ÄúWhatever is the non-existence of non-existence,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa /üîΩde la dngos po nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa / de la dngos po nyid du 'gyur //
translated: and so on,

original: zhes bya ba 'di mi 'dod par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di mi 'dod par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: it is not the case that this, ‚ÄúIt becomes a thing,‚Äù is not accepted.

original: 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted.

original: 'di ltar ba lang ma yin ba'i ngo bo rta la sogs pa las ba lang gi dngos po'i khyad par gyi ngo bo nyid mi 'dra bar 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar ba lang ma yin ba'i ngo bo rta la sogs pa las ba lang gi dngos po'i khyad par gyi ngo bo nyid mi 'dra bar 'dod kyi /
translated: In this way, the nature of a cow is accepted as different from the nature of a horse and so on, which is not a cow.

original: med pa'i bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa'i bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the nature of nonexistence,

original: des na dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: because in that case it would be a thing.

original: ba lang ma yin pa las kyang ba lang mi 'dra bar 'dod pa'i phyir ba lang ma yin pa lang du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba lang ma yin pa las kyang ba lang mi 'dra bar 'dod pa'i phyir ba lang ma yin pa lang du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And because it is asserted that a non-cow is not similar to a cow, it is not the case that a non-cow is a cow.

original: gang yang / med la bag chags med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang yang / med la bag chags med pa'i phyir //
translated: As for the statement, ‚ÄúBecause there are no latent predispositions in the absence of something,‚Äù

original: zhes smras pa de ni ma grub pa dang ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes smras pa de ni ma grub pa dang ma nges pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: this is unestablished and indefinite.

original: dngos med yul lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos med yul lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúThe mind does not exist in the absence of an object,‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po med pa'i yul la sems pa med do zhes bya ba 'di ma grub ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i yul la sems pa med do zhes bya ba 'di ma grub ste /
translated: The mind does not exist in the absence of an object.

original: 'di ltar sems pa ni btags pa'i gtam rgyud kyi yul dngos po med pa dngos po'i rnam par sgro btags pas 'jug pa yin te /üîΩde yang don la rigs mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma 'ongs pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems pa ni btags pa'i gtam rgyud kyi yul dngos po med pa dngos po'i rnam par sgro btags pas 'jug pa yin te / de yang don la rigs mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma 'ongs pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: This is unestablished because the mind engages in the object of a conceptual story through superimposing the form of an existent thing onto a nonexistent object.

original: mjug thogs kyi sems la bag chags 'jog pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: mjug thogs kyi sems la bag chags 'jog pa nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is the very depositing of latent propensities in the subsequent mind in order to generate a future conception that is concordant with the object.

original: gang gi phyir yang rgyud yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis sad par byed pa'i skyon bsgrubs nas rnam pa de lta bu'i sems pa skye ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang rgyud yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis sad par byed pa'i skyon bsgrubs nas rnam pa de lta bu'i sems pa skye ba yin la /
translated: Because, moreover, the awakening of the mind is produced by the power of the complete maturation of the continuum, the fault of the establishment of the awakening of the mind is refuted.

original: de sel ba rnams kyang phan tshun du tha dad pa dang yod pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa'i dbang gis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de sel ba rnams kyang phan tshun du tha dad pa dang yod pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa'i dbang gis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: And because the refutations of that also occur by the power of the realization of the different and existent natures of the refutations, there is no certainty.

original: yan lag gi don ni go sla ba'i phyir rnam par mi phye'o //üîΩgang yang / khyed kyi de yi rgyu mtshan can //
analyzed: yan lag gi don ni go sla ba'i phyir rnam par mi phye'o // gang yang / khyed kyi de yi rgyu mtshan can //
translated: The subsidiary meaning is easy to understand, so it is not distinguished.

original: sgra yi dbye bas rnyed ma yin //üîΩzhes smras pa de la /
analyzed: sgra yi dbye bas rnyed ma yin // zhes smras pa de la /
translated: Also, the statement, ‚ÄúThe reason for that is not found by the division of sound,‚Äù

original: ci 'dra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci 'dra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: is addressed by ‚ÄúWhat kind of . . . ?‚Äù and so on.

original: ci 'dra'i zhes bya ba'i gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: ci 'dra'i zhes bya ba'i gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid de /
translated: What kind of is the nature of a reflection?

original: de yang gzugs brnyan gzhan las tha dad par gsal bar rab tu rig par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir rgyas par smras pa gang yin pa de thams cad 'brel pa med pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //üîΩsel dag go bya go byed min //
analyzed: de yang gzugs brnyan gzhan las tha dad par gsal bar rab tu rig par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir rgyas par smras pa gang yin pa de thams cad 'brel pa med pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no // sel dag go bya go byed min //
translated: Moreover, since the reflection is clearly and distinctly known to be different from the other, therefore, all that has been extensively stated is irrelevant.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la lan 'debs pa ni dngos po nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩgal te dngos po med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la lan 'debs pa ni dngos po nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // gal te dngos po med pa'i phyir //
translated: The reply to the syllogism, ‚ÄúBecause the reflection is not the object of the act of seeing, etc.,‚Äù is ‚ÄúBecause of the nature of things, etc.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba spyir len par byed na de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub @348b pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba spyir len par byed na de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub @348b pa yin te /
translated: If you generally accept the statement, ‚ÄúBecause of the nonexistence of things,‚Äù then the reason is unestablished.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid kyi brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i sel ba dag 'khrul pas dngos po nyid kyi brjod byar nges pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu dngos po nyid yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid kyi brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i sel ba dag 'khrul pas dngos po nyid kyi brjod byar nges pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu dngos po nyid yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Because the exclusion of the object and the exclusion of the expression, which are the nature of the reflection, are ascertained as the expressed and the expression, respectively, by error, therefore, as convention, they exist as things.

original: ci ste don dam par dngos po med pa la brten nas gtan tshigs su brjod pa de'i tshe grub pa la bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste don dam par dngos po med pa la brten nas gtan tshigs su brjod pa de'i tshe grub pa la bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: But if you say that the reason is stated in dependence on the ultimate non-existence of things, then it is the proof of what is already established.

original: kho bo cag gis don dam par brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa cung zad 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis don dam par brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa cung zad 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For we do not accept even the slightest expression of the ultimate as either the object or means of expression.

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni dam pa'i don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni dam pa'i don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To demonstrate just this, he says, ‚ÄúIn the ultimate sense, etc. ‚Äù

original: khyab par byed pa dang bral phyir //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa dang bral phyir //
translated: Because it is devoid of the pervasion.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid skad cig ma nyid yin na yang brda dang tha snyad du phyin pa'i dus su khyab par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid skad cig ma nyid yin na yang brda dang tha snyad du phyin pa'i dus su khyab par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that even if the intrinsic identity is momentary, at the time of the attainment of the conventional and nominal, there is no pervasion.

original: 'di snyam du kho bo cag de kho na nyid kyi brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dngos po 'gog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du kho bo cag de kho na nyid kyi brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dngos po 'gog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: You might think, ‚ÄúWe do not refute the reality of the object and means of expression of reality.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: sel ba dag gis te /
analyzed: sel ba dag gis te /
translated: We refute the exclusion of that.

original: de kho na nyid du dngos po med pa la brten nas sel ba dag ni kun rdzob nyid kyis go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa 'gegs kyi yang dag pa pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du dngos po med pa la brten nas sel ba dag ni kun rdzob nyid kyis go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa 'gegs kyi yang dag pa pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The refutation of the object of refutation and the means of refutation, which are based on the nonexistence of things in reality, is a refutation of the object of refutation and the means of refutation as conventional, not as ultimate.

original: des na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin la /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the reason is not unestablished.

original: dam bca' ba grub pa la bsgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dam bca' ba grub pa la bsgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is there the fault of proving what is already established.

original: gnyi ga yang kun rdzob dang de kho na nyid la brten na skyon 'di gnyis su 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang kun rdzob dang de kho na nyid la brten na skyon 'di gnyis su 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If both are based on the conventional and reality, then these two faults would occur.

original: de'i phyir de ni go bya go byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni go bya go byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe object of refutation and the means of refutation are not established in reality.‚Äù

original: de ltar yin na gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no //üîΩrtogs pas sbyar ba'i don rgyal po dkar chen la sogs pa dang / de rjod par byed pa'i sgra dag la /
analyzed: de ltar yin na gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no // rtogs pas sbyar ba'i don rgyal po dkar chen la sogs pa dang / de rjod par byed pa'i sgra dag la /
translated: If that were so, the reason would be indefinite.üîΩThe meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe object of refutation and the means of refutation are not established in reality‚Äù is this.

original: don dam par dngos po nyid med na yang kun rdzob tu brjod bya dang rjod byed du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po nyid med na yang kun rdzob tu brjod bya dang rjod byed du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the object of refutation and the means of refutation do not exist ultimately, they are seen as the object of refutation and the means of refutation conventionally.

original: de ston pa ni rtogs pas sbyar ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ston pa ni rtogs pas sbyar ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The teacher demonstrates this with ‚ÄúThe application of the realized‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di snyam du rgyal po dkar chen la sogs pa de la yang don dam spyi'i brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rgyal po dkar chen la sogs pa de la yang don dam spyi'i brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: You might think, ‚ÄúIn the case of King MahƒÅpƒÅla and so on, the object and the expression of the ultimate do exist.

original: des na de dag gis 'khrul pa ma yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: des na de dag gis 'khrul pa ma yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that they are mistaken.‚Äù

original: de dag brjod bya'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag brjod bya'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To anticipate this qualm, he says, ‚ÄúTheir object and expression‚Äù and so on.

original: spyi ni spyi rtag par rgyas par bkag zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi ni spyi rtag par rgyas par bkag zin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the permanence of universals has already been extensively refuted,

original: de dag la brjod par bya ba'am rjod par byed pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag la brjod par bya ba'am rjod par byed pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not the case that the reason is not established because the object and expression do not exist for them.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni spyi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni spyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTheir‚Äù refers to universals.

original: rjod byed ces bya ba 'dir yang spyi zhes rnal ma dang spyar ro //üîΩ'di snyam du gal te @349a * //
analyzed: rjod byed ces bya ba 'dir yang spyi zhes rnal ma dang spyar ro // 'di snyam du gal te @349a * //
translated: ‚ÄúExpression‚Äù should be connected with ‚Äúuniversals‚Äù in the natural order.üîΩYou might think, ‚ÄúEven though the object of expression is not a thing,

original: yang de la dngos por gyur pa'i brjod bya med mod /
analyzed: yang de la dngos por gyur pa'i brjod bya med mod /
translated: the expression is a thing.

original: rjod par byed pa ni dkar chen la sogs pa'i sgra rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa nyid do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa ni dkar chen la sogs pa'i sgra rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa nyid do snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that the sound of a great drum, etc., is the intrinsic identity of the expression,

original: de'i phyir sgra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says ‚ÄúSound is not the expression,‚Äù etc.

original: dngos po thams cad la khyab pa'i skad cig ma 'jig pa bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad la khyab pa'i skad cig ma 'jig pa bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it has already been established that momentariness is the destruction of all things,

original: sgra rang gi mtshan nyid rjod par byed pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra rang gi mtshan nyid rjod par byed pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not logical that sound is the intrinsic identity of the expression.

original: skad cig 'jig pa nyid kyis de la brda byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad kyi dus su rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: skad cig 'jig pa nyid kyis de la brda byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad kyi dus su rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: Because of the momentariness of destruction, it is impossible for it to be the expression, and because it does not continue at the time of the convention, this has already been explained.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù and so on concludes this.

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba'i brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'o//
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba'i brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'o//
translated: ‚Äú Those two‚Äù are the expression and the object of expression.

original: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni shes pa rnam pa med par khas len na yang /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni shes pa rnam pa med par khas len na yang /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúreflections, etc.‚Äù is used because even if you accept that consciousness is without aspects,

original: rnam par shes pa don med pa la don du zhen pa'i ngo bo nyid rang la yod pa'i nges pa gzhan cung zad cig gdon mi za bar khas blang par bya dgos so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa don med pa la don du zhen pa'i ngo bo nyid rang la yod pa'i nges pa gzhan cung zad cig gdon mi za bar khas blang par bya dgos so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that one must definitely accept that consciousness has the nature of the conception of meaninglessness as meaning.

original: de dag rnams la zhes bya ba ni rtog pas bkod pa'i don dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag rnams la zhes bya ba ni rtog pas bkod pa'i don dag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the objects that are posited by thought.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ram de'i gtan tshigs 'khrul pa nyid ni de'i 'khrul pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ram de'i gtan tshigs 'khrul pa nyid ni de'i 'khrul pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù The error of that is the error of that.

original: gang zhig bsgrub pa'i ngo bo yang sgra'i don du khas mi len zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: gang zhig bsgrub pa'i ngo bo yang sgra'i don du khas mi len zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should not accept that the nature of the probandum is the meaning of the word‚Äù means the following.

original: sgrub pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of the probandum‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi mi 'dod par thal bar sgrub pa 'di byed pa kho bo cag thams cad kyis thams cad du sgrub pa'i ngo bo sgra'i don du khas mi len pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi mi 'dod par thal bar sgrub pa 'di byed pa kho bo cag thams cad kyis thams cad du sgrub pa'i ngo bo sgra'i don du khas mi len pa ni ma yin no //
translated: We do not accept that the nature of the probandum is the meaning of the word in all cases, in which case it would follow that we do not accept it.

original: gang gi phyir sgra las don nges pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir kun rdzob tu sgrub pa'i ngo bo sgra'i don du mngon par 'dod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra las don nges pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir kun rdzob tu sgrub pa'i ngo bo sgra'i don du mngon par 'dod pa nyid yin la /
translated: Because the meaning of a word is accepted as the nature of the probandum in the conventional sense, since a cognition arises that ascertains the meaning from the word.

original: de kho na nyid du ni sgra rnams la brjod par bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi sgrub pa'i ngo bo 'gegs pa yin gyi sgrub pa'i ngo bo sgra'i don du 'dod pa'i phyir //üîΩkun rdzob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du ni sgra rnams la brjod par bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi sgrub pa'i ngo bo 'gegs pa yin gyi sgrub pa'i ngo bo sgra'i don du 'dod pa'i phyir // kun rdzob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But in reality, since the words do not have the slightest thing to express, the nature of the probandum is refuted. It is not the conventional sense, because the nature of the probandum is accepted as the meaning of the word.

original: rang don brjod na ste sgrub pa'i ngo bo yin /
analyzed: rang don brjod na ste sgrub pa'i ngo bo yin /
translated: If one expresses one‚Äôs own meaning, that is, the nature of the probandum,

original: gzhan las ldog pa shugs kyis rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan las ldog pa shugs kyis rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: the exclusion of other is understood implicitly.

original: sgrub pa sngon du 'gro ba'i ldog pa ni rigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa sngon du 'gro ba'i ldog pa ni rigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the exclusion that precedes the probandum is reasonable.

original: gal te 'di snyam du sgrub pa'i ngo bo sgra'i don du khas len par byed na /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du sgrub pa'i ngo bo sgra'i don du khas len par byed na /
translated: If one accepts the nature of the probandum as the meaning of the word,

original: 'o na gtan tshigs kyi sgor mtshan nyid mdzad pa sgrub pa mi srid do zhes bstan pa de ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gtan tshigs kyi sgor mtshan nyid mdzad pa sgrub pa mi srid do zhes bstan pa de ci ltar zhe na /
translated: then how is it that the definition of the gateway of reasoning, ‚ÄúThe probandum is impossible,‚Äù is taught?

original: de'i phyir / spyi la sogs pa mi srid phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir / spyi la sogs pa mi srid phyir //
translated: Therefore, it says,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because universals and so forth are impossible,üîΩHere,

original: don dam par spyi dang rang gi mtshan @349b nyid la sogs pa'i brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par spyi dang rang gi mtshan @349b nyid la sogs pa'i brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: because the objects of expression, such as universals and intrinsic identity, are ultimately impossible,

original: sgra rnams dang rnam par rtog pa rnams dngos su ste /
analyzed: sgra rnams dang rnam par rtog pa rnams dngos su ste /
translated: the terms and the conceptualizations are actually,

original: don dam par yul med pa nyid kyi phyir don dam pa la brten nas slob dpon gyis sgrub pa mi srid par bstan to zhes bya ba mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: don dam par yul med pa nyid kyi phyir don dam pa la brten nas slob dpon gyis sgrub pa mi srid par bstan to zhes bya ba mi 'gal lo //
translated: ultimately, devoid of objects. Therefore, the master has shown that ultimately, the establishment of terms is impossible.üîΩIf you accept mere exclusion of other

original: gal te gzhan sel ba tsam zhig / brjod bya nyid du khas len na //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gal te gzhan sel ba tsam zhig / brjod bya nyid du khas len na // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: as the object of expression,üîΩHere,

original: autpala sngon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: autpala sngon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the phrase ‚Äúblue lotus‚Äù and so forth is stated.

original: sngon po ma yin pa dang autpala ma yin pa las ldog pa'i don gyi rnam pa gcig nyid gnyi ga'i ngo bo'i gzugs brnyan autpala sngon po sgra skyed kyi med pa tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po ma yin pa dang autpala ma yin pa las ldog pa'i don gyi rnam pa gcig nyid gnyi ga'i ngo bo'i gzugs brnyan autpala sngon po sgra skyed kyi med pa tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: The form of a single object that is the opposite of nonblue and nonlotus is the reflection of the nature of both. It is not mere nonexistence of the term ‚Äúblue lotus.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhen pa'i dbang gis autpala sngon po la sogs sgra rnams kyis sna tshogs pa'i don nges pa nyid yin pas de'i ngo bor gzhi mthun pa nyid 'thad pa yin no //üîΩci ste gzhan sel ldan dngos po //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhen pa'i dbang gis autpala sngon po la sogs sgra rnams kyis sna tshogs pa'i don nges pa nyid yin pas de'i ngo bor gzhi mthun pa nyid 'thad pa yin no // ci ste gzhan sel ldan dngos po //
translated: Therefore, because of the power of attachment, the words ‚Äúblue lotus‚Äù and so on ascertain a variety of objects, and thus it is tenable that they share the same nature.üîΩIf you say that an entity that possesses an other-exclusion

original: brjod bya yin zhes rjod byed na //
analyzed: brjod bya yin zhes rjod byed na //
translated: is the expressed object,

original: zhes gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de la /
translated: then in response to that,

original: nged kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nged kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: we say the following.

original: gal te ldog pa'i dngos po la ldog pa zhes bya ba gzhan yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te ldog pa'i dngos po la ldog pa zhes bya ba gzhan yin par gyur na /
translated: If the entity of an exclusion were something other than what is called an ‚Äúexclusion,‚Äù

original: de'i tshe de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la brjod pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la brjod pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur na /
translated: then at that time the fault of the expression would ensue.

original: ci srid du kho bo cag gis gzhan las ldog pa'i dngos po las ldog pa gzhan ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang ldog pa'i dngos po nyid khyad par gzhan spangs pa tsam shes par 'dod pa la de skad du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ci srid du kho bo cag gis gzhan las ldog pa'i dngos po las ldog pa gzhan ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang ldog pa'i dngos po nyid khyad par gzhan spangs pa tsam shes par 'dod pa la de skad du brjod pa yin no //
translated: However, as long as we do not say that the entity of an exclusion is something other than an exclusion, but rather that the entity of an exclusion is merely the exclusion of another attribute, then we assert that it is the expressed object.

original: des na ji ltar gtsor rigs brjod par bya ba yin na de dang ldan ba gzhan gyi dbang gis brjod pa'i phyir der rtogs pa'i khyad par ma 'phags pas de dag dang lhan cig gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba brjod pa de
analyzed: des na ji ltar gtsor rigs brjod par bya ba yin na de dang ldan ba gzhan gyi dbang gis brjod pa'i phyir der rtogs pa'i khyad par ma 'phags pas de dag dang lhan cig gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba brjod pa de
translated: Therefore, if it is to be expressed primarily as a type of object, then it is expressed in terms of another that possesses it.  Since it is not superior in terms of the distinction of being understood as that, it follows that it does not have a common locus with those.

original: ltar sel ba'i phyogs la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: ltar sel ba'i phyogs la mi 'jug ste /
translated: This is not the case in the system of apoha.

original: gzhan sel ba dang ldan pa tha dad pa ma brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba dang ldan pa tha dad pa ma brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not expressed as a different thing that possesses an other-exclusion.

original: de ston pa ni /üîΩdes ni gzhan dbang nyes pa sogs //
analyzed: de ston pa ni / des ni gzhan dbang nyes pa sogs //
translated: The teaching of that is:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe other-dependent, etc., are faults, etc.‚Äù

original: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //üîΩblo gros bzang pos gsungs pa yis //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro // blo gros bzang pos gsungs pa yis //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThe good-minded one said‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni blo gros rnam par dag pa'i slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos gsungs pa'i gzhan sel ba'i sgra'i don la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni blo gros rnam par dag pa'i slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos gsungs pa'i gzhan sel ba'i sgra'i don la'o //
translated: means ‚Äúthe one with pure mind, the master DignƒÅga, said.‚Äù

original: 'di la rgyu smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu smras pa /
translated: Here, the reason is stated:

original: logs min phyir zhes bya ba la gzhan sel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i don te gzhan sel ba'i dngos po las logs shig pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: logs min phyir zhes bya ba la gzhan sel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i don te gzhan sel ba'i dngos po las logs shig pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not different from that, that is, the meaning of the word qualified by the definition of other-exclusion, because it is not different from the thing that is other-exclusion.

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that it is not different.

original: ji ltar gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa mi 'gal ba de ltar bstan pa'i @350a * //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa mi 'gal ba de ltar bstan pa'i @350a * //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the existence of a common locus and so forth are not contradictory,

original: phyir ; sngon po'i sgra sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyir ; sngon po'i sgra sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says ‚Äúthe word blue‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'di ltar sngon po zhes brjod pa na ser po la sogs pa las ldog pa'i dngos por nges pa'i bung ba dang khu byug dang mig sman la sogs pa la the tshom za bzhin pa'i ngo bo'i rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan skye la de yang autpala'i sgras
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po zhes brjod pa na ser po la sogs pa las ldog pa'i dngos por nges pa'i bung ba dang khu byug dang mig sman la sogs pa la the tshom za bzhin pa'i ngo bo'i rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan skye la de yang autpala'i sgras
translated: Thus, when one says ‚Äúblue,‚Äù a conceptual reflection arises in the form of a doubt that is uncertain about the nature of things that are ascertained as entities that are the opposite of yellow and so forth, such as a bee, a cuckoo, eye medicine, and so forth.üîΩAnd that is produced by the word ‚Äúlotus.‚Äù

original: khu byug la sogs pa las rnam par bcad nas autpala ma yin pa las ldog pa'i yul can du rnam par 'jog pa ni nges pa'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: khu byug la sogs pa las rnam par bcad nas autpala ma yin pa las ldog pa'i yul can du rnam par 'jog pa ni nges pa'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Having excluded the cuckoo and so on, it is posited as the subject that is the opposite of non-lotus. This is understood to be the nature of ascertainment.

original: des na phan tshun du ji skad du bshad pa'i blo'i gzugs brnyan la ltos nas rnam par gcad par bya ba dang gcod par byed pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir sngon po dang autpala'i sgra dag khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos por mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: des na phan tshun du ji skad du bshad pa'i blo'i gzugs brnyan la ltos nas rnam par gcad par bya ba dang gcod par byed pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir sngon po dang autpala'i sgra dag khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos por mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, in relation to the mental images explained in terms of each other, there is no contradiction in the terms blue and lotus being the basis of the relationship of qualifier and qualificand, because they are the object and subject of exclusion.

original: gnyi gas kyang sngon po ma yin pa dang autpala ma yin pa las ldog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid kyis dngos po gcig ston par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyi gas kyang sngon po ma yin pa dang autpala ma yin pa las ldog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi bdag nyid kyis dngos po gcig ston par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because both of them indicate a single entity in the form of an image that is the opposite of non-blue and non-lotus,

original: don gcig la 'jug pa nyid kyi gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //
analyzed: don gcig la 'jug pa nyid kyi gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don to //
translated: they become a common locus of engaging in the same object. This is the general meaning.

original: yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag gi don brjod par bya ste /
translated: The subsidiary meaning should be stated.

original: yid gnyis kyi zhes bya ba ni gnas pa mi rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: yid gnyis kyi zhes bya ba ni gnas pa mi rnyed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDoubt‚Äù means not finding a basis.

original: the tshom gyi ngo bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: the tshom gyi ngo bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: the nature of doubt.

original: snyan sgrogs zhes bya ba ni khu byug gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: snyan sgrogs zhes bya ba ni khu byug gi rnam grangs so //
translated: ‚ÄúCooing‚Äù is a synonym for the cuckoo.

original: lhag ma ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is easily understood.

original: 'di snyam du kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa mi 'gal ba kho na'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du kho bo cag gi phyogs la yang gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa mi 'gal ba kho na'o snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that in our system, too, there is no contradiction in the common locus, etc.,

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi phyogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi phyogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the verse says ‚Äúin the other‚Äôs system,‚Äù etc.

original: rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExposition‚Äù means the exposition of the common locus, etc.

original: ji ltar 'thad par dka' zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'thad par dka' zhe na /
translated: How is it difficult to maintain?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse says ‚Äúthus,‚Äù etc.

original: sgrub pa sgra'i don yin par smra ba'i phyogs la sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra gcig nyid kyis autpala sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid brjod pa na /
analyzed: sgrub pa sgra'i don yin par smra ba'i phyogs la sngon po la sogs pa'i sgra gcig nyid kyis autpala sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid brjod pa na /
translated: In the system that maintains that the meaning of the word is the proof, when a single word such as ‚Äúblue‚Äù expresses the intrinsic identity of the lotus, etc.,

original: ci autpala yin nam 'on te mig sman yin zhes bya ba de lta bu khyad par gzhan la mi shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci autpala yin nam 'on te mig sman yin zhes bya ba de lta bu khyad par gzhan la mi shes par 'gyur te /
translated: It would be like saying, Is it a blue lotus or is it eye medicine? One would not know any other difference.

original: dngos po de'i bdag nyid thams cad kyis bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po de'i bdag nyid thams cad kyis bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of that thing is taught in its entirety.

original: gcig la gcig gi tshe rtog pa po gcig la ltos nas shes pa dang mi shes pa nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la gcig gi tshe rtog pa po gcig la ltos nas shes pa dang mi shes pa nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for one thing to be both known and unknown in relation to a single cognizer.

original: de ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching on that is:

original: ci phyir ldog gzhan la blo med //
analyzed: ci phyir ldog gzhan la blo med //
translated: Why is there no cognition of another exclusion?

original: ces bya ba la blo med pa ni mi shes pa'am /
analyzed: ces bya ba la blo med pa ni mi shes pa'am /
translated: Here, no cognition means not knowing or

original: blo gros dman pa'i blo med pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros dman pa'i blo med pa ste /
translated: no cognition of a lesser intellect,

original: the tshom dang phyin ci log ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: the tshom dang phyin ci log ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: which means doubt and error.

original: de lta yin dang the tshom dang phyin ci @350b log med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta yin dang the tshom dang phyin ci @350b log med pa'i phyir /
translated: If that were the case, because there would be no doubt and error,

original: autpala la sogs pa'i sgra gzhan la sbyor ba pos sbyor bar 'dod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ston pa ni /
analyzed: autpala la sogs pa'i sgra gzhan la sbyor ba pos sbyor bar 'dod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ston pa ni /
translated: one who applies the term blue lotus and so on would not wish to apply it to another. The teaching on that is:

original: gang gi don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: For what purpose?

original: gang gi don du zhes bya ba ni blo med pa gang zhig bzlog pa'i don du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi don du zhes bya ba ni blo med pa gang zhig bzlog pa'i don du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúFor the sake of which‚Äù means ‚Äúfor the sake of which there is no cognition, which is to be refuted.‚Äù

original: ci ste yang dngos po de phyogs gcig gis brjod kyi bdag nyid thams cad kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste yang dngos po de phyogs gcig gis brjod kyi bdag nyid thams cad kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But if that entity is expressed by one part, not by the whole,

original: des na rang bzhin gzhan brjod pa'i phyir sgra gzhan brtsal bar bya ba nyid yin no snyam na /
analyzed: des na rang bzhin gzhan brjod pa'i phyir sgra gzhan brtsal bar bya ba nyid yin no snyam na /
translated: then in order to express another nature, another word would have to be sought.üîΩThus, in response to that, it is said:

original: de'i phyir gal te rnam kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te rnam kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it is expressed in all ways,üîΩthen it is not one.

original: gang gis phyogs gcig brjod par 'gyur ba dngos po gcig la phyogs gcig yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis phyogs gcig brjod par 'gyur ba dngos po gcig la phyogs gcig yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In one entity, there is no one part that is expressed and another part that is not expressed.

original: gcig nyid dang du ma nyid dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid dang du ma nyid dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because singularity and multiplicity are characteristics that exclude each other.

original: de lta yin dang khyed kyi dngos po phyogs gcig pa ji snyed pa de snyed bstan pa kho nar zad pas gcig du mar 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang khyed kyi dngos po phyogs gcig pa ji snyed pa de snyed bstan pa kho nar zad pas gcig du mar 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, then as many one-sided entities as there are, that many would have to be taught, and singularity and multiplicity would not be established.

original: 'di snyam du sngon po'i sgras rdzas brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du sngon po'i sgras rdzas brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: One might think as follows: The word ‚Äúblue‚Äù does not express a substance.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩsngon po zhes bya ba'i yon tan nam /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / sngon po zhes bya ba'i yon tan nam /
translated: What does it express?

original: de dang 'du ba'i sngon po nyid kyi rigs yin la /
analyzed: de dang 'du ba'i sngon po nyid kyi rigs yin la /
translated: It expresses the quality called ‚Äúblueness‚Äù or the universal of blueness, which is the inherence cause of the color blue.

original: autpala'i sgras kyang autpala nyid kyi rigs kho na brjod kyi rdzas ni ma yin no //üîΩdes na don tha dad pa brjod pa'i phyir /üîΩautpala la sogs pa'i sgra gzhan 'dod par rigs nyid do snyam du sems na //
analyzed: autpala'i sgras kyang autpala nyid kyi rigs kho na brjod kyi rdzas ni ma yin no // des na don tha dad pa brjod pa'i phyir / autpala la sogs pa'i sgra gzhan 'dod par rigs nyid do snyam du sems na //
translated: The word ‚Äúlotus‚Äù also expresses only the universal of lotusness, not a substance.üîΩTherefore, because it expresses a different object, it is reasonable to accept that the words ‚Äúlotus‚Äù and so on express universals.

original: autpala rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: autpala rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond to this, the root text says, ‚ÄúThe word ‚Äòlotus‚Äô . . . ‚Äù

original: autpala rigs gzhan zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan yang yin la autpala'i rigs kyang yin no zhes bsdu'o //
analyzed: autpala rigs gzhan zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhan yang yin la autpala'i rigs kyang yin no zhes bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe universal of lotusness‚Äù is a bahuvrƒ´hi compound, meaning ‚Äúthat of which the universal is lotusness.‚Äù

original: des na zhes bya ba ni nges par bya'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni nges par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù is for emphasis.

original: autpala'i sgra las zhes bya ba lnga pa'i sgra can no //
analyzed: autpala'i sgra las zhes bya ba lnga pa'i sgra can no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom the word ‚Äòlotus‚Äô‚Äù has the fifth case ending.

original: phyogs 'di la gzhi mthun pa mi 'thad pa ches bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: phyogs 'di la gzhi mthun pa mi 'thad pa ches bsal ba yin te /
translated: In this context, it is very clear that a common locus is untenable.

original: ba ku la dang autpala'i sgra dag bzhin du don gcig la sngon po dang autpala'i sgra dag 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba ku la dang autpala'i sgra dag bzhin du don gcig la sngon po dang autpala'i sgra dag 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the terms ‚Äúblue‚Äù and ‚Äúlotus‚Äù do not apply to the same object, like the terms ‚Äúbakula‚Äù and ‚Äúlotus.‚Äù

original: autpala ba ku la zhes bya bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: autpala ba ku la zhes bya bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not called a ‚Äúbakula lotus.‚Äù

original: 'di snyam du gal te yang sngon po'i sgras rigs dang yon tan dang bye brag rjod par byed pa de lta na yang de'i sgo nas sngon po'i yon tan dang de'i rigs dag dang 'brel pa'i rdzas kyang des brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te yang sngon po'i sgras rigs dang yon tan dang bye brag rjod par byed pa de lta na yang de'i sgo nas sngon po'i yon tan dang de'i rigs dag dang 'brel pa'i rdzas kyang des brjod pa yin la /
translated: ‚Äú If the term ‚Äòblue‚Äô expresses a type, a quality, and a particular, then by that the substance that is related to the quality of blue and its type is also expressed.

original: de bzhin du de autpala'i sgras kyang rigs kyi sgo nas rdzas de nyid brjod pa yin pas des na de dag don gcig la 'jug pa srid pa'i phyir gzhi mthun par 'gyur bas ba ku la dang autpala'i sgra dag ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de bzhin du de autpala'i sgras kyang rigs kyi sgo nas rdzas de nyid brjod pa yin pas des na de dag don gcig la 'jug pa srid pa'i phyir gzhi mthun par 'gyur bas ba ku la dang autpala'i sgra dag ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: And likewise, by the term ‚Äòlotus‚Äô that very substance is expressed by way of its type. Therefore, since it is possible for those to apply to the same object, there is a common locus, unlike the terms ‚Äòbakula‚Äô and ‚Äòlotus.‚Äô ‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you think that,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúIf the term ‚Äòblue‚Äô expresses a type, a quality, and a particular, then by that the substance that is related to the quality of blue and its type is also expressed.

original: @351a * // sngon po zhes bya ba'i yon tan yang yin la sngon po nyid ces bya ba'i rigs kyang yin pas yon tan de'i rigs te /
analyzed: @351a * // sngon po zhes bya ba'i yon tan yang yin la sngon po nyid ces bya ba'i rigs kyang yin pas yon tan de'i rigs te /
translated: Since blue is a quality and also a type of blue, it is the type of that quality.

original: de dag dang 'brel ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro /
analyzed: de dag dang 'brel ba zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro /
translated: The phrase connected with those is to be supplied.üîΩThe term lotus would be meaningless means that substance is indicated by the term blue itself.üîΩThis is demonstrated by the statement, ...because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance.

original: autpala sgra don med par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rdzas de sngon po'i sgra nyid kyis bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di nyid ston pa ni /üîΩgang nyid de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: autpala sgra don med par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rdzas de sngon po'i sgra nyid kyis bstan pa'i phyir ro // 'di nyid ston pa ni / gang nyid de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.üîΩThe phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni yon tan dang de'i rigs dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni yon tan dang de'i rigs dag go //
translated: The phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.üîΩThe phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.üîΩThe phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.üîΩThe phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.üîΩThe phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.

original: 'di snyam du gal te yang sngon po'i sgra yon tan de'i rigs dang ldan pa'i rdzas brjod pa de lta na yang sngon po de don gcig la 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir rtog pa bo'i blo autpala'i don la nges pa'i ngo bor skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te yang sngon po'i sgra yon tan de'i rigs dang ldan pa'i rdzas brjod pa de lta na yang sngon po de don gcig la 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir rtog pa bo'i blo autpala'i don la nges pa'i ngo bor skye ba ma yin te /
translated: The phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.

original: khu byug la sogs pa yang sngon po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khu byug la sogs pa yang sngon po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.üîΩThe phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.üîΩThe phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.üîΩThe phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.üîΩThe phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.üîΩThe phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.üîΩThe phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.üîΩThe phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.üîΩThe phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.üîΩThe phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.üîΩThe phrase because the word 'blue' is applied to that substance is to be supplied.

original: de'i phyir don gzhan du the tshom zab bcad pa'i don du autpala'i sgra sbyor ba don dang bcas ba kho na'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de'i phyir don gzhan du the tshom zab bcad pa'i don du autpala'i sgra sbyor ba don dang bcas ba kho na'o snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, the term utpala is meaningful only in the sense of eliminating doubt about the meaning of another term.

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: skabs kyi don mi shes pa nyid kyis brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skabs kyi don mi shes pa nyid kyis brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you have not understood the context.

original: sgra'i don sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir gsal ba gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa mi 'thad do zhes bya ba 'dir skabs yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i don sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir gsal ba gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa mi 'thad do zhes bya ba 'dir skabs yin no //
translated: The context here is that it is not tenable to have a common locus of manifestation and so on because the meaning of a word is established.

original: gal te autpala'i sgra the tshom bcad pa'i don du brjod kyi rdzas rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //üîΩ'o na sgrub pa sgra'i don du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te autpala'i sgra the tshom bcad pa'i don du brjod kyi rdzas rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ni ma yin no // 'o na sgrub pa sgra'i don du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the term utpala is used in the sense of eliminating doubt, it is not used to understand a substance.

original: autpala'i sgra 'khrul par sgro btags pa'i rnam par bcad pa tsam nyid ston bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: autpala'i sgra 'khrul par sgro btags pa'i rnam par bcad pa tsam nyid ston bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Well then, the meaning of a word would not be established because it merely teaches the exclusion of superimposition in regard to the term utpala.

original: sngon po'i sgras autpala la sogs pa'i rdzas brjod kyi /
analyzed: sngon po'i sgras autpala la sogs pa'i rdzas brjod kyi /
translated: The term blue expresses the substance of a lotus and so on.

original: yang rtogs pa po de res pa mi skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ni phan tshun 'gal ba brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang rtogs pa po de res pa mi skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ni phan tshun 'gal ba brjod pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is contradictory to say that the one who understands does not arise again.

original: gang la the tshom skye ba de ni sgra'i don du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la the tshom skye ba de ni sgra'i don du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to doubt the meaning of a word.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would lead to absurd consequences.

original: nges par yul du bya ba'i dngos po la ni the tshom gyi go skabs rnyed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nges par yul du bya ba'i dngos po la ni the tshom gyi go skabs rnyed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there an opportunity for doubt to arise with regard to a thing that is being perceived,

original: nges pa dang sgro 'dogs pa'i yid ni gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa dang sgro 'dogs pa'i yid ni gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind that is certain and the mind that doubts are mutually exclusive.

original: 'di snyam du gal te yang sngon po dang autpala'i sgra dag ni don gcig la 'jug pa med mod /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te yang sngon po dang autpala'i sgra dag ni don gcig la 'jug pa med mod /
translated: If you think that although the words ‚Äúblue‚Äù and ‚Äúlotus‚Äù do not refer to the same object,

original: de'i don yon tan dang rigs dag ni rdzas gcig la 'jug pa yod pa de'i don can 'di dag gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de'i don yon tan dang rigs dag ni rdzas gcig la 'jug pa yod pa de'i don can 'di dag gzhi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: the words ‚Äúquality‚Äù and ‚Äúsubstance‚Äù do refer to the same thing, then these words would have the same referent.

original: 'di ni mi rigs te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is unreasonable because it would lead to absurd consequences.

original: de lta na ni gzugs dang ro'i sgra dag kyang gzhi mthun par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni gzugs dang ro'i sgra dag kyang gzhi mthun par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the words form and taste would have a common locus,

original: de'i don gzugs dang ro dag ni sa la sogs pa'i rdzas gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don gzugs dang ro dag ni sa la sogs pa'i rdzas gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meanings of those words, form and taste, are included in a single substance, such as earth.

original: gzhan yang @351b autpala sngon po zhes bya ba'i don gcig gi yul can gyi blo der yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang @351b autpala sngon po zhes bya ba'i don gcig gi yul can gyi blo der yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the cognition that has a single object, a blue lotus, would not be a cognition of that,

original: rdzas gcig la 'du ba'i yon tan dang rdzas kyi rigs dag ni gnyis kyi so sor brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas gcig la 'du ba'i yon tan dang rdzas kyi rigs dag ni gnyis kyi so sor brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the qualities and the substance that are included in a single substance are expressed separately as two.

original: don gcig gi yul can gyi shes pa ma skyes pa na sgra dag gi gzhi mthun pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don gcig gi yul can gyi shes pa ma skyes pa na sgra dag gi gzhi mthun pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When a cognition that has a single object does not arise, the words do not have a common locus.

original: spros pas chog go //
analyzed: spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this elaboration!

original: 'di snyam du gang kho na sngon po'i yon tan dang de'i rigs dag dang 'brel pa'i dngos po de nyid autpala'i sgras brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang kho na sngon po'i yon tan dang de'i rigs dag dang 'brel pa'i dngos po de nyid autpala'i sgras brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If you think that the entity that is related to the quality of blue and its type is not expressed by the word lotus,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what is it?

original: gzhan nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin te /
translated: It is different.

original: des na autpala'i sgra don med par mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: des na autpala'i sgra don med par mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, the word lotus is not meaningless.

original: de'i phyir yon tan de yi rigs //
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan de yi rigs //
translated: Therefore, the quality of that is its type.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te zhen zhes bya ba 'dir bcad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te zhen zhes bya ba 'dir bcad do //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù is supplied.

original: rten ni tha dad du yang 'gyur //
analyzed: rten ni tha dad du yang 'gyur //
translated: The basis would be different.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is to say,

original: gzhi tha dad par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhi tha dad par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the basis would be different.

original: yang ci ste gal te yang rdzas de nyid sngon po'i sgras brjod cing autpala'i sgras kyang yin sngon po'i sgras ni autpala'i rigs dang 'brel pa'i ngo bor rdzas brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang ci ste gal te yang rdzas de nyid sngon po'i sgras brjod cing autpala'i sgras kyang yin sngon po'i sgras ni autpala'i rigs dang 'brel pa'i ngo bor rdzas brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But if the substance is expressed by the word ‚Äúblue‚Äù and also by the word ‚Äúlotus,‚Äù then the word ‚Äúblue‚Äù does not express the substance as having the nature of being related to the type lotus.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩsngon po'i yon tan dang de'i rigs dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / sngon po'i yon tan dang de'i rigs dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis te /
translated: What does it express?üîΩIt expresses the substance as having the nature of being related to the type of blue.

original: des ni 'di'i sngon po dang autpala nyid kyis rigs dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid brjod par 'dod nas autpala'i sgra 'jug pa na don med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di dogs pa bsu nas len 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: des ni 'di'i sngon po dang autpala nyid kyis rigs dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid brjod par 'dod nas autpala'i sgra 'jug pa na don med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di dogs pa bsu nas len 'debs pa ni /
translated: When the word ‚Äúlotus‚Äù is applied, it is not meaningless, since it is intended to express the substance as having the nature of being related to the type of blue and the type lotus.

original: ci ste sngon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci ste sngon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúThe word blue does not express the substance that is related to the nature of the quality blue and its type,‚Äù then the response is:

original: ci ste sngon po zhes bya ba'i sgra autpala nyid dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi yon tan dang de'i rigs dang 'brel pa'i rdzas mi brjod nas zhes 'brel te /
analyzed: ci ste sngon po zhes bya ba'i sgra autpala nyid dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi yon tan dang de'i rigs dang 'brel pa'i rdzas mi brjod nas zhes 'brel te /
translated: If the word blue does not express the substance that is related to the nature of the quality blue and its type,

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: then that is not correct.

original: gang gis sngon po dang de'i rigs dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid brjod pa na autpala nyid kyi rigs dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rdzas brjod par mi 'gyur ba sngon po'i yon tan dang de'i rigs dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid las autpala nyid kyi rigsüîΩdang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhan nyid ni ma yin te /
