analyzed: gang gis sngon po dang de'i rigs dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid brjod pa na autpala nyid kyi rigs dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rdzas brjod par mi 'gyur ba sngon po'i yon tan dang de'i rigs dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid las autpala nyid kyi rigs dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhan nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: When the quality blue and its type are expressed, the substance that is related to the nature of the quality blue and its type is also expressed, because the substance that is related to the nature of the quality blue and its type is not different from the substance that is related to the nature of the quality blue and its type.

original: ci tsam du rdzas gcig la 'brel pa can nyid kyis ngo bo gnyi ga yang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci tsam du rdzas gcig la 'brel pa can nyid kyis ngo bo gnyi ga yang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: To the extent that the substance is related to both natures, it is not different.

original: de bzhin du de dag kyang gcig nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du de dag kyang gcig nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, it is not logical to say that they are the same.

original: ngo bo gcig brjod pa na ngo bo gzhan ma brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo gcig brjod pa na ngo bo gzhan ma brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one nature is expressed, another nature is not expressed.

original: gzhan yang khas blangs nas kyang brjod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang khas blangs nas kyang brjod de /
translated: Moreover, it is also expressed by implication.

original: autpala nyid dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid ni sngon po dang de'i rigs dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan nyid yin du chug mod /
analyzed: autpala nyid dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid ni sngon po dang de'i rigs dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan nyid yin du chug mod /
translated: Even though the nature of the blue color and its type that is related to the lotus is different from the nature that is related to the lotus,

original: de lta na @352a * //
analyzed: de lta na @352a * //
translated: in that case,

original: yang autpala'i sgra ni don med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang autpala'i sgra ni don med pa nyid yin te /
translated: the word lotus would be meaningless.

original: 'di ltar autpala dang 'brel pa'i dngos po'i cha gang yin pa de nyid sngon po'i yon tan dang de'i rigs dag gnyi ga dang 'brel gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar autpala dang 'brel pa'i dngos po'i cha gang yin pa de nyid sngon po'i yon tan dang de'i rigs dag gnyi ga dang 'brel gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: In this way, the part of the entity that is related to the lotus is related to both the blue color and its type, but it is not related to anything else.

original: de yang cha med pa'i phyir bdag nyid thams cad kyi sngon po'i sgra nyid kyis brjod la /
analyzed: de yang cha med pa'i phyir bdag nyid thams cad kyi sngon po'i sgra nyid kyis brjod la /
translated: Moreover, because it is partless, it is expressed by the word blue in all its aspects.

original: nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi sgra las byung ba'i blos kyang yul du byas pa'i phyir gang zhig brjod pa'i don du autpala'i sgra don dang bcas par 'gyur ba 'di'i rang gi ngo bo ma brjod pa gzhan ci zhig yod //
analyzed: nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi sgra las byung ba'i blos kyang yul du byas pa'i phyir gang zhig brjod pa'i don du autpala'i sgra don dang bcas par 'gyur ba 'di'i rang gi ngo bo ma brjod pa gzhan ci zhig yod //
translated: And because the cognition that arises from the sound of the indeÔ¨Ånite self also has an object, what other thing is there whose own nature is not expressed, for which the sound of the lotus would have a meaning as a word?

original: 'od pas smras pa /
analyzed: 'od pas smras pa /
translated: ƒÄryadeva says:

original: cha med pa'i dngos po la bdag nyid thams cad kyis yul du byas kyi yul cha shas kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: cha med pa'i dngos po la bdag nyid thams cad kyis yul du byas kyi yul cha shas kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The idea that a partless thing is an object by its whole self and not by a part of its object does not occur.üîΩThis is because the word ‚Äúall‚Äù has many objects and because the word ‚Äúone‚Äù refers to a part.

original: thams cad kyi sgra ni don du ma'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dang / gcig gi sgra ni cha shas la 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di dogs pa bsu nas len 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgra ni don du ma'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dang / gcig gi sgra ni cha shas la 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di dogs pa bsu nas len 'debs pa ni /
translated: Anticipating this objection, he says,

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said that . . .

original: cha shas las grol zhes bya ba ni cha med pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cha shas las grol zhes bya ba ni cha med pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from parts‚Äù means ‚Äúpartless.‚Äù

original: ma lus cha'i rnam rtog ces bya ba ni bdag nyid thams cad kyi yul du byas kyi phyogs gcig gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu ma lus pa dang cha dag gi rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: ma lus cha'i rnam rtog ces bya ba ni bdag nyid thams cad kyi yul du byas kyi phyogs gcig gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu ma lus pa dang cha dag gi rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe conceptual thought of all and part‚Äù means that the object is taken as a whole, not as a part.üîΩThe conceptual thought of all and part

original: ma lus cha yi rnam rtog go //
analyzed: ma lus cha yi rnam rtog go //
translated: is the conceptual thought of all and part.

original: 'di ni ngag gi don yongs su ma shes nas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni ngag gi don yongs su ma shes nas brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is said without understanding the meaning of the words.üîΩFor,

original: 'di ltar ; dang po nyid du sngon po'i sgras //
analyzed: 'di ltar ; dang po nyid du sngon po'i sgras //
translated: First, by the word ‚Äúblue‚Äù

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis de bsal //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis de bsal //
translated: its whole nature is excluded.

original: zhes bya ba'i don 'di brjod par 'dod pa yin te de'i dngos po ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba nyid brjod pa yin gyi gang zhig brjod pa'i don du sngon po'i sgra sbyor bar byed pa de'i rang bzhin 'ga' zhig dor pa ni ma yin te dngos po
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don 'di brjod par 'dod pa yin te de'i dngos po ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba nyid brjod pa yin gyi gang zhig brjod pa'i don du sngon po'i sgra sbyor bar byed pa de'i rang bzhin 'ga' zhig dor pa ni ma yin te dngos po
translated: The meaning of this is that the nature of the object is stated just as it is, but not that some nature is excluded in order to state what is to be stated by the word ‚Äúblue,‚Äù because the object

original: de ni cha med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni cha med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is partless.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni tshig gi don tsam ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni tshig gi don tsam ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not just the meaning of the words.

original: de bzhin du ji ltar autpala'i sgra don med pa de ltar sgra'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang sbyor ba don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar autpala'i sgra don med pa de ltar sgra'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang sbyor ba don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, just as the word lotus is meaningless, so also the other words such as impermanent of sound would be meaningless.

original: sbyor ba yin na yang rnam grangs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yin na yang rnam grangs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Even if they were applied, they would be synonyms.üîΩLike the words tree, root, and trunk.

original: shing dang rtsa ba mthun pa la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no zhes bsgre bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shing dang rtsa ba mthun pa la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no zhes bsgre bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show this, he says,

original: rnam pa 'di dag nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag nyid kyis ni //
translated: By these very modes,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here,

original: brjod pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'o //üîΩbrjod pa zhes bya ba ni smra ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba'o // brjod pa zhes bya ba ni smra ba'o //
translated: expression means application.üîΩExpression means speech.

original: brjod na zhes bya ba ni smra ba'o //üîΩde ni / gzhan du dngos po gcig pu la //
analyzed: brjod na zhes bya ba ni smra ba'o // de ni / gzhan du dngos po gcig pu la //
translated: If expressed, means if spoken.üîΩThat is,

original: sgra'am blo gcig gis khyab na //
analyzed: sgra'am blo gcig gis khyab na //
translated: If one thing is pervaded by one word or one cognition,

original: gzhan yul ma yin de yi phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yul ma yin de yi phyir //
translated: then the other is not its object. Therefore,

original: rnam grangs @352b pa ni nyid du 'gyur //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam grangs @352b pa ni nyid du 'gyur //üîΩzhes bshad do //
translated: they would be synonyms.

original: 'di snyam du khyed kyi phyogs la yang skad cig gis brjod pa'i dngos po'i khyad par la the tshom dang phyin ci log med par thal ba dang / sgra gzhan mi 'jug par thal bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du khyed kyi phyogs la yang skad cig gis brjod pa'i dngos po'i khyad par la the tshom dang phyin ci log med par thal ba dang / sgra gzhan mi 'jug par thal bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúWhy does it follow that for you also there is no doubt and error regarding the particulars of the expressed object in an instant, and why does it follow that another sound does not occur?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúWe do not assert that the object of expression is a sound that is different from the cognition.‚Äù

original: de dag gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni sgra dang shes pa de dag gis so //
analyzed: de dag gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni sgra dang shes pa de dag gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy those two‚Äù means by those two, the sound and the cognition.

original: phyi ma zhes bya ba ni dus phyis so //
analyzed: phyi ma zhes bya ba ni dus phyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúLater‚Äù means at a later time.

original: ci ste sgra'i don du kun rdzob pa la yang ci'i phyir gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa med pa'i skyon 'di 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste sgra'i don du kun rdzob pa la yang ci'i phyir gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa med pa'i skyon 'di 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúWhy does this error of the lack of a common locus and so on not occur for the conventional object of the sound?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir sgra yis rnam rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra yis rnam rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúThe object of expression is not a sound that is different from the cognition.‚Äù

original: sngon po'i sgras ches dang por sngon po ma yin pa'i dngos po las ldog pa'i autpala la sogs pa la yid gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid kyis de dag mi spong ba phyi rol gyi ngo bor zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan skyed par byed la /üîΩyang autpala'i sgras de nyid autpala ma yin pa las ldog pa'i phyir rol gyi dngos po dang gcig gis ngo bo sgro 'dogs pa skye'o //
analyzed: sngon po'i sgras ches dang por sngon po ma yin pa'i dngos po las ldog pa'i autpala la sogs pa la yid gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid kyis de dag mi spong ba phyi rol gyi ngo bor zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan skyed par byed la / yang autpala'i sgras de nyid autpala ma yin pa las ldog pa'i phyir rol gyi dngos po dang gcig gis ngo bo sgro 'dogs pa skye'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúblue‚Äù first generates the image of a lotus, etc., which is the nature of doubt, in the sense of a negation of a non-blue entity.üîΩAnd the word ‚Äúlotus‚Äù generates the image of an external entity, in the sense of a superimposition of identity with that, in the sense of a negation of a non-lotus.

original: de'i phyir rigs pa des sngon po ma yin pa dang autpala ma yin pa las ldog pa'i phyi rol dang gcig gi ngo bor zhen pa'i 'khrul pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan skyed pa'i phyir de'i ngor byas nas kun rdzob tu gzhi mthun pa la sogs par
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs pa des sngon po ma yin pa dang autpala ma yin pa las ldog pa'i phyi rol dang gcig gi ngo bor zhen pa'i 'khrul pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan skyed pa'i phyir de'i ngor byas nas kun rdzob tu gzhi mthun pa la sogs par
translated: Therefore, by that reasoning, since it generates the image of a mistaken conceptual consciousness that conceives of an external entity as having the nature of identity with a negation of a non-blue and a negation of a non-lotus, from the perspective of that, it is correct to posit a common locus, etc., in the conventional.

original: rigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: That is the reasoning.

original: ci'i phyir don dam par mi rigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir don dam par mi rigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not correct in the ultimate?

original: dam pa'i don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dam pa'i don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the ultimate sense‚Äù and so on.

original: rtags dang grangs sogs 'brel pa ni /
analyzed: rtags dang grangs sogs 'brel pa ni /
translated: The connection between the sign and number and so on

original: sel ba la ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: sel ba la ni yod ma yin //
translated: does not exist in the case of the excluded.

original: zhes gang smras pa 'di ni /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa 'di ni /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: rtags dang grangs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtags dang grangs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The connection between the sign and number and so on

original: rtags dang grangs la sogs pa 'di dag ni dngos po'i chos nyid du ma grub ste /
analyzed: rtags dang grangs la sogs pa 'di dag ni dngos po'i chos nyid du ma grub ste /
translated: is not established as the intrinsic reality of things,

original: rang dbang can mi 'dod pas 'dod pa bkod pa'i brda tsam las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dbang can mi 'dod pas 'dod pa bkod pa'i brda tsam las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are asserted to be dependent on mere conventions that are established by desire, since they are not asserted to be autonomous.

original: bsal ba rnams la yang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgra las sel ba yang ngo //
analyzed: bsal ba rnams la yang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgra las sel ba yang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúin the case of the excluded‚Äù also refers to the excluded.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa de ni de'i chos can ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa de ni de'i chos can ma yin te /
translated: The application is as follows: Whatever does not follow and reverse the presence and absence of something is not the property of that thing,

original: me'i grang ba nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: me'i grang ba nyid bzhin no //
translated: like the coldness of fire.

original: rtags dang grangs la sogs pa gang yang dngos po'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rtags dang grangs la sogs pa gang yang dngos po'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is a non-observation of the pervader.

original: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan @353a * //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan @353a * //
translated: In order to show that this reason is not unestablished, he says:

original: pa'i phyir / mtha' ma 'gram pa dogs rnams kyis //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir / mtha' ma 'gram pa dogs rnams kyis // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The ends, sides, and corners, etc.

original: gal te rtags dngos por gtogs pa'i chos yin na de'i tshe 'gram zhes bya ba 'di dngos po gcig la 'gram pa dang / mtha' ma dang dogs zhes bya ba'i rtags gsum dang ldan pa'i sgra 'jug pas dngos po gcig ngo bo gsum du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te rtags dngos por gtogs pa'i chos yin na de'i tshe 'gram zhes bya ba 'di dngos po gcig la 'gram pa dang / mtha' ma dang dogs zhes bya ba'i rtags gsum dang ldan pa'i sgra 'jug pas dngos po gcig ngo bo gsum du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If a mark belongs to a real entity, then in the case of this so-called side, since the term is used for a single entity that has three marks, namely, side, end, and corner, it follows that a single entity would have three natures.

original: gcig la pho dang mo dang ma ning zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin gsum rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la pho dang mo dang ma ning zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin gsum rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not logical that a single entity has three natures, namely, male, female, and neuter,

original: gcig nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that singularity would be lost.

original: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yang gcig nyid ni sna tshogs thams cad gcig nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yang gcig nyid ni sna tshogs thams cad gcig nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: And if it has contradictory properties, then everything would be one.

original: de ltar yin dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩgzhan yang dngos po thams cad sgra gcig gis sam /
analyzed: de ltar yin dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ro // gzhan yang dngos po thams cad sgra gcig gis sam /
translated: And if that were so, then it would follow that things would arise and perish simultaneously.

original: sgra gzhan gyis rtags gsum ston par mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra gzhan gyis rtags gsum ston par mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because all things are seen to be indicated by one word or by another,

original: de'i yul can gyi shes pa thams cad nor bu gzi la sogs pa bzhin du khra bor snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi shes pa thams cad nor bu gzi la sogs pa bzhin du khra bor snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it follows that all consciousnesses that have them as objects would appear as variegated like a sapphire and so on.

original: yang ci ste dngos po thams cad rtags gsum dang ldan pa yin na yang ston pa po ngo bo gang zhig brjod par 'dod pa de tsam zhig brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis snang ba shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yang ci ste dngos po thams cad rtags gsum dang ldan pa yin na yang ston pa po ngo bo gang zhig brjod par 'dod pa de tsam zhig brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis snang ba shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: But if, although all things have the three marks, the consciousness that appears as the mere thing that the speaker wishes to express arises by the power of the wish to express just that much,

original: khra bor snang ba ni ma yin no snyam na /üîΩde'i phyir / brjod 'dod rjes su byed na yang //
analyzed: khra bor snang ba ni ma yin no snyam na / de'i phyir / brjod 'dod rjes su byed na yang //
translated: and not as variegated,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Even if it does conform to the wish to express,

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid yin na yang ste /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid yin na yang ste /
translated: Even if they do conform to the desire to express,

original: shes pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: shes pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: the rest is as before.

original: gal te brjod par 'dod pas gcig gi ngo bo la sems pa gcig gi ngo bor 'gyur ro zhes khas len par byed na /
analyzed: gal te brjod par 'dod pas gcig gi ngo bo la sems pa gcig gi ngo bor 'gyur ro zhes khas len par byed na /
translated: If you accept that the desire to express is one entity and the cognition is one entity,

original: de'i tshe shes pa de dag dngos po gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi yul can du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe shes pa de dag dngos po gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi yul can du mi 'gyur te /
translated: then those cognitions would not have as their object an entity that is the nature of three things,

original: de'i rnam pas stong pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul du sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pas stong pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul du sgra bzhin no //
translated: because they are empty of that aspect, like a sound is not the object of an eye consciousness.

original: de'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the power of that‚Äù means by the power of the desire to express.

original: gang yang 'di snyam du 'jig pa dang / skye ba dang gnas pa rnams la go rims bzhin du mo dang pho dang ma ning nyid du rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang 'di snyam du 'jig pa dang / skye ba dang gnas pa rnams la go rims bzhin du mo dang pho dang ma ning nyid du rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, the statement ‚ÄúThe three, destruction, arising, and enduring, are respectively established as feminine, masculine, and neuter‚Äù is illogical.

original: gal te gnas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te gnas dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúIf enduring, etc.‚Äù

original: gnas par gyur na zhes bya ba 'dir bcad do //
analyzed: gnas par gyur na zhes bya ba 'dir bcad do //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were to endure‚Äù is the conclusion.

original: gal te gnas pa la sogs pa la brten pa'i rtags rnams gnas pa ste /üîΩrtags rnam par gzhag par 'gyur na de'i tshe @353b 'gram dang lu gu rgyud la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po thams cad la rnam phar ma phye bar rtags gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gnas pa la sogs pa la brten pa'i rtags rnams gnas pa ste / rtags rnam par gzhag par 'gyur na de'i tshe @353b 'gram dang lu gu rgyud la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po thams cad la rnam phar ma phye bar rtags gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: If the signs that are based on endurance, etc. were to be the signs of endurance, etc.,

original: thams cad la 'gram la sogs pa bzhin du gnas pa la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la 'gram la sogs pa bzhin du gnas pa la sogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then, like the bank, the chain, etc., all things would be without distinction, because all of them have endurance, etc., like the bank, etc.

original: de lta ma yin na 'gram pa dang mtha' ma dang dogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang rtags gsum du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'gram pa dang mtha' ma dang dogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang rtags gsum du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, the bank, the end, the corner, etc. would not be the three signs,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no distinction.

original: de lta bas na mtshan nyid ha cang thal ba'i skyon yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mtshan nyid ha cang thal ba'i skyon yin no //
translated: Thus, the error of overextension of the definition is committed.

original: 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir yang ma khyab pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir yang ma khyab pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the pervasion is not established because of the perception of error, he says:

original: med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe non-existent, etc.‚Äù

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa'i ngo bo dag la gnas pa la sogs pa med na yang med pa dang nye bar brjod pa med pa dang gsol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra dag gis rtags gsum ston par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa'i ngo bo dag la gnas pa la sogs pa med na yang med pa dang nye bar brjod pa med pa dang gsol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra dag gis rtags gsum ston par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the case of the non-existent entity, such as the horn of an ass, etc., although there is no abiding, etc., one sees that the three marks are indicated by the words ‚Äúnon-existent,‚Äù ‚Äúnon-mention,‚Äù ‚Äúnon-supplication,‚Äù etc.

original: rtags rnam par gzhag pa ma khyab pa ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: rtags rnam par gzhag pa ma khyab pa ma yin pa yin no //
translated: The establishment of the marks is not non-pervasive.

original: 'di las kyang ma khyab pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di las kyang ma khyab pa ma yin te /
translated: This is also not non-pervasive,

original: gnas pa la sogs pa de dag nyid re re la rtags gsum dang ldan pa'i sgra 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas pa la sogs pa de dag nyid re re la rtags gsum dang ldan pa'i sgra 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: because one sees that the words are used with reference to each of those very abiding, etc., in the sense of the three marks.

original: 'di ltar skye ba ni 'byung ba la brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba ni 'byung ba la brjod do //
translated: Thus, arising is said to be origination.

original: 'jig pa na nyams pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa na nyams pa'o //
translated: Destruction is said to be cessation.

original: bdag gi rang gi ngo bo ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi rang gi ngo bo ni gnas pa'o //
translated: The intrinsic nature of the self is abiding.

original: de la skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no arising, abiding, or destruction in that,

original: ji ltar skyed pa dang 'byung ba dang skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa mo dang pho dang ma ning gi rtags kyi sgra 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar skyed pa dang 'byung ba dang skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa mo dang pho dang ma ning gi rtags kyi sgra 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: how could the words ‚Äúarising,‚Äù ‚Äúoriginating,‚Äù ‚Äúarisen,‚Äù etc., be used, as well as the words for male, female, and neuter?

original: de bzhin du 'jig pa la gnas pa dang skye ba dag med pa'i phyir ji ltar 'jig pa dang zhig pa dang nyams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra dag gis bstan par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig pa la gnas pa dang skye ba dag med pa'i phyir ji ltar 'jig pa dang zhig pa dang nyams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra dag gis bstan par 'gyur /
translated: So too, since destruction does not exist in endurance and arising, how could the terms ‚Äúdestruction,‚Äù ‚Äúdisintegration,‚Äù ‚Äúcessation,‚Äù and so on be indicated?

original: yang gi sgras ni 'jig pa zhes bya ba yang rang gi sgras ji ltar ston zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni 'jig pa zhes bya ba yang rang gi sgras ji ltar ston zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúso too‚Äù indicates that just as arising is not tenable, so too destruction is not tenable.

original: de bzhin du gnas pa la 'jig pa dang skye ba dag med pa'i phyir gnas pa dang rang bzhin la sogs pa'i sgra dag gis gnas pa de rgyu gang gis zhes brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa la 'jig pa dang skye ba dag med pa'i phyir gnas pa dang rang bzhin la sogs pa'i sgra dag gis gnas pa de rgyu gang gis zhes brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: So too, since destruction and arising do not exist in endurance, it must be said that endurance is the cause of what?

original: ci ste yang gnas pa la sogs pa 'di dag phan tshun rnam par dbye ba med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir 'di dag re re la rtags gsum dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang gnas pa la sogs pa 'di dag phan tshun rnam par dbye ba med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir 'di dag re re la rtags gsum dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if you think that since these endurance and so on are essentially inseparable, each of them must possess three characteristics,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: But if they are inseparable,

original: de'i phyir / ci ste 'di dag dbyer med pa'i //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / ci ste 'di dag dbyer med pa'i //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: How could they be the characteristics of that?

original: gal te 'di dag phan tshun du dbye ba med pa'i ngo bor gyur na de'i tshe don dam par rtags gcig kho nar 'gyur gyi rtags gsum ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag phan tshun du dbye ba med pa'i ngo bor gyur na de'i tshe don dam par rtags gcig kho nar 'gyur gyi rtags gsum ni ma yin no //
translated: If they were essentially undifferentiated from each other, then ultimately there would be only one reason, not three reasons.

original: gzhan dag na re gal te mo la sogs pa spyi dang khyad par rnams ni @354a * //üîΩba lang nyid la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ba de la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gal te mo la sogs pa spyi dang khyad par rnams ni @354a * // ba lang nyid la sogs pa bzhin no zhes zer ba de la /
translated: Others say: Gender, etc., are universals,üîΩlike cowness, etc.

original: gal te mo la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te mo la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To that, he says, ‚ÄúIf gender, etc., are universals,‚Äù etc.

original: sngar spyi brtag par spyi dang bye brag bsal zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar spyi brtag par spyi dang bye brag bsal zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because universals and particulars have already been refuted in the chapter on universals.

original: de'i ngo bo'i mo nyid la sogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo'i mo nyid la sogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the nature of femininity, etc., is impossible,

original: mtshan nyid mi srid pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi srid pa yin no //
translated: the definition is impossible.

original: gzhan yang spyi dang bye brag de dag nyid la spyi dang bye brag gzhan med na yang rigs dang yod pa dang spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mo dang pho dang ma ning gi rtags kyi sgra 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir mtshan nyid ma khyab pa ma
analyzed: gzhan yang spyi dang bye brag de dag nyid la spyi dang bye brag gzhan med na yang rigs dang yod pa dang spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mo dang pho dang ma ning gi rtags kyi sgra 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir mtshan nyid ma khyab pa ma
translated: Moreover, if those universals and particulars themselves do not have other universals and particulars, then the terms for the signs of femininity, masculinity, and neutrality, such as class, existence, and universal, are seen to be applied. Therefore the definition is not universal.

original: yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The response to this is as follows:

original: rigs dang yod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩspyi rnams la yang gzhan pa yi //üîΩspyi ni rigs ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs dang yod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // spyi rnams la yang gzhan pa yi // spyi ni rigs ba ma yin no //
translated: genus, existence, etc.üîΩA universal of universalsüîΩis not tenable.

original: zhes bya ba ni spyi med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni spyi med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of universals is a tenet.

original: 'di yang bye brag pa'i grub pa'i mtha' la brten nas brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di yang bye brag pa'i grub pa'i mtha' la brten nas brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: This is stated on the basis of the tenets of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas.

original: gang gi tshe brda sprod pa ba rnams kyi spyi la yang spyi gzhan yod do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe brda sprod pa ba rnams kyi spyi la yang spyi gzhan yod do zhes brjod do //
translated: When grammarians say that universals also have other universals,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: they say:

original: don gyi rigs ni brjod na yang //
analyzed: don gyi rigs ni brjod na yang //
translated: When a class of things is expressed,

original: thams cad rigs ni rjod byed yin //üîΩgang phyir dngos rnams bya ba yi //üîΩmtshan nyid du ni gnas pa yin //
analyzed: thams cad rigs ni rjod byed yin // gang phyir dngos rnams bya ba yi // mtshan nyid du ni gnas pa yin //
translated: all are expressed as belonging to that class.üîΩBecause things are established

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: as having the character of activity.

original: bstan bcos gzhan du mthong ba'i rigs rnam par gzhag pa'i nges pa ni brda sprod pa rnams kyis khas blang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos gzhan du mthong ba'i rigs rnam par gzhag pa'i nges pa ni brda sprod pa rnams kyis khas blang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas do not accept the presentation of universals as seen in other treatises.

original: rigs rnams ni shes pa dang brjod pa'i rjes su 'gro bar bya ba'i 'bras bus dpags pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: rigs rnams ni shes pa dang brjod pa'i rjes su 'gro bar bya ba'i 'bras bus dpags pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: The universals are the nature of that which is inferred through the effect of being the object of cognition and expression.

original: de dag la nges pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag la nges pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not at all ascertained.

original: des na ji skad du bshad pa'i 'bras bu ma mthong ba'i phyir spyi'i rten gyi rigs ni rigs mthun pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i mtshan nyid can yin te /
analyzed: des na ji skad du bshad pa'i 'bras bu ma mthong ba'i phyir spyi'i rten gyi rigs ni rigs mthun pa zhes bya ba'i sgra'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i mtshan nyid can yin te /
translated: Therefore, since the effect as it has been explained is not seen, the universal that is the basis of the general is the reason for the term ‚Äúhomogeneous.‚Äù This is the definition of action.

original: brjod pa dang shes pa'i bya bas rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brjod pa dang shes pa'i bya bas rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid can yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is defined by the action of expression and cognition.

original: spyi gsal ba yang de 'dra ba de dag gsal ba kho na yin zhes de ma thag pa'i skyon nyid yin no //
analyzed: spyi gsal ba yang de 'dra ba de dag gsal ba kho na yin zhes de ma thag pa'i skyon nyid yin no //
translated: The universal is also like that. It is only the manifestation of those. This is the fault that was just explained.

original: thun mong ba'i skyon 'di yang bshad pa /üîΩmed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thun mong ba'i skyon 'di yang bshad pa / med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This common fault is also explained.üîΩNonexistent, etc.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa dag la rigs yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa dag la rigs yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Universals do not exist for nonexistent things such as the horns of a rabbit.

original: de ni dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the qualities of real things.

original: des na de dag la med pa la sogs pa'i sgra sbyar bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de dag la med pa la sogs pa'i sgra sbyar bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the words ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù and so on cannot be applied to them.

original: de lta bas na rtags rnam par gzhag pa ni ma khyab pa can yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rtags rnam par gzhag pa ni ma khyab pa can yin no //
translated: Thus, the establishment of the reason is not inconclusive.

original: des na rtags gsum rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni 'dod pas sbyor ba'i brda tsam las byung ba nyid yin no zhes bya @354b bar grub po //
analyzed: des na rtags gsum rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni 'dod pas sbyor ba'i brda tsam las byung ba nyid yin no zhes bya @354b bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the presentation of the three reasons is merely a conventional symbol that is employed by desire.

original: grangs kyang dngos por gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa med par bstan pa'i phyir grangs kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grangs kyang dngos por gtogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa med par bstan pa'i phyir grangs kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that number is also not a universal that conforms with the presence and absence of real things, the root text states, ‚ÄúNumber is also . . .‚Äù

original: grangs kyang brda las byung ba nyid yin gyi dngos po ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: grangs kyang brda las byung ba nyid yin gyi dngos po ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Number is also a conventional symbol; it is not a real thing.

original: btsun mo rnams la sogs pa dag la dngos po tha dad pa med kyang rjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis nye bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btsun mo rnams la sogs pa dag la dngos po tha dad pa med kyang rjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis nye bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though there is no difference in the real thing, such as a queen, the number is understood in accordance with the desire to express it.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the reason is not unestablished.

original: 'di ltar mang po nyid dang gcig nyid la sogs pa'i grangs ni dngos por gtogs pa'i tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la /

analyzed: 'di snyam du 'brel pa dang / 'brel pa las sam de dang 'brel pa las 'grub pa yin te /

analyzed: brgyud pas de dha ba la sogs pa'i gsal ba khyad par du byed pa yin no //

analyzed: gang gi tshe grangs rigs dang tha mi dad pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe dngos su 'brel pa'i phyir /

analyzed: des khyad par du byed pas de'i phyir rigs dang grangs kyi khyad par can du grub po //

analyzed: gal te de lta yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed de /

original: de bas na mngon par 'dod pa'i don bstan pa na shugs kyis mi 'dod pa rnam par bcad pa rtog pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bas na mngon par 'dod pa'i don bstan pa na shugs kyis mi 'dod pa rnam par bcad pa rtog pa nyid yin te /

analyzed: gang yang / mtshed do zhes la dgag med par //

analyzed: rang gi ngo bor gnas pa yin //

analyzed: zhes smras pa de la gzhan la rang gi tshig dang 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir 'tshed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams dang chos mtshungs pa nyid du nges pa'i rgyu mtshan no //

original: sgrub pa sogs don gnyer @357a * //

analyzed: gtsang sbra gzhan sel brjod pa ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de la /

original: de'i phyir de ni dag pa gzhan med ces bya ba smos te /üîΩtshig gi don las ma rtogs pa cha med pa'i khra bo'i bdag nyid dam //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni dag pa gzhan med ces bya ba smos te /üîΩtshig gi don las ma rtogs pa cha med pa'i khra bo'i bdag nyid dam //
translated: The etc. is the and so on.üîΩThe

original: 'dres pa'i kha dog dang mtshungs pa'i ngag gi don yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i kha dog dang mtshungs pa'i ngag gi don yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is not something that exists in the same way as the color of a mixture.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa de 'dra ba ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa de 'dra ba ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The idea is that such a thing is not perceived, because it has the character of being an object of perception.

original: 'di nyid dper brjod pa'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid dper brjod pa'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make this very point clear by means of an example, he says

original: nag pa ba lang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nag pa ba lang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúA black cow,‚Äù etc.

original: ngag 'di la nag pa la sogs pa'i dngos po las don gzhan pa blo la snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ngag 'di la nag pa la sogs pa'i dngos po las don gzhan pa blo la snang ba ma yin te /
translated: In this sentence, the meaning of the words is not something that appears to the mind as something other than the things, such as ‚Äúblack,‚Äù etc.

original: nag pa la sogs pa'i don rtog pa na /
analyzed: nag pa la sogs pa'i don rtog pa na /
translated: When the meaning of ‚Äúblack,‚Äù etc., is imagined,

original: yang shugs kyis nag pa ma yin pa la sogs pa gcod pa rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang shugs kyis nag pa ma yin pa la sogs pa gcod pa rtogs pa yin no //
translated: one also understands, by implication, the exclusion of ‚Äúnon-black,‚Äù etc.

original: de lta ma yin te gal te byed pa po la sogs pa gzhan rnam par gcod par mi 'dod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gal te byed pa po la sogs pa gzhan rnam par gcod par mi 'dod par 'gyur na /
translated: Otherwise, if one did not intend to exclude other agents, etc.,

original: de'i tshe nag pa la sogs pa blangs pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nag pa la sogs pa blangs pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the mention of ‚Äúblack,‚Äù etc., would be pointless.

original: de lta yin dang 'ga' zhig la 'ga' zhig gi tha snyad med pa'i phyir 'gro ba'i ngag gi g-yo ba med par 'gyur ro //üîΩgzhan sel min pa'i sgra sogs la //
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'ga' zhig la 'ga' zhig gi tha snyad med pa'i phyir 'gro ba'i ngag gi g-yo ba med par 'gyur ro // gzhan sel min pa'i sgra sogs la //
translated: If that were so, then because some things would not have the conventions of some things, there would be no movement of speech in the world.

original: brjod bya mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod bya mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: With regard to the statement, ‚ÄúOne does not see the expressed object of words, etc. that are not other-eliminators,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba 'di la gzhan sel min pa'i sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la gzhan sel min pa'i sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúWith regard to the statement, ‚ÄòOne does not see the expressed object of words, etc. that are not other-eliminators,‚Äô etc.‚Äù

original: 'dir don dam par khyed cag gis 'dod pa'i rigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid sgra'i don sgrub pa'i ngo bo nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir don dam par khyed cag gis 'dod pa'i rigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid sgra'i don sgrub pa'i ngo bo nges pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the meaning of the word, the nature of the establishment of the definition of a class, etc., which you assert ultimately, is not ascertained.

original: rigs la sogs pa de dag sngar spyi brtag par rgyas par bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa de dag sngar spyi brtag par rgyas par bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the classes, etc. have already been extensively refuted in the examination of universals.

original: 'o na ci zhig nges par byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig nges par byed ce na /
translated: Well, what is ascertained?

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúHowever, etc.‚Äù

original: de lta na gal te sel ba'i sgra'i don 'gegs pa'i blo skye'o zhes bya ba la 'dod na 'o na @358a * //
analyzed: de lta na gal te sel ba'i sgra'i don 'gegs pa'i blo skye'o zhes bya ba la 'dod na 'o na @358a * //
translated: Thus, if you assert that the meaning of the word, the exclusion, is the production of the cognition that excludes, then

original: sel ba sgra'i don du khas blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: sel ba sgra'i don du khas blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: the exclusion should not be accepted as the meaning of the word.

original: de 'gegs pa'i phyir ro zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'gegs pa'i phyir ro zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If you say that it is in order to refute that,

original: de ni slu byed min zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni slu byed min zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not a deceiver.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni sel ba ma yin pa'i sgra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni sel ba ma yin pa'i sgra la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the words that are not the exclusion.

original: slu byed yin zhes bya ba ni mi slu bar mi byed pas na slu byed dam 'di la mi slu ba med pas slu byed do //
analyzed: slu byed yin zhes bya ba ni mi slu bar mi byed pas na slu byed dam 'di la mi slu ba med pas slu byed do //
translated: ‚Äú It is a deceiver‚Äù means that it is a deceiver because it does not make one nondeceived, or because there is no nondeception in this.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩdngos po dang 'brel pa nyams phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / dngos po dang 'brel pa nyams phyir te /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause the connection with the thing is lost.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos po dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos po dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because it is not connected with the thing that is the basis of the word,

original: sngar rigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i don dngos po bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar rigs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i don dngos po bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because the meaning of the word that has the characteristic of a universal and so on was previously refuted.

original: 'on gal te de lta na gzhan sel ba ma yin pa'i sgra la sogs ba las sel ba'i sgra'i don bkag pa la ji ltar blo skye ba yin zhe na /üîΩsgra las byung ba'i shes pa kun //
analyzed: 'on gal te de lta na gzhan sel ba ma yin pa'i sgra la sogs ba las sel ba'i sgra'i don bkag pa la ji ltar blo skye ba yin zhe na / sgra las byung ba'i shes pa kun //
translated: But if that is so, then how does the cognition of the meaning of the word exclusion arise from the words that are not the exclusion?üîΩIt is said, ‚ÄúAll cognitions that arise from words

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: are mistaken.‚Äù

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa 'ga' zhig ni ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa goms pa'i bag chags kyi mthu nyid kyis yang dag ba ma yin pa'i don mngon par zhen pa skye ba nyid kyi phyir de'i dbang gis dngos po rnams yod
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa 'ga' zhig ni ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa goms pa'i bag chags kyi mthu nyid kyis yang dag ba ma yin pa'i don mngon par zhen pa skye ba nyid kyi phyir de'i dbang gis dngos po rnams yod
translated: Some consciousnesses that arise from words are produced by the power of latent propensities of the conception of what is not as existent, due to the conception of what is not as existent.

original: pa dang med par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: pa dang med par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, things do not exist or not exist due to their power.
